translated: Those who have extinguished the asravas by obtaining the aggregates of morality, etc., which are the counteragents to the asravas, are asra-vakas.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Those who are free from the defilements of moral defilement, action, and rebirth are an-agamin.

original: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par thob pas go rims bzhin du nyes par spyod pa dang / sred pa dang / lta pa ngan pa dang / srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spyod lam dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par thob pas go rims bzhin du nyes par spyod pa dang / sred pa dang / lta pa ngan pa dang / srid pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i spyod lam dang /
translated: One is endowed with the right conduct,🔽and one is endowed with the higher knowledges,

original: mngon par shes pas rnam par brtse ba dang / lha dang 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa thos pas ;
analyzed: mngon par shes pas rnam par brtse ba dang / lha dang 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa thos pas ;
translated: and one is endowed with the hearing of the abodes of the gods and noble beings.🔽One is endowed with mastery in the sense that one has mastery over one's own world and mind, and one has mastery over the gods and noble beings.

original: de rang nyid 'jig rten gyi dang 'jig rten dang sems dbang du gyur pa gang yin pa dang / rang nyid 'ching ba thams cad dang bral zhing rang dbang thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni dbang du gyur ba'o //🔽sred pa dang ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon @8a * //
analyzed: de rang nyid 'jig rten gyi dang 'jig rten dang sems dbang du gyur pa gang yin pa dang / rang nyid 'ching ba thams cad dang bral zhing rang dbang thob pa'i phyir dbang dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni dbang du gyur ba'o // sred pa dang ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon @8a * //
translated: One is endowed with mastery in the sense that one is free from all bonds and has attained independence.

original: mongs pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mongs pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: One is endowed with mastery in the sense that one is endowed with mastery over the abandonment of afflictions and branch afflictions that are on the side of craving and ignorance.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems rnam par grol ba yin la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems rnam par grol ba yin la /
translated: Concentration and meditative attainment are mental liberation.

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes ni /
translated: The knowledge of the arhat's path is

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba yin no //🔽de ltar byas na sred pa dang ma rig pa'i phyogs rnams med pas /
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba yin no // de ltar byas na sred pa dang ma rig pa'i phyogs rnams med pas /
translated: wisdom liberation.🔽Thus, since craving and ignorance are absent,

original: go rims bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / ma rig pa'i chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / ma rig pa'i chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: they are respectively free from attachment and free from the attachment of ignorance.

original: sems dang shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba ni /
analyzed: sems dang shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba ni /
translated: Mental liberation and wisdom liberation🔽are respectively the liberation of mind and the liberation of wisdom.🔽Since they obtain that result, they are liberated from the obscurations of meditative attainment and affliction.

original: de las de thob pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas las shin tu rnam par grol bas rnam pa thams cad du gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: de las de thob pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas las shin tu rnam par grol bas rnam pa thams cad du gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: Liberated from both aspects in all ways, they are liberated in mind and

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: liberated in wisdom.

original: cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa rnams dang bdag gis smad pa dang gzhan gyis smad pa dang ngan 'gro dang 'tsho ba med pa dang chad pas gcad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams dang /🔽rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis gos pa'i 'jigs pa dang / rang gi rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa mi shes pa dang the rtsom du gyur pa dang log par shes pa'i 'jigs pa rnams med pas /
analyzed: cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa rnams dang bdag gis smad pa dang gzhan gyis smad pa dang ngan 'gro dang 'tsho ba med pa dang chad pas gcad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams dang / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis gos pa'i 'jigs pa dang / rang gi rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa mi shes pa dang the rtsom du gyur pa dang log par shes pa'i 'jigs pa rnams med pas /
translated: The term “knower of the world” is used because the Buddha is free of fear of suffering, lamentation, and so on, free of fear of self-reproach and reproach by others, free of fear of the lower realms, of lack of livelihood, of punishment, of not being praised, and of death.🔽He is free of fear of being tainted by the eight worldly concerns, such as gain and loss, and free of fear of the hindrances to his own realization, such as ignorance, doubt, and wrong understanding.

original: go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang ; 'jigs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos dang / mi shes pa'i dogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa nyid kyis cang shes pa'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang ; 'jigs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos dang / mi shes pa'i dogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa nyid kyis cang shes pa'o //
translated: He is fearless because he is free of suffering, free of fear, free of the worldly concerns, and free of the fear of ignorance.

original: rig pa gsum la sogs pa khyad par can gyi chos rtogs pa dang ldan pas gtso bo chen por gyur pa'i phyir glang po chen po'o //
analyzed: rig pa gsum la sogs pa khyad par can gyi chos rtogs pa dang ldan pas gtso bo chen por gyur pa'i phyir glang po chen po'o //
translated: He is a great elephant because he has become a great lord by possessing the realization of special qualities such as the three knowledges.

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas /🔽sdug bsngal thams cad las thar pa la sogs pa nges par bya ba rnams byas ba dang / zhar la bya ba rang gi 'dod pa la rag las pas 'jug pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa'i bya bar 'os pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas / sdug bsngal thams cad las thar pa la sogs pa nges par bya ba rnams byas ba dang / zhar la bya ba rang gi 'dod pa la rag las pas 'jug pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa'i bya bar 'os pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: He is one who has done what had to be done because he has completed morality, samadhi, and wisdom,

original: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa'o //
translated: and he has done what had to be done and what was to be done, such as liberation from all suffering, etc., and whatever else is to be done, such as the practices of the spiritual levels, etc., which are suitable to be done, since they are dependent on his own wishes.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags ba'i bden pa bzhi bo rtogs pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yongs su shes par bya ba dang / sbang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba rnams med pas khur bor ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags ba'i bden pa bzhi bo rtogs pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yongs su shes par bya ba dang / sbang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba rnams med pas khur bor ba ste /
translated: He is one who has put down his burden because he has no more to know, to abandon, to actualize, or to cultivate, since he has realized the four noble truths of suffering, etc., just as they are.

original: phung bo dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dam bcas pa dang / brtson @8b pa'i khur rnams rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa gang yin pa de dag ni khur por ba'o //
analyzed: phung bo dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dam bcas pa dang / brtson @8b pa'i khur rnams rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa gang yin pa de dag ni khur por ba'o //
translated: Those who have completely abandoned the burden of the aggregates, the burden of the defilements, the burden of vows, and the burden of striving are the ones who have laid down the burden.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa thob pa dang spangs pa dag gis phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa thob pa dang spang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi don rnam pa gnyis po dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su thob pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa thob pa dang spangs pa dag gis phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa thob pa dang spang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi don rnam pa gnyis po dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su thob pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa'o //
translated: Those who have attained the two kinds of benefit for themselves, the benefit of obtaining and abandoning through the attainment and abandonment of the knowledge and ignorance of the two kinds of benefit for themselves, and who have attained the benefit of following the Lord are the ones who have attained their own goal.

original: srid pa dang skyes bu lhan cig kun tu sbyor bar byed pa khong khro ba la sogs pa'i kun tu sbyor pa dgu po ji ltar srid pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis kun nas yongs su zad bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni srid par kun tu🔽sbyor ba yongs su bzad pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang skyes bu lhan cig kun tu sbyor bar byed pa khong khro ba la sogs pa'i kun tu sbyor pa dgu po ji ltar srid pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis kun nas yongs su zad bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni srid par kun tu🔽sbyor ba yongs su bzad pa'o //
translated: Those who have completely extinguished the nine fetters such as hostility through the noble path of existence, as far as possible, are the ones who have extinguished the fetters of existence.

original: yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par kun nas shes pas na kun shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par kun nas shes pas na kun shes pa ste /
translated: They are fully understanding because they understand completely and without error.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: They have realized reality.

original: des sems legs par rnam par grol zhing 'ching ba thams cad las shin tu rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: des sems legs par rnam par grol zhing 'ching ba thams cad las shin tu rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Those whose minds are fully liberated and completely liberated from all bonds are fully understanding, their minds are completely liberated.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i mtshan nyid kyi sems can thams cad la rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i mtshan nyid kyi sems can thams cad la rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: They are masters because they have mastery over the minds of all sentient beings, the characteristics of the nine serial steps of meditative concentration.

original: dbang yang yin la de ni dam pa'i pha rol te /
analyzed: dbang yang yin la de ni dam pa'i pha rol te /
translated: They are masters of the highest,🔽because they have attained the highest of their own kind.

original: rang gi rigs rab kyi mthar phyir pa thob ba la yang yin pas na de dag ni sems thams cad kyi dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs rab kyi mthar phyir pa thob ba la yang yin pas na de dag ni sems thams cad kyi dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are those who have reached the highest mastery over all minds.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i dge slong dang zhes thams cad la gsum pa'i mthar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i dge slong dang zhes thams cad la gsum pa'i mthar sbyar ba'o //
translated: Thus, such monks should be applied at the end of all the above.

original: kha cig ni thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: Some say all of them are arhats.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: zag pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: zag pa zad pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The destruction of the contaminants is the absence of afflictions.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni sems thams cad kyi dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma snga ma'i rgyu phyi ma phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni sems thams cad kyi dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma snga ma'i rgyu phyi ma phyi ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the mind is completely liberated through perfect knowledge, up to: he has attained the perfection of the mastery of all minds. Each subsequent one is the cause of the next.

original: skyes bu'i don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i khyad par ni brjod par mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i khyad par ni brjod par mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the purpose of a person is completely fulfilled, no other distinction should be mentioned apart from that.

original: rnam 'grel byed pa ni dgra rnams bcom pas na dgra bcom pa'o //🔽nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs bas na zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel byed pa ni dgra rnams bcom pas na dgra bcom pa'o // nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs bas na zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The commentator says: He is an arhat because he has conquered the enemies.🔽He has destroyed the contaminants because he has abandoned the obscurations of affliction.

original: yang zag pa zad par 'bad pa'i bdag nyid can gyi nyon mongs pa med pas na nyon mongs pa me pa'o //
analyzed: yang zag pa zad par 'bad pa'i bdag nyid can gyi nyon mongs pa med pas na nyon mongs pa me pa'o //
translated: He is without affliction because he is by nature diligent in destroying the contaminants.

original: de ltar na tshig 'di dag gis ni nyes pa rnams shin tu spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig 'di dag gis ni nyes pa rnams shin tu spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having described the qualities that are the characteristics of the complete abandonment of the faults,

original: da ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi @9a * //
analyzed: da ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi @9a * //
translated: now, the qualities that are the characteristics of the side of the antidotes

original: yon tan ni dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod do //
analyzed: yon tan ni dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod do //
translated: are described by “mastery” and so forth.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa khyad par can gyi yon tan mngon par sgrub par byed pa mi slob pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag dang ldan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum la phan 'dogs par nus pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don gyi khur la bcom
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa khyad par can gyi yon tan mngon par sgrub par byed pa mi slob pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag dang ldan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum la phan 'dogs par nus pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don gyi khur la bcom
translated: Because he possesses the special qualities such as the superknowledges, the meditative absorption and insight of no more learning that accomplish them, he is able to benefit the three worlds.

original: ldan 'das kyis nges par sbyar ba ni dbang du gyur pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad du sred pa dang lta ba'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol bas go rims bzhin du sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis nges par sbyar ba ni dbang du gyur pa'o // rnam pa thams cad du sred pa dang lta ba'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol bas go rims bzhin du sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: The Bhagavān is definitely applied to the burden of benefitting sentient beings.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: He is the one who has completely liberated mind and completely liberated wisdom, because he is completely liberated from the bondage of craving and views in all aspects.

original: yon po ma yin zhing drang po'i lam gyis bgrod par bya ba ji srid par 'gro bas na cang shes pa'o //
analyzed: yon po ma yin zhing drang po'i lam gyis bgrod par bya ba ji srid par 'gro bas na cang shes pa'o //
translated: It is a thoroughbred because it goes as far as it can on the path of honesty without crookedness.🔽

original: nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rnam bar rgyal ba'i phyir glang po chen po'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rnam bar rgyal ba'i phyir glang po chen po'o //
translated: He is a great elephant because he has completely conquered the battle against the defilements.

original: yang rgyal bar bya ba med pas na bya ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang rgyal bar bya ba med pas na bya ba byas pa'o //
translated: He has done what had to be done because there is nothing more to be done.

original: bya ba rnams rigs pa'i tshul gyis rdzogs par byas pas na byed pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba rnams rigs pa'i tshul gyis rdzogs par byas pas na byed pa byas pa'o //
translated: He has accomplished what had to be accomplished because he has accomplished all that has to be done in the right way.

original: yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal mi sogs pas na khur bor ba'o //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du thob par byed pas /
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal mi sogs pas na khur bor ba'o // mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du thob par byed pas /
translated: He has laid down the burden because he does not carry the suffering of rebirth.

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa'o //
translated: He has attained his own goal because he has attained Nirvana.

original: srid pa'i rgyu yang dag par bcom pas na srid pa kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu yang dag par bcom pas na srid pa kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa'o //
translated: He has exhausted the fetters of existence because he has completely destroyed the cause of existence.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis rab kyi mthar thug pas na yang dag pa'i shes bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis rab kyi mthar thug pas na yang dag pa'i shes bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: His mind is completely liberated by right knowledge because he has reached the highest point by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: khyad par can gyi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan la dbang thob pa nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi mchog tu gyur par 'gro bas na /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan la dbang thob pa nyid dang / rang gi rigs kyi mchog tu gyur par 'gro bas na /
translated: In particular, they attain mastery over the qualities of the higher perceptions and so on, and they become supreme in their own family.🔽Thus, they have gone to the culmination of all mental states.🔽The former cause is the latter.

original: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa'o zhes de kho na ltar 'grel te snga ma'i rgyu ni phyi ma phyi ma yin no mthar thug pa brjod pa la yang khyad par brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa'o zhes de kho na ltar 'grel te snga ma'i rgyu ni phyi ma phyi ma yin no mthar thug pa brjod pa la yang khyad par brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Even when the ultimate is expressed, one should not express any distinction.

original: des na mthar phyin pa med pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: des na mthar phyin pa med pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Thus, there is no fault of non-culmination.

original: chos 'dzin pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir ji skad du smos pa'i grangs kyi nang du gtogs su zin kyang /
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir ji skad du smos pa'i grangs kyi nang du gtogs su zin kyang /
translated: Because they are supreme in upholding the Dharma, they are included in the enumeration as stated.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to show that they do not possess such qualities,

original: gang zag gcig ma gtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag gcig ma gtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said that except for one person... and so on.

original: gang zag ces bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i ngo bo rtag pa ni mi 'thad pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags rnams kyis gang zhing mi rtag la /
analyzed: gang zag ces bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i ngo bo rtag pa ni mi 'thad pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags rnams kyis gang zhing mi rtag la /
translated: The term “person” is a designation for the characteristics of cause and effect, and since it is not tenable that it is permanent, having the nature of an agent and experiencer, it is filled with the propensities of virtue and nonvirtue and is impermanent.

original: de @9b lta bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'gro ba len cing 'dzin par byed ba zhes bya ba'i nges ba'i tshig gi tshul gyis na rgyun nyid kyis gang zag gcig go //
analyzed: de @9b lta bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'gro ba len cing 'dzin par byed ba zhes bya ba'i nges ba'i tshig gi tshul gyis na rgyun nyid kyis gang zag gcig go //
translated: It is a “person” in the sense that it takes up and holds a continuum that is similar to that.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar ston pa lhur len pa'i tshig phrad do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar ston pa lhur len pa'i tshig phrad do //
translated: The term “thus” is a particle that expresses the speaker’s conviction.

original: tshe 'dod par gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: tshe 'dod par gyur pas tshe dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is called “the venerable” because he is desirous of life.

original: phan pa dang bde ba dang mchod pa rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba dang mchod pa rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: He is called “Ānanda” because he is one who expresses what is beneficial, what is pleasant, and what is worshipful.

original: lung thams cad 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bsnyen bkur gyis dga' ba thob pa nyid kyis na kun dga' bo'o //
analyzed: lung thams cad 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bsnyen bkur gyis dga' ba thob pa nyid kyis na kun dga' bo'o //
translated: He is called “Ānanda” because he is one who is delighted by the acquisition of the service of the Buddha and by the retention of all the scriptures.

original: des na tshe dang ldan pa 'phags pa kun dga' bo 'di ston par mdzad pa'i dus na rgyun du zhugs pa yin pas 'di skad brjod pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: des na tshe dang ldan pa 'phags pa kun dga' bo 'di ston par mdzad pa'i dus na rgyun du zhugs pa yin pas 'di skad brjod pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pas /
translated: Therefore, when the Teacher was teaching, the venerable arya Ananda was a stream enterer and did not possess the qualities of one who recites this sutra.

original: gang zag gcig po 'di ma gtogs te bzhag nas zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gcig po 'di ma gtogs te bzhag nas zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is the one person who is excluded and set aside.

original: bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rang la phan par 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bying yis brlabs kyis thams cad 'byor pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rang la phan par 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bying yis brlabs kyis thams cad 'byor pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has completed his activities, he desires to benefit himself, and he is empowered by the transcendent state of the tathagatas, he is endowed with all prosperity.🔽The five faults, lack of prosperity,

original: nyes dmigs lnga dang ma 'byor dang // mig dga' chags dang yid mi bde //
analyzed: nyes dmigs lnga dang ma 'byor dang // mig dga' chags dang yid mi bde //
translated: joyful eyes, attachment, mental dissatisfaction,

original: 'thab dag rnyed sogs sred dang mdza' //
analyzed: 'thab dag rnyed sogs sred dang mdza' //
translated: quarreling, craving for gain, and so on,🔽love, respect for the guru,

original: brtse dang bla ma la gus dang // to mtshar khyad par don phyir dang // lhung dang dkon mchog rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: brtse dang bla ma la gus dang // to mtshar khyad par don phyir dang // lhung dang dkon mchog rgyu dang ni //
translated: wonder, distinction, for the sake of the meaning,🔽falling, cause of the three jewels,

original: mchod rten la sogs phyag bya'i phyir //
analyzed: mchod rten la sogs phyag bya'i phyir //
translated: and for the sake of prostrating to stupas and so on,

original: dge slong rgyu bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: dge slong rgyu bar byed pa yin //
translated: the monk should wander.

original: zhes bya ba rgyu bar byed pa'i rgyu bco lnga dang bral ba'i phyir rang nyid gar yang mi 'gro'i /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyu bar byed pa'i rgyu bco lnga dang bral ba'i phyir rang nyid gar yang mi 'gro'i /
translated: Because it is free from the fifteen causes of movement, it does not move anywhere by itself.

original: 'on kyang byas pas shes pa dang chos la gus pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi thad na rtag tu gnas pas rang gi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang byas pas shes pa dang chos la gus pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi thad na rtag tu gnas pas rang gi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because it always remains in the presence of the Bhagavat through the respect for the Dharma and so on that are produced by the Bhagavat, it is one's own.

original: rang gi ba'i nyan thos chen po'i 'khor brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ba'i nyan thos chen po'i 'khor brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the great disciples who are one's own are mentioned.

original: mdo sde rin chen zab mo ni //🔽dpag med nyan pa'i srid pa yis //
analyzed: mdo sde rin chen zab mo ni // dpag med nyan pa'i srid pa yis //
translated: The sutra of the profound jewel

original: mtha' yas 'jig rten khams rnams su //
analyzed: mtha' yas 'jig rten khams rnams su //
translated: is heard in the world systems without limit🔽by the wise who move about

original: mkhas pa gang phyir rgyu byed pas //
analyzed: mkhas pa gang phyir rgyu byed pas //
translated: because of the cause of the vehicle.

original: de yi theg pa bshad nyid kyis //
analyzed: de yi theg pa bshad nyid kyis //
translated: Because of the explanation of that vehicle,

original: de dag mang po 'ongs gyur te //
analyzed: de dag mang po 'ongs gyur te //
translated: many of them come.

original: des na mdo sde'i lung rnams su //
analyzed: des na mdo sde'i lung rnams su //
translated: Therefore, in the scriptures of the sutras

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams ma brjod do //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams ma brjod do //
translated: the sons of the Victor are not mentioned.

original: zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
translated: This is according to some.

original: tshig lhur len pa rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'phags pa stong phrag brgya pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig lhur len pa rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'phags pa stong phrag brgya pa bstan to //
translated: The noble one hundred thousand is taught for the sake of guiding those beings who delight in the extensive and who are intent on the words.

original: bar ma la dga' ba spros te bshad pas go ba'i sems can rnams la rjes su brtse bas /🔽don thams cad bsdus nas 'phags pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa bstan to //
analyzed: bar ma la dga' ba spros te bshad pas go ba'i sems can rnams la rjes su brtse bas / don thams cad bsdus nas 'phags pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa bstan to //
translated: For those sentient beings who like a concise teaching, with compassion he taught the noble Eight Thousand.🔽For those sentient beings who like to hear a lot, with compassion he taught the noble One Hundred Thousand.

original: mgo smos pas go ba bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir de'i yang don thams cad du bsdus nas 'phags pa @10a * //
analyzed: mgo smos pas go ba bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir de'i yang don thams cad du bsdus nas 'phags pa @10a * //
translated: For those sentient beings who like to hear a medium amount, with compassion he taught the noble Twenty-five Thousand.

original: brgyad stong pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyad stong pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: For those sentient beings who like to hear a little, with compassion he taught the noble Eight Thousand.🔽For those sentient beings who like to hear a very concise teaching, with compassion he taught the noble Condensed Perfection of Wisdom.🔽For those sentient beings who like to hear a very concise teaching, with compassion he taught the noble Condensed Perfection of Wisdom.🔽For those sentient beings who like to hear a very concise teaching, with compassion he taught the noble Condensed Perfection of Wisdom.🔽For those sentient beings who like to hear a very concise teaching, with compassion he taught the noble Condensed Perfection of Wisdom.

original: des na de'i rjes su 'brangs nas chos mthong ba mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor rnams dang / de bzhin du lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: des na de'i rjes su 'brangs nas chos mthong ba mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor rnams dang / de bzhin du lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang /

original: lhun gyis grub pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / nges ba'i spyod pa la yang dag par zhugs pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor ni tshad med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / nges ba'i spyod pa la yang dag par zhugs pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor ni tshad med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the retinue of the great bodhisattvas should be understood to be immeasurable.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: This is the other's.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
translated: And the master Dignaga says:

original: de ltar ji skad bshad rnams kyis //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad rnams kyis //
translated: Thus, by these as explained,

original: brgyad stong 'di don ma tshang med //
analyzed: brgyad stong 'di don ma tshang med //
translated: this Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines is not incomplete.

original: 'dir gzhung bsdus pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung bsdus pa yin par 'dod //
translated: Here, it is considered to be a summary.

original: don de ji skad gsungs de nyid //
analyzed: don de ji skad gsungs de nyid //
translated: The meaning of that is just as it is taught.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de ltar de'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis skal ba zhan pa rnams 'khor la sogs pa med pa na yid mi bde ba bzlog par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa chung ba la dgyes pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis chos kyi gdan bshams nas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis skal ba zhan pa rnams 'khor la sogs pa med pa na yid mi bde ba bzlog par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa chung ba la dgyes pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis chos kyi gdan bshams nas /
translated: Thus, by following that very thing, in order to turn away the mental dissatisfaction of those of little fortune when there is no retinue and so forth, and in order to delight in few desires, the Blessed One himself arranged the Dharma seat.

original: mdo sde rin po che 'di ni mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde rin po che 'di ni mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: This precious sutra is to be realized through meditative equipoise alone.

original: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir shin tu rkyong ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung du sku drang por bzhugs nas /
analyzed: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir shin tu rkyong ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rdo rje'i skyil mo krung du sku drang por bzhugs nas /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he sat upright in vajra posture, free from faults such as excessive relaxation,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: and formed the Dharma wheel mudra.

original: shangs kyi rtse mor spyan gtad de dran pa rtse gcig tu mngon du phyogs par mdzad nas ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te bzhengs so //
analyzed: shangs kyi rtse mor spyan gtad de dran pa rtse gcig tu mngon du phyogs par mdzad nas ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te bzhengs so //
translated: With his eyes focused at the tip of his nose, he directed his one-pointed mindfulness and arose from meditative equipoise in order to gather all meditative concentrations. He then entered the meditative concentration called the king of meditative concentrations.

original: de nas byams pa dang snying rje'i spyan dag gis 'jig rten 'di dag sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba la yang dag par gzigs te bstan pa 'di ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas skal ba ji lta ba bzhin tu 'gro zhing sangs rgyas nyid kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes gdul bya rnams kyis rtogs par mdzad pas /
analyzed: de nas byams pa dang snying rje'i spyan dag gis 'jig rten 'di dag sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba la yang dag par gzigs te bstan pa 'di ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas skal ba ji lta ba bzhin tu 'gro zhing sangs rgyas nyid kyi mthar thug par byed pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes gdul bya rnams kyis rtogs par mdzad pas /
translated: Then, with eyes of love and compassion, he sees that these worlds are tormented by suffering, and he causes disciples to understand that this teaching, which has the result of leading them according to their fortune, with its divisions of lesser, middling and greater, to the ultimate goal of buddhahood.

original: ci rigs par sku'i yan lag dang nyin lag rnams dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya @10b stong drug cu drug cu dang rang bzhin gyi 'od spro ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos khyab par mdzad cing /
analyzed: ci rigs par sku'i yan lag dang nyin lag rnams dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya @10b stong drug cu drug cu dang rang bzhin gyi 'od spro ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos khyab par mdzad cing /
translated: From all the limbs and fingers of his body and from all the pores of his skin, he radiates sixty times one hundred thousand times ten million light rays, together with his natural radiance, and he fills the worlds of the ten directions, as many as there are sand particles in the Ganges, with a great light.

original: sems can thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mdzad nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mdzad nas /
translated: He also caused all sentient beings to be certain of attaining unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ljags kyi dbang pos khebs par mdzad do /🔽de las 'od zer gyi tshogs mang po spros pa la gnas pa'i padma'i snying po la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mang po bzhugs pa sngon du 'gro bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i chos ston par mdzad pas snga ma bzhin du sems can gyi
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ljags kyi dbang pos khebs par mdzad do / de las 'od zer gyi tshogs mang po spros pa la gnas pa'i padma'i snying po la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mang po bzhugs pa sngon du 'gro bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i chos ston par mdzad pas snga ma bzhin du sems can gyi
translated: He covered the trichiliocosm with his tongue.

original: don mdzad de /
analyzed: don mdzad de /
translated: From that, many masses of light rays emanated. In the center of lotuses that were the bases of the emanations, many bodies of tathāgatas were seated. Preceded by those, he taught the Dharma endowed with the six perfections. He acted for the welfare of sentient beings as before.

original: de don du gnyer ba'i skye bo bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba'i skye bo bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to gather beings who were striving for that,

original: yum ston pa'i ltas pa thogs pa med pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: yum ston pa'i ltas pa thogs pa med pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: he displayed the unimpeded display of teaching the mother.

original: de'i 'og tu de bzhin du 'khor gyi 'jigs pa la sogs 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de bzhin du 'khor gyi 'jigs pa la sogs 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bas /
translated: After that, likewise, free from all fears such as the fear of the retinue,

original: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered into the meditative absorption called “the lion’s majestic posture,”

original: gnas mi gtsang ba dang / nyan po kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba la mi mkhas pa la rgyal ba'i yum bstan par mi bya'o zhes chos smra ba rnams la go bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas mi gtsang ba dang / nyan po kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba la mi mkhas pa la rgyal ba'i yum bstan par mi bya'o zhes chos smra ba rnams la go bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to make the Dharma teachers understand that the Mother of the Victorious Ones should not be taught to those who are in impure places or who are not skilled in the division of the conventional and the ultimate,

original: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad de /
translated: he manifested such a miraculous display.

original: gang gis ltas chen po bcva brgyad sngon du 'gro ba dang de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la bsdus pa'i mi khom pa brgyad rnam par bsal bas gnas yongs su sbyangs pas /
analyzed: gang gis ltas chen po bcva brgyad sngon du 'gro ba dang de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la bsdus pa'i mi khom pa brgyad rnam par bsal bas gnas yongs su sbyangs pas /
translated: This was preceded by the eighteen great omens, and likewise, by completely purifying the place through dispelling the eight non-conducive conditions that pervade all world systems,

original: de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams lha dang mi dang skal pa mnyam par skyes nas skye ba dran te /
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams lha dang mi dang skal pa mnyam par skyes nas skye ba dran te /
translated: the sentient beings dwelling there were born with the fortune of gods and humans and remembered their previous lives.

original: dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du song ba sngon du 'gro bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du song ba sngon du 'gro bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dud par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will go to their own buddha-fields with joy and delight, and will bow down to and pay homage to the Blessed Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad kyang long bar gyur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang long bar gyur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing /
translated: All sentient beings will be free from the faults of blindness and so forth,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi la mngon par dga' zhing /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi la mngon par dga' zhing /
translated: and will abide in the path of the ten virtuous actions, delighting in the four divine abodes,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs pa lta bu'i bde ba thob pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs pa lta bu'i bde ba thob pas /
translated: and will attain the bliss of being absorbed in the third concentration.

original: rgyal ba'i yum mnyan pa'i snod du gyur pas 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang yang dag par ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum mnyan pa'i snod du gyur pas 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang yang dag par ldan par gyur te /
translated: Having become vessels for listening to the Mother of the Victorious Ones, they will possess this kind of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: Thus, generosity is excellent.

original: dul ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: dul ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: Discipline is excellent.

original: zhi ba ni legs pa'o //🔽yang dag @11a * //🔽par sdom pa ni legs pa'o /
analyzed: zhi ba ni legs pa'o // yang dag @11a * // par sdom pa ni legs pa'o /
translated: Peace is excellent.🔽Correct restraint is excellent.

original: tshangs par spyad pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: Pure conduct is excellent.

original: srog chags su gyur pa rnams la mi 'tshe ba ni legs pa'o zhes bya ba'i ched du brjod do //
analyzed: srog chags su gyur pa rnams la mi 'tshe ba ni legs pa'o zhes bya ba'i ched du brjod do //
translated: It is good not to harm any living being.

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two kinds of miracles of concentration.

original: de'i rjes la bcom ldan 'das shes bya mtha' dag mnga' brnyes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston par spyod do zhes ston par mdzad pas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bcom ldan 'das shes bya mtha' dag mnga' brnyes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston par spyod do zhes ston par mdzad pas /
translated: After that, the Blessed One, having attained mastery over all objects of knowledge, taught this perfection of wisdom, as is shown by the statement:

original: gdul bya rnams grus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du 'od dang sku mdog dang gzi brjid dang dpal gyis 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis man na nas ;
analyzed: gdul bya rnams grus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du 'od dang sku mdog dang gzi brjid dang dpal gyis 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis man na nas ;
translated: Having outshone the whole world with his splendor, color, majesty, and glory, just as before, in order to generate respect in those to be trained,

analyzed: go rims bzhin du mdzes shing lham me lhan ne lhang nge ste /

original: de bzhin du 'di lta bu nyid kyis 'di thugs su chud pa dang ston par spyod kyis bdag cag lta bus ni ma yin no zhes gdul bya rnams 'bad pa 'bad pa mi byed par 'gyur du 'ong bas /

translated: The second pair of miracles is the display of the body of the Tathagata, which is like the display of all aspects of the Dharma by the King of the Well Gone Ones in the presence of all sentient beings who dwell in the world systems.

original: // de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su 'khrungs pa'i phyir dang / shes rab la sogs pa phul du byung ba yang srid pa'i phyir bcam ldan 'das 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang rnam ba thams cad du 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa la mnyam pa ma yin no //

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab srid pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang lhan cig /

original: tshogs dang chos sku dag dang ni //
analyzed: tshogs dang chos sku dag dang ni //
translated: The buddhas are equal in terms of their accumulations, their dharmakaya,

translated: In the same way, he made aspirations to be born in various world systems, and to all the bodhisattvas who are his disciples in those places, he taught the entire collection of the precious scriptures of the Excellent Speech without error.

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /

original: gis 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sems can mi mnyam pa nyid kyi the tshom gyi sa bon rnam pa thams cad drungs phyung bar gyur pa thams cad kyi phan tshun nas phan tshun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor🔽gyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshogs dang bcas pa rnams mthong nas mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / de bzhin du snang ba chen po la sogs pa'i ltas mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas /🔽rang gi bla ma la ma zhus par bab chol du 'gro ba ni mi rigs so snyam nas /
analyzed: gis 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sems can mi mnyam pa nyid kyi the tshom gyi sa bon rnam pa thams cad drungs phyung bar gyur pa thams cad kyi phan tshun nas phan tshun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshogs dang bcas pa rnams mthong nas mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / de bzhin du snang ba chen po la sogs pa'i ltas mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas / rang gi bla ma la ma zhus par bab chol du 'gro ba ni mi rigs so snyam nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having seen the bhagavān buddhas residing in the world systems of the ten directions, together with the assemblies of their retinues, thought, “It is not right for us to go to the buddha realm of Sahā without asking our gurus.”

original: de'i don du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thad du song ste zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i don du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thad du song ste zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis /
translated: With that in mind, the bodhisattvas of the ten directions went to their respective tathāgatas, bowed down at their feet, and said, “We are going to the buddha realm of Sahā.”

original: bcom ldan 'das snang ba chen po 'jig rten du byung ba 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa'i lan gyi rjes thogs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snang ba chen po 'jig rten du byung ba 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa'i lan gyi rjes thogs la /
translated: After the question, Bhagavat, this great light appeared in the world, and so forth,

original: bsngags pa gsung ba thos pas rang gi bdag po'i thugs dgongs bzang po rig pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das bdag cag bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa de lta bu de lta ba la sogs pa'i slad du 'jig rten gyi khams der mchi'o zhes gsol te snang
analyzed: bsngags pa gsung ba thos pas rang gi bdag po'i thugs dgongs bzang po rig pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das bdag cag bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa de lta bu de lta ba la sogs pa'i slad du 'jig rten gyi khams der mchi'o zhes gsol te snang
translated: the retinue of the Tathagata of the Land of Bliss, having heard the praise of the Land of Bliss, said, We will go to that world in order to see the Bhagavat and his retinue.

original: ba thob nas /
analyzed: ba thob nas /
translated: Having obtained the light,

original: rang gi bdag pos chos la gus pas mchod pa'i don du rin po che sna tshogs kyi padma'i skyes bskur ba dang / gnod pa chung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa snyun gsol ba'i tshig dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa yin pas bag yod par gnas par gyis shig ces bya ba'i rjes su bstan pa mnos nas /
analyzed: rang gi bdag pos chos la gus pas mchod pa'i don du rin po che sna tshogs kyi padma'i skyes bskur ba dang / gnod pa chung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa snyun gsol ba'i tshig dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa yin pas bag yod par gnas par gyis shig ces bya ba'i rjes su bstan pa mnos nas /
translated: they were sent with various jeweled lotuses as offerings to their master out of respect for the Dharma and with the words of inquiry, Are you well? and so forth, and they accepted the instruction, This world is endowed with the five degenerations, so abide carefully.

original: 'khor dpag tu med pa dang bcas pas bar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed cing 'ongs nas /
analyzed: 'khor dpag tu med pa dang bcas pas bar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed cing 'ongs nas /
translated: Having made offerings to the intermediate tathagatas together with an immeasurable retinue,

original: zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa'i tshogs byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa'i tshogs byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: they arrived, prostrated at the feet of the tathagatas, blessed the offerings and🔽sat in their own places, each offering a lotus to their own tathagata.

original: rang rang gi gnas su 'khod nas rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi snyun gsol ba'i tshig dang padma phul bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos snang ba'i cho 'phrul rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas su 'khod nas rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi snyun gsol ba'i tshig dang padma phul bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos snang ba'i cho 'phrul rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: This is the second kind of miracle of Dharma illumination.

original: de'i rjes la bcom ldan @12b 'das yongs sum dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su 'khrungs su zin kyang de'i nyes pas ma gos pa shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / dam pa'i chos la mchod ba bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bcom ldan @12b 'das yongs sum dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su 'khrungs su zin kyang de'i nyes pas ma gos pa shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / dam pa'i chos la mchod ba bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to show that the bhagavat was born in the impure world but was not tainted by its faults and in order to make offerings to the holy Dharma,

original: padma de rnams rang rang gi phyogs su gtor ba na /
analyzed: padma de rnams rang rang gi phyogs su gtor ba na /
translated: he scattered the lotuses in all directions.

original: padma de rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba can rgyal ba'i yum ston par mdzad pas /🔽sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mdzad pa'i don du dam pa'i chos la mchod pa phul nas /
analyzed: padma de rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba can rgyal ba'i yum ston par mdzad pas / sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mdzad pa'i don du dam pa'i chos la mchod pa phul nas /
translated: The Tathagatas, seated on those lotuses, expound the Mother of the Conquerors,🔽and make beings certain of supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: skal ba ji lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa'i 'dus pa rnams 'ongs par thugs su chud nas ;
analyzed: skal ba ji lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa'i 'dus pa rnams 'ongs par thugs su chud nas ;
translated: Having made offerings of the supreme Dharma, they know that the assemblies of great Bodhisattvas and so on, according to their fortune, have come.🔽And they teach the perfection of wisdom, which is virtuous in the beginning, middle and end.

original: thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha mar dge ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha mar dge ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is to be known as the introduction.

original: mgo smos pas go ba mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas 'dir ni de dag ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mgo smos pas go ba mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas 'dir ni de dag ma gsungs so //
translated: For the sake of those beings who like a brief teaching and understand by a mere hint, the teaching is given in a condensed form.

original: des ni gang gi cho bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen po na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la ji skad du bshad pa'i 'khor rnams kyis yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: des ni gang gi cho bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi grong khyer chen po na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la ji skad du bshad pa'i 'khor rnams kyis yongs su bskor te /
translated: This means that the Bhagavat was dwelling in the great city of Rajagrha on Vulture Peak Mountain, surrounded by the retinue as explained above,

original: chos ston par mdzad cing bzhugs pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das las gnas de nyid du 'khor de rnams dang lhan cig 'di skad bdag gis mdo sde rin po che thos so //
analyzed: chos ston par mdzad cing bzhugs pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das las gnas de nyid du 'khor de rnams dang lhan cig 'di skad bdag gis mdo sde rin po che thos so //
translated: and teaching the Dharma. At that time, the Bhagavat spoke to that retinue in that very place, saying, “Thus have I heard: the precious sutra.”

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what he said.

original: yul la sogs pa yang dag par bsgrags pa 'di thams cad kyis kyang /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa yang dag par bsgrags pa 'di thams cad kyis kyang /
translated: All of this, the proclamation of the place and so on,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs pa las yang dag par sdud par byed pas bdag nyid tshad mar bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs pa las yang dag par sdud par byed pas bdag nyid tshad mar bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: is a means of establishing the validity of the compiler himself by following worldly conventions.

original: gdul bya rnams la gus pa dang bcas bas mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams la gus pa dang bcas bas mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore he is encouraging his disciples to listen, reflect and so on with respect.

original: de yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
translated: The master Dignaga said:

original: ston pa dbang po'i 'khor dang ni //
analyzed: ston pa dbang po'i 'khor dang ni //
translated: The teacher, the retinue of faculties,

original: yul dang dus kyang nges bstan pa //
analyzed: yul dang dus kyang nges bstan pa //
translated: and the definite teaching of place and time,

original: dad ldan 'jug pa'i yan lag tu //
analyzed: dad ldan 'jug pa'i yan lag tu //
translated: are for the sake of engaging those with faith.

original: sdud po rang nyid tshad mar ni //
analyzed: sdud po rang nyid tshad mar ni //
translated: The compiler himself is established as

original: rab grub phyir yin 'jig rten na //
analyzed: rab grub phyir yin 'jig rten na //
translated: authoritative in the world,

original: yul dang dus sogs kyis mtshon cing //🔽dbang por bcas tshig smra ba yi //
analyzed: yul dang dus sogs kyis mtshon cing // dbang por bcas tshig smra ba yi //
translated: characterized by place, time, and so forth,🔽and is fully understood as an authoritative speaker

original: smra po tshad mar rab tu rtogs //
analyzed: smra po tshad mar rab tu rtogs //
translated: with faculties and speech.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: de la / mdo don smra bar 'dod pa yis //🔽@13a * // dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas dang // tshig don bcas dang mtshams sbyar bcas //
analyzed: de la / mdo don smra bar 'dod pa yis // @13a * // dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas dang // tshig don bcas dang mtshams sbyar bcas //
translated: One who wishes to explain the meaning of the sutras🔽should do so with the purpose, the summarized meaning,🔽the meaning of the words, the connection,

original: brgal lan bcas pas bsnyad par bya //
analyzed: brgal lan bcas pas bsnyad par bya //
translated: and the response to objections.

original: zhes rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las rnam pa lngas mdo sde bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las rnam pa lngas mdo sde bshad par bya'o //
translated: In the Principles of Exegesis, it is said that the sutras should be explained in five ways.

original: zhes nges par byas so //
analyzed: zhes nges par byas so //
translated: This is understood.

original: de la dgos pa ni bshad zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la dgos pa ni bshad zin pa kho na'o //
translated: The purpose has already been explained.

original: de bas na nyan pa po'i skye bo rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / bstan bcos don rnam par dbye pa byas pa ni 'chad pa po rnams kyis kyang bshad sla ba des na re zhig mdor bsdus pa'i don brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyan pa po'i skye bo rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / bstan bcos don rnam par dbye pa byas pa ni 'chad pa po rnams kyis kyang bshad sla ba des na re zhig mdor bsdus pa'i don brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to make it easy for the listener to understand and in order to make it easy for the expounder to explain, having analyzed the meaning of the treatise, the brief meaning will be stated first.

original: de la 'bras bu bstan pas byang chub don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su shes par byed pa'i phyir na dang po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu bstan pas byang chub don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su shes par byed pa'i phyir na dang po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brjod do //
translated: Therein, in order to make known all the aspects of arousing the thought of enlightenment, etc. for the bodhisattva who is striving for enlightenment by teaching the result, the knowledge of all modes is mentioned first.

original: de ni nyan thos kyi lam la sogs pa yongs su shes pa med par ma yin pas de'i rjes la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos kyi lam la sogs pa yongs su shes pa med par ma yin pas de'i rjes la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: That is not without the knowledge of the disciples' path, etc. , so the knowledge of the path aspects comes next.

original: de yang gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par ma yin pas de'i 'og tu thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par ma yin pas de'i 'og tu thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: That is not without the knowledge of all bases, so the knowledge of all bases comes next.

original: de nas de ltar thob pa'i thams cad mkhyen nyid gsum rnam pa thams cad du dbang du bya ba'i don du yang rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang dngos po'i bye brag bsdus nas kun mkhyen gsum sgom pas rtogs pa ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par
analyzed: de nas de ltar thob pa'i thams cad mkhyen nyid gsum rnam pa thams cad du dbang du bya ba'i don du yang rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang dngos po'i bye brag bsdus nas kun mkhyen gsum sgom pas rtogs pa ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par
translated: Then, in order to bring the three omnisciences that are thus obtained under one's control in every way, one comprehends by meditating on the three omnisciences, having included all the aspects, paths, and categories of things. This is the complete clear realization of all aspects.

original: rtogs pa'o // khyad par can gyi lam gyis rab kyi mthar thug pa rtogs pa thob pa rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la brten nas /🔽so sob dang bsdus pa'i dbye bas rnam par bsgoms pa'i don rnams nges par bya ba'i don du rim par bkod bas mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rig nas /
analyzed: rtogs pa'o // khyad par can gyi lam gyis rab kyi mthar thug pa rtogs pa thob pa rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la brten nas / so sob dang bsdus pa'i dbye bas rnam par bsgoms pa'i don rnams nges par bya ba'i don du rim par bkod bas mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rig nas /
translated: Having attained the realization that is the culmination of the supreme path, one relies on the clear realization of the peak.🔽In order to ascertain the topics that have been meditated on in detail and in summary, one actualizes them by means of the sequential arrangement. This is the clear realization of sequence.

original: yang legs par goms par bya ba'i phyir rnam par bsgoms pa skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i de ma thag tu /
analyzed: yang legs par goms par bya ba'i phyir rnam par bsgoms pa skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i de ma thag tu /
translated: Then, in order to become well acquainted with them, one actualizes the topics that have been meditated on in a single instant. This is the clear realization of the single instant that is the culmination of practice.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la chos kyi sku mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la chos kyi sku mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the second moment, there is the realization of the unerring enlightenment of the Dharmakaya.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bsdus pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bsdus pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the brief summary of the eight realizations of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag @13b bshad //
analyzed: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag @13b bshad //
translated: is explained in eight topics:

original: rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
translated: Omniscience, path knowledge,

original: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid //
analyzed: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid //
translated: and then knowledge of all aspects.🔽The complete realization of all aspects,

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs gtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs gtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
translated: the peak application, and the serial one,

original: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //🔽chos kyi sku dang de rnam brgyad //
analyzed: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub // chos kyi sku dang de rnam brgyad //
translated: and the instantaneous complete enlightenment.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These are the eight topics of the Dharmakaya.

original: mdor bstan pa ni rgyas par smras na legs par bshad pa nyid yin pas slar yang bsdus pa'i don rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa ni rgyas par smras na legs par bshad pa nyid yin pas slar yang bsdus pa'i don rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since the brief explanation is well explained when expanded, the meaning of the summary should be stated in detail.

original: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'gro bar 'dod pas dang por stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can gyi byang chub kyi sems smon pa dang 'jug pa'i rang bzhin can rnam pa gnyis po bskyed nas /
analyzed: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'gro bar 'dod pas dang por stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can gyi byang chub kyi sems smon pa dang 'jug pa'i rang bzhin can rnam pa gnyis po bskyed nas /
translated: One who wishes to proceed to perfect complete enlightenment first generates the two aspects of the mind of enlightenment bodhicitta, which is the essence of emptiness and compassion, the aspiring pranidhicitta and the engaging prasthānacitta.

original: sems bskyed pa dang des 'phangs pa'i chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par thob pa'i yon tan yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i don du bsgrubs pa la sogs pa gdams ngag bzung ba'i rjes la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang des 'phangs pa'i chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par thob pa'i yon tan yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i don du bsgrubs pa la sogs pa gdams ngag bzung ba'i rjes la /
translated: Then, in order to perfect the qualities of the generation of bodhicitta and the phenomena induced by it, one should take the instructions of practice and so on for the purpose of guarding the qualities that are correctly obtained and for the purpose of increasing them.

original: thos pa la sogs pa rab tu mthar phyin pa thob pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'og tu bden pa bzhi rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi po 'jig
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa rab tu mthar phyin pa thob pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'og tu bden pa bzhi rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi po 'jig
translated: After that, one should generate the four aspects of the branches leading to enlightenment, which are characterized by faith and so on, which are the roots of virtue that obtain the culmination of listening and so on, and which are concordant with the realization of the four noble truths.

original: rten pa'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin nges par byas te /
analyzed: rten pa'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin nges par byas te /
translated: Having ascertained the nature of the meditation that is the basis,🔽one should practice the factors conducive to penetrative insight as they have been explained, and also the path of seeing and so forth.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nges bar 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang gzhan mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa yang sgrub pa dang ldan pa yin pas na sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi chos thams cad
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nges bar 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang gzhan mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa yang sgrub pa dang ldan pa yin pas na sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi chos thams cad
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva's own Dharma, which is the nature of the dharmadhatu, becomes the basis of practice.

original: dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can /
analyzed: dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can /
translated: It is preceded by the observation of all phenomena

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyis sems chen po nyid dang spong ba chen po nyid dang rtogs pa chen po nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid kyis sems chen po nyid dang spong ba chen po nyid dang rtogs pa chen po nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: and is the great mind, the great abandonment, and the great realization, in terms of being the best of all sentient beings.

original: sgrub pa la 'jug pas dben gyi gnas su gyur pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa la 'jug pas dben gyi gnas su gyur pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should cultivate the three kinds of objects of meditation for the purpose of engaging in practice and becoming isolated.

original: de'i rjes la de thob bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la spyir dge ba'i chos kyi rten can dang / rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi la mngon par rtogs pa re re la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa yin no //🔽des na de ltar ji ltab bzhin du sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang sgom pa dang khyad par @14a * //

translated: After that, in order to attain that, in the field of the three omnisciences, in general, it is the practice of virtue, and in particular, it is the practice of the four realizations, such as the complete realization of all aspects, and so on. analyzed: gyi lam gyi ngo bo go cha la sogs pa'i sgrub pa rnams kyi nang nas /

translated: The mindstream of those who have conquered pride🔽has the fortune to realize this.🔽This is taught by the words.

translated: for them, the factors conducive to penetration and so forth are taught.

original: de bas na le'u dgu pa las /
analyzed: de bas na le'u dgu pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the ninth chapter of the sutra,

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: having spoken thus, the venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i slad du 'di ni mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i slad du 'di ni mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “This is the perfection of the infinite, because of the infinity of space,” and so on.

original: le'u nyi shu pa nas /
analyzed: le'u nyi shu pa nas /
translated: The twentieth chapter says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dang de dag ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrogs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dang de dag ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi 'phrogs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pas /
translated: “Those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are not carried away by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: ji ltar srid par sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: ji ltar srid par sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, it teaches the complete and perfect realization of the buddhas and so on in samsara.

original: / de skad du yang /
analyzed: / de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said,🔽The aspects, the trainings, and so on,

original: rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
analyzed: rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
translated: The characteristics of qualities and faults,🔽Liberation, the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: The assembly of trainees, the irreversible,🔽The equality of existence and peace,

original: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
translated: The unsurpassable fields,

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste ;
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste ;
translated: The complete and perfect realization in all aspects,

original: /'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin /
analyzed: /'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin /
translated: This is the skillful means.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i rjes la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa thob pa ni khyad par gyi lam gyi rtogs pa rab kyi mthar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa thob pa ni khyad par gyi lam gyi rtogs pa rab kyi mthar 'gro'o //
translated: After that, the attainment of the realization of the complete aspects is the culmination of the realization of the special path.

original: zhes rtse mor mngon par rtogs pa bstan pa'i don du /🔽grangs ji lta ba bzhin drod la @16a * //
analyzed: zhes rtse mor mngon par rtogs pa bstan pa'i don du / grangs ji lta ba bzhin drod la @16a * //
translated: In order to teach the realization at the peak,

original: sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'i ngo bo /
analyzed: sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'i ngo bo /
translated: in accordance with the enumeration, the nature of the four aspects of definite separation beginning with heat,

original: rtags dang rnam par 'phel ba dang brtan pa dang sems kun tu gnas pa bstan pa sngon du song ba can /
analyzed: rtags dang rnam par 'phel ba dang brtan pa dang sems kun tu gnas pa bstan pa sngon du song ba can /
translated: the signs, increase, stability, and complete mental placement,

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dag bdag dang skyes bu rdzas dang btags par yod pa'i rten can dag grangs ji lta ba bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis gnyis yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dag bdag dang skyes bu rdzas dang btags par yod pa'i rten can dag grangs ji lta ba bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis gnyis yin pa'i phyir /
translated: having gone before, based on the side of engagement and disengagement, based on the substantial and imputed self and person, in accordance with the enumeration, are the two conceptualizations of apprehended and apprehender.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhin rnams mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam so so la spang bar bya ba nyid du dang / de spong bar byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gnyen po rnam pa bzhi blang bar bya ba nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhin rnams mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam so so la spang bar bya ba nyid du dang / de spong bar byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gnyen po rnam pa bzhi blang bar bya ba nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the four kinds of conceptual thoughts to be seen and to be abandoned on the paths of seeing and cultivation, respectively, and the four kinds of remedies to be taken up in the context of abandoning them,

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob ba la bar chad med pas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bden pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas spang bar bya ba'i log par sgrub pa dang bcas pa bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob ba la bar chad med pas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bden pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas spang bar bya ba'i log par sgrub pa dang bcas pa bstan to //
translated: the uninterrupted meditative stabilization for attaining buddhahood is taught, along with the wrong practices to be abandoned, by means of the skill in means that is based on both truths.

original: de nas le'u nyi shu pa las /
analyzed: de nas le'u nyi shu pa las /
translated: Then, in the twentieth chapter,

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rmi lam gyi nang na yang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rmi lam gyi nang na yang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva, even in a dream, and so on,

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pas rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa rgyu dang bcas par gsungs so //
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pas rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa rgyu dang bcas par gsungs so //
translated: The twenty-ninth chapter says, “Because of the immeasurable virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas, one should know the perfection of wisdom.” This is the culmination of the explanation of the peak’s clear realization and its causes.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It says:🔽Its signs, its increase,🔽its stability, its abiding in the mind,

original: de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
analyzed: de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
translated: its seeing, and its meditation

original: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
analyzed: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
translated: are the paths of action.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
translated: The four types of conceptualization

original: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
translated: are the four types of antidotes.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The uninterrupted samādhi

original: log par bsgrub dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: log par bsgrub dang bcas pa ni //
translated: is together with wrong practice.

original: rtse mo'i mngon rtogs /🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon rtogs /🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The clear realization of the peak.

original: de'i rjes la rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa ni so so ba dang bsdus pa nyid du rtogs pa'i don rnams brtan par bya ba'i phyir rim par bkod nas rnam par sgom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa ni so so ba dang bsdus pa nyid du rtogs pa'i don rnams brtan par bya ba'i phyir rim par bkod nas rnam par sgom par byed pa yin no //
translated: After that, the attainment of the peak realization is the successive arrangement and meditation on the meaning of the individual and combined realizations in order to stabilize them.

original: zhes chos thams cad sdud par byed pa sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gsum du /
analyzed: zhes chos thams cad sdud par byed pa sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu gsum du /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom should be understood as the thirteen aspects such as generosity that encompass all dharmas,
