original: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pha las seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig po nyid kyis mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rgyu dang bcas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pha las seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig po nyid kyis mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rgyu dang bcas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the single statement the lion's roar in the twenty-ninth chapter is said to be the gradual realization with its cause.

original: de @16b skad du yang /
analyzed: de @16b skad du yang /
translated: And thus:

original: mthar gyis pa /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa /
translated: The gradual

original: rnam gsum rnam bcu zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam gsum rnam bcu zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is said to be threefold and tenfold.

original: de'i 'og tu mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bsgoms pa ni shin tu goms par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bsgoms pa ni shin tu goms par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, the meditation on the gradual realization is for the sake of thorough familiarity.

original: rtogs pa'i chos de rnams nyid rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa dbye ba rnam pa bzhir skad cig ma gcig nyid kyis mngon du byed do zhes le'u de nyid las chos
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos de rnams nyid rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa dbye ba rnam pa bzhir skad cig ma gcig nyid kyis mngon du byed do zhes le'u de nyid las chos
translated: The Dharma of realization is all uncontaminated dharmas that are not fully ripened and they are actualized in a single instant by means of a single instant, which is divided into four aspects, such as the single instant that is the defining characteristic of all dharmas.🔽In that very chapter, it says:🔽Because all dharmas are unperturbed, the perfection of wisdom should be known to be unperturbed.

original: thams cad 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'khrug pa med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig nyid kyis skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa sgom pa'i rnam pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa
analyzed: thams cad 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'khrug pa med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig nyid kyis skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa sgom pa'i rnam pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa
translated: By that single phrase, the aspect of meditation on awakening in a single instant is the second instant.

original: la chos kyi sku mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar 'gyur bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa de ma thag pa rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: la chos kyi sku mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar 'gyur bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa de ma thag pa rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
translated: Since the dharmakāya is fully awakened in the second instant, the three types of immediate full awakening of the bodhisattvas are explained.

original: sku lhag ma gsum po ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu snang ba yin te /
analyzed: sku lhag ma gsum po ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu snang ba yin te /
translated: The remaining three kāyas appear in the correct relative.

original: don dam par chos nyid kyi ngo bo la mos pa ji lta bas rab tu phye bas /
analyzed: don dam par chos nyid kyi ngo bo la mos pa ji lta bas rab tu phye bas /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, it is classified in accordance with the interest in the essence of dharmatā.🔽It is presented as the domain of buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /🔽gang phyir dben par gyur pa las //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du / gang phyir dben par gyur pa las //
translated: In order to teach this, the text says:🔽Because it is not different from what is isolated,

original: dben pa tha mi dad par 'dod //
analyzed: dben pa tha mi dad par 'dod //
translated: it is held to be isolated.🔽Although it is not different from the svabhāvakāya, it is attained as different through the supramundane path.🔽Because it is not fabricated, it is not created.

original: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid kyi sku de las tha mi dad kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis tha dad du 'thob pa yin gyi bcos bu ma yin pa'i don gyis na byas pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma ltar
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis ngo bo nyid kyi sku de las tha mi dad kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis tha dad du 'thob pa yin gyi bcos bu ma yin pa'i don gyis na byas pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma ltar
translated: All phenomena are like illusions.

original: gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i ye shes kyis khong du chud pa yin no zhes de brjod pa sngon du song ba can /
analyzed: gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i ye shes kyis khong du chud pa yin no zhes de brjod pa sngon du song ba can /
translated: They are realized by the wisdom that realizes nonduality.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu don khyad par can du snang ba skyed pa'i sgo nas gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu don khyad par can du snang ba skyed pa'i sgo nas gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba /
translated: In the relative truth of the yogi, it is an object that appears in a special way and must be accepted.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pas yongs su gyur pa /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pas yongs su gyur pa /
translated: It is the transformation of the basis.

original: chos ston pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba byed pa gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba /
analyzed: chos ston pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba byed pa gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba /
translated: It is the mind and mental factors that perform the function of teaching the Dharma and so forth without any duality.

original: rnam pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi spyod yul du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs las byung ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi spyod yul du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs las byung ba ni /
translated: It arises from the accumulation of wisdom, which is the domain of the tathāgatas themselves.

original: chos kyi sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa yin no /
analyzed: chos kyi sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa yin no /
translated: It is the dharmakāya together with its activity.

original: zhes bstan pa'i de ma thag tu /🔽mdo sde rin po che sna tshogs nyan par 'dod pas bcu la rab tu @17a * //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i de ma thag tu / mdo sde rin po che sna tshogs nyan par 'dod pas bcu la rab tu @17a * //
translated: Immediately after teaching this,

original: gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang lhan cig tu /
analyzed: gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang lhan cig tu /
translated: those who wish to listen to the various precious sūtras should do so together with the great bodhisattvas who are abiding in the tenth bhūmi.

original: mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa theg pa chen po'i chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par mdzes pa'i sku🔽ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par bstan nas /🔽skal pa ji lta ba bzhin 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don bya ba byed pa srid pa ji srid kyi mthar thug par rnam pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi cha las byung ba /
analyzed: mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa theg pa chen po'i chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par mdzes pa'i sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par bstan nas / skal pa ji lta ba bzhin 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don bya ba byed pa srid pa ji srid kyi mthar thug par rnam pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi cha las byung ba /
translated: The sambhogakaya is the body that is beautified by the major and minor marks of excellence, which are the result of the accumulation of immeasurable merit, and which experiences the bliss and joy of fully enjoying the Dharma of the Mahayana, which is supremely free of negative influences.

original: byis pa dang nyan thos la sogs bas dmigs par rung bar bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i gzugs ni sprul pa'i sku yin par bstan to //
analyzed: byis pa dang nyan thos la sogs bas dmigs par rung bar bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i gzugs ni sprul pa'i sku yin par bstan to //
translated: The nirmanakaya is the body that is the result of the accumulation of wisdom and is the means for accomplishing the benefit of all beings without exception, in accordance with their individual fortunes, until the end of samsara. It is the body that is suitable to be perceived by ordinary beings, shravakas, and so forth, such as Shakyamuni Buddha.

original: des na le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa las /
analyzed: des na le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa las /
translated: In the twenty-ninth chapter of the Sutra of the King of the Tantras of Secret Amrita, it says:

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhuti, beginning with Thus should a Bodhisattva, a great being,

original: le'u de'i zhabs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa rnyed par dka' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku mngon par byang chub ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: le'u de'i zhabs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa rnyed par dka' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku mngon par byang chub ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the end of the chapter, he will not find it difficult to attain the unexcelled, perfect enlightenment of the Buddhas, explains the enlightenment body of the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: de skad du yang //
analyzed: de skad du yang //
translated: And it is said:

original: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan la sprul ba ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan la sprul ba ni //
translated: The essence, the beatific, and likewise the emanation,

original: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
analyzed: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
translated: The Dharma body, and the activities,

original: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
translated: These are said to be the four aspects.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And it is said:🔽The essence, the beatific, and likewise the emanation,🔽The Dharma body, and the activities,🔽These are said to be the four aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du ltar bsgrub par bya'o zhes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du ltar bsgrub par bya'o zhes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to make the assembly of disciples understand how a Bodhisattva should always practice,

original: de'i sngon gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba brjod pa'i sngo nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes pa sngon du 'gro bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: de'i sngon gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba brjod pa'i sngo nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes pa sngon du 'gro bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Having stated the introduction to the story of its past, in order to demonstrate the benefits of applying oneself to the perfection of wisdom, with the pleasing of the spiritual master as a prerequisite,

original: mjug bsdu pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: mjug bsdu pa'i sgo nas /
translated: in the concluding section,

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa nyid tshul lugs par pas ston pa lhur byed pa nyid kyi le'u gsum bstan te /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa nyid tshul lugs par pas ston pa lhur byed pa nyid kyi le'u gsum bstan te /
translated: he teaches the three chapters that are devoted to the practice of the stages of realization as they are taught.

original: de yang go sla ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas par ma bsdus so //
analyzed: de yang go sla ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas par ma bsdus so //
translated: And because they are easy to understand, they are not included in the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: de ltar rnam pa gzhan gnyis kyis ni bsdus pa'i don 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir re zhig bsdus pa'i don ni gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gzhan gnyis kyis ni bsdus pa'i don 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir re zhig bsdus pa'i don ni gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, since the two other aspects are explained in the summarized meaning, the summarized meaning is just one.

original: da ni tshig don la sogs pa @17b bshad pas mdo'i don brjod pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni tshig don la sogs pa @17b bshad pas mdo'i don brjod pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the meaning of the words and so on are explained, and the meaning of the sutra is stated with Then and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: Then is the introduction to the words.

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na mchod pa la sogs pas gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir gnas brtan no //
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na mchod pa la sogs pas gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir gnas brtan no //
translated: He is the Elder because he is the foremost in being worshipped by the world with its gods.

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mdzes shing mchog tu gyur pa dang / 'byor pa sems kyis phun sum tshogs pa gang la yod pa de ni rab 'byor ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mdzes shing mchog tu gyur pa dang / 'byor pa sems kyis phun sum tshogs pa gang la yod pa de ni rab 'byor ro //
translated: Subhuti is one who is well gone, because he has the perfection of the mind that is endowed with the wealth of being the most beautiful and the best among those who abide in the absence of afflictions.

original: 'di na la lar ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku'i mdzad pa'i bdag nyid can phyag la sogs pas byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: 'di na la lar ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku'i mdzad pa'i bdag nyid can phyag la sogs pas byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: In some places, the Tathagatas bless the body of the Buddha, which is the embodiment of the Buddha's activities, through acts such as bowing.

original: dper na sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo ston par mdzad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo ston par mdzad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, as in the teaching of the Dashabhumika Sutra.

original: la lar ni gsung gi byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: la lar ni gsung gi byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: In some places, they bless the speech.

original: dper na ma skyes dgra'i 'gyod pa bsal ba'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ma skyes dgra'i 'gyod pa bsal ba'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, as in the teaching of the Ajnata Kaukrtya Vinodana Sutra.

original: la lar ni thugs kyis byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: la lar ni thugs kyis byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: In some places, they bless the mind.

original: dper na kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa ston pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa ston pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, as in the teaching of the Samantabhadracaraparisishta Sutra.

original: des na 'phags pa rab 'byor la lhag par mos pa rnams rjes su bzung ba dang / yongs su gtang gtad ba dag gis yang dag par yongs su bzung ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis theg pa chen por brtul ba las rang gi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: des na 'phags pa rab 'byor la lhag par mos pa rnams rjes su bzung ba dang / yongs su gtang gtad ba dag gis yang dag par yongs su bzung ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis theg pa chen por brtul ba las rang gi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Therefore, those who have special faith in the noble Subhuti are taken care of, and by means of being taken care of by the Tathagatas through the stages of being fully taken care of, etc., they are trained in the Mahayana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa'i mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa'i mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The power of the Tathagatas' skill in means is inconceivable.🔽For, although they are completely incapable, they are shown to be capable.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du mi nus pa yang ston to zhes mthu yang dag par mthong ba'i gdul bya rnams la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du mi nus pa yang ston to zhes mthu yang dag par mthong ba'i gdul bya rnams la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to benefit those to be trained who see this power correctly,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba bshad pa la ngag byin gyis rlob pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba bshad pa la ngag byin gyis rlob pa'i sgo nas /
translated: the explanation of the perfection of wisdom is blessed by speech.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor yid gzhan du yengs ba de la mngon du phyogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor yid gzhan du yengs ba de la mngon du phyogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to turn the mind of the noble Subhuti, who is distracted by other things, towards it,🔽the Blessed One spoke.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /🔽bos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /🔽bos par gyur pa'o //
translated: He was called.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te khyod spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te khyod spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti, you should be confident in teaching the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: chos ston pa'i skabs yin pas /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i skabs yin pas /
translated: This is because it is the occasion for teaching the Dharma.

original: yod pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: yod pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if it were to exist,

original: kye rab 'byor deng khyod kyi chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa thams cad mngon du gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: kye rab 'byor deng khyod kyi chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa thams cad mngon du gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, now you should manifest your special, complete knowledge of Dharma, meaning, etymologies, and confidence.

original: byang chub ces bya ba @18a * //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba @18a * //
translated: The term enlightenment

original: chos thams cad la ma chags pa rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa la sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la ma chags pa rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa la sems dpa' ste /
translated: is a hero with regard to all phenomena, complete in one's own purpose,

original: bsam pa gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' pa'o //
translated: and one who has that intention is a bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos kyang de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyang de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that śrāvakas would also be like that,

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said great being.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chen po la sems dpa' gang la yod pa de dag ni sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chen po la sems dpa' gang la yod pa de dag ni sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: Those who have the great perfection of the aim of others are the great beings.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i chen po nyid ni mu stegs pa'i skye bo dam pa la yang yod pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i chen po nyid ni mu stegs pa'i skye bo dam pa la yang yod pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: The greatness of the transformation is also found in the holy persons of the tīrthikas, so he says “bodhisattva.”

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: those bodhisattva great beings, having begun the perfection of wisdom,

original: skal pa grangs med pa dang po nges par 'byung zhing mos pas spyod pa rnam par 'phel ba bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpas sa phyogs gtsang mar skyil mo krung bcas te /
analyzed: skal pa grangs med pa dang po nges par 'byung zhing mos pas spyod pa rnam par 'phel ba bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpas sa phyogs gtsang mar skyil mo krung bcas te /
translated: in the first incalculable eon, having emerged and having increased the practice of devotion, having accumulated the collection of merit, the bodhisattva, in a clean place, having crossed the legs,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: having made the buddhas and bodhisattvas the object of observation,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul chos thams cad bdag med par ston par byed pa la rtsa ba'i sems kyis ming gi sgo nas yang dag par dmigs la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul chos thams cad bdag med par ston par byed pa la rtsa ba'i sems kyis ming gi sgo nas yang dag par dmigs la /
translated: In the system of the perfection of wisdom, which teaches that all phenomena are selfless, one should correctly observe the root mind by way of name.

original: rjes su dpyad pa'i sems kyis de nyid kyi tshig gi rab tu dbye ba le'u la sogs pa'i bye brag gis brtag par bya'o /
analyzed: rjes su dpyad pa'i sems kyis de nyid kyi tshig gi rab tu dbye ba le'u la sogs pa'i bye brag gis brtag par bya'o /
translated: One should investigate it with the subsequent discerning mind by way of the distinctions of chapters and so forth of the words of that root mind.

original: de nas bgrang bas mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi gnas skabs kyi dbye bas grangs gzung ba'i phyir dang / gzhal bas mngon par rtogs pa so so'i rang bzhin nges pa'i phyir dang / rtog pas sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de nas bgrang bas mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi gnas skabs kyi dbye bas grangs gzung ba'i phyir dang / gzhal bas mngon par rtogs pa so so'i rang bzhin nges pa'i phyir dang / rtog pas sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Then, in order to apprehend the number of the eight realizations by way of enumeration, in order to ascertain the nature of each realization by way of evaluation, in order to eliminate superimpositions and denials by way of conception,

original: nges par rtog pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'thad par byas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: nges par rtog pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'thad par byas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: and in order to make it tenable by way of direct perception and inference by way of definitive investigation, one should investigate the eight realizations by way of the four investigations.

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pa go rims bzhin du don med pa dang don dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bas yi ge la ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pa go rims bzhin du don med pa dang don dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bas yi ge la ste /
translated: Thus, by these four aspects, the perfection of wisdom is meaningless in terms of its individual and combined meanings, respectively.🔽

original: rnam pa 'di dag gis rnam par dpyod ba'i sems kyis dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gis rnam par dpyod ba'i sems kyis dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by these four aspects, the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be analyzed by the mind that analyzes with these aspects, respectively, as meaningless, meaningful, and both.

original: de'i 'og tu ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa'i mtshan ma nge nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis bzung la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa'i mtshan ma nge nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis bzung la /
translated: Then, having ascertained the signs of the analyzed object with the mind that apprehends those signs,

original: ji ltar brtags pa'i don nyid ming la dmigs par byed pa'i rtsa ba'i sems nyid du sdom pa'i sems nyid kyis bcug la /
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa'i don nyid ming la dmigs par byed pa'i rtsa ba'i sems nyid du sdom pa'i sems nyid kyis bcug la /
translated: one should focus the mind that is the root mind observing the name on just the object as it was analyzed.

original: don gang la rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba @18b de 'dun pa dang lhan cig pa'i re ba'i sems kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: don gang la rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba @18b de 'dun pa dang lhan cig pa'i re ba'i sems kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should cultivate that object with the mind of aspiration accompanied by aspiration, to which one is applying oneself.

original: de ltar na dang po thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes pa skye ba'i rim gyis /
translated: Thus, in the beginning, knowledge having the nature of hearing, contemplation, and meditation arises in sequence.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it realizes the exalted wisdom of omniscience,

original: pha rol te rab kyi mthar 'gro ba yin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa'o ;
analyzed: pha rol te rab kyi mthar 'gro ba yin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa'o ;
translated: it is a perfection, because it goes to the other shore, to the highest point.

original: ; de yang shes rab ces bya ba chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: ; de yang shes rab ces bya ba chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of the discernment of phenomena, is the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sgyu ma lta bu ni dngos yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sgyu ma lta bu ni dngos yin la /
translated: The nondual, illusion-like exalted wisdom of the Bhagavan Buddha is the actual perfection of wisdom.

original: de 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis na tshig dang ngag gi tshogs kyi gzhung dang / mthong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis na tshig dang ngag gi tshogs kyi gzhung dang / mthong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni btags pa'o //
translated: By virtue of being concordant with the attainment of that, the scriptural collections of statements and speech and the path characterized by seeing and so on are also called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: Moreover, the master Dignaga said:

original: shes rab pha rol tu phyin gnyis med //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol tu phyin gnyis med //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nondual exalted wisdom.

original: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs /
analyzed: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs /
translated: That exalted wisdom is the Tathagata.

original: bsgrub bya don de dang ldan pas //
analyzed: bsgrub bya don de dang ldan pas //
translated: Since it is endowed with that object to be accomplished,

original: gzhung lam dag la de sgra yin //
analyzed: gzhung lam dag la de sgra yin //
translated: it is the word for the path of the text.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de'i phyir de dang 'brel pa gzugs brnyan dang bral pa rnam pa gsum ka yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do zhes bya bar bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang 'brel pa gzugs brnyan dang bral pa rnam pa gsum ka yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do zhes bya bar bzung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the three aspects of the perfection of wisdom itself are free from the reflection that is related to that,

original: gtso bo las dbang du byas pas so //
analyzed: gtso bo las dbang du byas pas so //
translated: because it is governed by the principal one.

original: de rnams nyid kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not those themselves,

original: 'di med na mi 'byung bas byang chub gsum ka'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di med na mi 'byung bas byang chub gsum ka'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without this, the three enlightenments would not occur, and it is governed by them.

original: da yang 'di nyid las nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: da yang 'di nyid las nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Now, in this very text, it will be explained that even those who wish to train on the level of the śrāvakas should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on.

original: skyes bu'i don mchog gi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa rtogs pa'i tshul bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de la yang rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sa bon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don mchog gi rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa rtogs pa'i tshul bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de la yang rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sa bon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Because it is to be shown how the supreme human goal is realized in all its aspects, and because it is taught in the noble Array of Stalks that the thought of awakening is the seed

original: de nyid ni 'bras bur gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snying po yin no zhes 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'bras bur gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi snying po yin no zhes 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: and the very essence of all the qualities of buddhahood, which are the fruit.

original: ji ltar te gang gis gzhan gyi don la dmigs nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dbye ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis su phye ba'i byang chub kyi sems rtogs pa'i bye brag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab
analyzed: ji ltar te gang gis gzhan gyi don la dmigs nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dbye ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis su phye ba'i byang chub kyi sems rtogs pa'i bye brag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab
translated: So, by means of the various realizations of the thought of awakening, which is defined as the desire for perfect awakening, with the focus on the welfare of others, the bodhisattvas, the great beings, will

original: kyi @19a * //
analyzed: kyi @19a * //
translated: understand the perfection of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gsum char la yang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gsum char la yang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: And they will also attain the other two perfections.

original: nges par thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang rab tu dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: nges par thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang rab tu dbye ba yin la /
translated: The phrase “will definitely attain” indicates the essence and divisions of the generation of the resolve together with its object.

original: de'i dbye ba nyid ni mdo'i don yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de'i dbye ba nyid ni mdo'i don yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that its divisions are the meaning of the sutra,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa'i sgo nas /
translated: the Lord, through his discourse with Subhuti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mdor ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mdor ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: summarizes the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir ngag gi don mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ngag gi don mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the summary of the meaning of the text:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i bye brag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsum char yang ji ltar rigs pa'i thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i bye brag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsum char yang ji ltar rigs pa'i thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i
translated: The perfection of wisdom in all three of its forms is the generation of the knowledge that comes from hearing, etc., in accordance with the distinctions in the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s understanding of all the aspects of the thought of enlightenment.

original: rim gyis / yang dag par thob bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de rnams dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: rim gyis / yang dag par thob bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de rnams dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Just as they gradually attain the perfections, in the same way, beginning with the perfection of wisdom that is connected with them,

original: rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach it extensively,

original: rab 'byor so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mngon du gyis shig ces de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mngon du gyis shig ces de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the Lord said to the elder Subhuti, “Subhuti, manifest the four right discriminations.”

original: rgya cher ni /
analyzed: rgya cher ni /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows:

original: de la dang por rigs nus pas //
analyzed: de la dang por rigs nus pas //
translated: First, by the power of the potential,

original: snying rje'i sa bon rab sad cing //
analyzed: snying rje'i sa bon rab sad cing //
translated: the seed of compassion is awakened,

original: sbyor dang bsam pa phun tshogs pas //
analyzed: sbyor dang bsam pa phun tshogs pas //
translated: and by the perfection of application and intention,

original: byang chub sems ni yongs su bzung //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis rigs la sogs pa'i nus pas byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems ni yongs su bzung // zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis rigs la sogs pa'i nus pas byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa la sogs pas /
translated: the thought of awakening is fully taken up.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can gyi byang chub kyi sems bskyed la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can gyi byang chub kyi sems bskyed la /
translated: In this way, by the power of the potential and so forth, one should generate the thought of awakening, which is the essence of emptiness and compassion, through taking up the bodhisattva vows and so forth.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur nas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyi don du theg gsum gyis chos bstan pa la sogs pas 'bad par bya'o zhes smon par byas nas /🔽sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur nas skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyi don du theg gsum gyis chos bstan pa la sogs pas 'bad par bya'o zhes smon par byas nas / sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa yin te /
translated: Having become a perfect buddha, one should strive to benefit others according to their fortune by teaching the Dharma of the three vehicles and so forth.🔽Having made this aspiration, one should complete it with perfect practice.

original: 'go bar 'dod dang 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: 'go bar 'dod dang 'gro ba yi //
translated: This is the definition of the desire for perfect enlightenment that focuses on the benefit of others, together with its cause and result.

original: bye brag ji ltar shes pa bzhin //🔽de bzhin mkhas pas 'di gnyis kyi //
analyzed: bye brag ji ltar shes pa bzhin // de bzhin mkhas pas 'di gnyis kyi //
translated: Just as one knows the difference between🔽the one who wishes to go and the one who is going,🔽so the wise one should know the difference between these two

original: bye brag rim bzhin shes par bya //
analyzed: bye brag rim bzhin shes par bya //
translated: in the same order.

original: zhes bya bas smon pa dang 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems bskyed pa @19b rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas smon pa dang 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems bskyed pa @19b rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two types of generating the mind: the essence of aspiration and the essence of engagement.

original: spro ba che dang rtsom pa che //
analyzed: spro ba che dang rtsom pa che //
translated: Great enthusiasm, great undertaking,

original: don che ba dang 'byung ba che //
analyzed: don che ba dang 'byung ba che //
translated: great purpose, and great emergence

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems pa ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems pa ste //
translated: are the thoughts of the bodhisattva.

original: don gnyis ldan pa'i sems 'byung ba //
analyzed: don gnyis ldan pa'i sems 'byung ba //
translated: The mind possessing the two aims arises.

original: zhes bshad pas sems pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems yul khyad par can du snang ba skye ba sems bskyed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas sems pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems yul khyad par can du snang ba skye ba sems bskyed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Thus, is not the generation of the mind the arising of the mind endowed with intention, appearing as a special object?

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni de don du gnyer ba dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de sems bskyed pa yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni de don du gnyer ba dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de sems bskyed pa yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since the desire for perfect enlightenment is the mental factor of aspiration for virtue that seeks that goal, how can it be the generation of the mind?

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: 'on kyang 'gro ba mgon med pa sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtshor nub pa la mngon par bltas nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gro ba mgon med pa sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtshor nub pa la mngon par bltas nas /
translated: when one sees that beings are helpless and sinking in the ocean of suffering,

original: de gdon pa'i bsam pa'i dge bas chos la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don du gnyer ba yod na /
analyzed: de gdon pa'i bsam pa'i dge bas chos la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don du gnyer ba yod na /
translated: if one has the aspiration for virtue that seeks the goal of liberating them,🔽one generates the enlightenment mind in order to attain buddhahood.

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yin pas 'dir rgyus 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yin pas 'dir rgyus 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here the cause is taught as the result.

original: de ltar 'dun cing don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gdags pa la brten pa yang yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dun cing don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gdags pa la brten pa yang yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Thus, in order to show that the bodhisattva who is intent and desirous in this way increases all virtuous qualities, it is said that he is supported by his aspirational prayer.

original: yang na smon lam ni don du gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: yang na smon lam ni don du gnyer ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, aspirational prayer is the desire,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid yin la /🔽de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa ni de'i sgrar bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid yin la / de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa ni de'i sgrar bstan te /
translated: which is the wish for complete enlightenment.

original: don du gnyer ba gtso bor gyur pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba gtso bor gyur pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The generation of the thought that accompanies that is indicated by the word “aspiration” because the desire is the principal factor in the generation of the thought.

original: de ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la smon lam dang ldan pa'i sems de skye'o zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //🔽de nas gang 'dod pa'i bdag nyid dang / gang gi don du sems bskyed pa yang dag /
analyzed: de ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la smon lam dang ldan pa'i sems de skye'o zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //🔽de nas gang 'dod pa'i bdag nyid dang / gang gi don du sems bskyed pa yang dag /
translated: Thus, it is reasonable to say that the thought endowed with aspirational prayer arises in the bodhisattvas.🔽Then, the bodhisattva who has generated the thought in this way should train in the bodhisattva trainings.

original: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de dang / gzhan gyi don de gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de dang / gzhan gyi don de gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that perfect enlightenment and what is the benefit of others?

original: 'phags pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i mdo ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i mdo ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be stated just as it is in the Twenty-five Thousand.

original: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: There, the brief teaching of perfect enlightenment is this:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtsan par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtsan par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Śāriputra, here, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to all aspects of all dharmas should exert themselves in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la 'di'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the extensive teaching on that is this:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi gnas pa'i @20a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi gnas pa'i @20a * //
translated: Śāriputra, here, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, by way of non-abiding,

original: tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas ti /
analyzed: tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas ti /
translated: should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba dang len pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su btang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba dang len pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su btang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of generosity should be completed by the method of non-apprehending the giver, the gift, and the receiver.

original: de la gzhan gyi don bsdus te bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi don bsdus te bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The teaching of the benefit for others is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang zhig yod pa de dag thams cad phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang zhig yod pa de dag thams cad phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan
translated: A bodhisattva-mahāsattva who wishes to lead all sentient beings existing in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, to nirvāṇa without remainder,

original: las 'da' bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: las 'da' bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: to the realm of nirvāṇa, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The extensive teaching on that is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can ser sna can rnams ni sbyin pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can ser sna can rnams ni sbyin pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva wishes to establish stingy sentient beings in generosity,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams ni tshul khrims la /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams ni tshul khrims la /
translated: those with faulty morality in morality,

original: gnod sems mang ba rnams ni bzod pa la rab tu dgod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gnod sems mang ba rnams ni bzod pa la rab tu dgod par 'dod pas /
translated: and those with much malice in patience.🔽Therefore, he should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: sems bskyed ba ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: sems bskyed ba ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: The generation of the thought is for the sake of the aim of others,

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //🔽de dang de ni mdo bzhin du //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod // de dang de ni mdo bzhin du //
translated: the desire for perfect complete enlightenment.🔽That and that are expressed in brief and in detail

original: bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
analyzed: bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
translated: according to the sutras.

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And it is said:

original: de la de'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la de'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: The divisions of that are as follows.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po 'dun pa dang ldan pa ni sa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po 'dun pa dang ldan pa ni sa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The first generation of the thought of the bodhisattvas, endowed with aspiration, is like the earth,

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i tshogs rab tu bskyed pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i tshogs rab tu bskyed pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the generation of the stores of merit and knowledge for the full realization of all aspects of all dharmas.

original: gnyis pa bsam pa dang ldan pa ni gser bzang po lta bu yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa bsam pa dang ldan pa ni gser bzang po lta bu yin te /
translated: The second, endowed with the intention, is like good gold,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bstan pa'i tshe 'di dang phyi ma dag la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bstan pa'i tshe 'di dang phyi ma dag la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te ;
translated: because the intention for benefit and happiness in this life and the next, which is taught by the six perfections, is unchangeable until the full realization of enlightenment,

original: gnas pas na bsam pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gnas pas na bsam pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because it is the method called intention.

original: gsum pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi zla ba tshes pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi zla ba tshes pa lta bu yin te /
translated: The third, endowed with superior intention, is like the waxing moon on the virtuous side,

original: dge ba'i tshes thams cad gong nas gong du rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i tshes thams cad gong nas gong du rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because all the virtuous phases increase more and more,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba'i tshul @20b gyis so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba'i tshul @20b gyis so //
translated: because it is the method called superior intention.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis las dang po pa tshogs kyi sas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis las dang po pa tshogs kyi sas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These three are for beginners, and are included in the stage of the equipment, by reason of their small, middling, and great character.

original: bzhi pa sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni me lta bu ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni me lta bu ste /
translated: The fourth, endowed with application, is like fire.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba ni shing gzhan gyis me khyad par du 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar gong nas gong du 'gro ba'i phyir te mchog tu gyur pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba ni shing gzhan gyis me khyad par du 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar gong nas gong du 'gro ba'i phyir te mchog tu gyur pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The application to the three knowledges is like the fire of other wood, because it proceeds higher and higher, by the method of the term prabhāvita, which means “to be distinguished”.

original: 'di ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: This is connected with the stage of action in faith, which is included in the path of application to the first stage.

original: lnga pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni gter chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lnga pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni gter chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The fifth, endowed with the perfection of generosity, is like a great treasure.

original: zad zing gi longs spyod kyis rnam pa thams cad du tshad med pa'i sems can rnams yang dag par tshim par byed kyang mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad zing gi longs spyod kyis rnam pa thams cad du tshad med pa'i sems can rnams yang dag par tshim par byed kyang mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although he satisfies with wealth of every kind immeasurable beings, there is no end to beings.

original: drug pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang dra ste /
analyzed: drug pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang dra ste /
translated: The sixth, endowed with the perfection of morality, is like a mine of jewels,

original: rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yon tan rin po che thams cad de las skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yon tan rin po che thams cad de las skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all precious qualities are born from it by the very nature of the support.

original: bdun pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bdun pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The seventh, endowed with the perfection of patience, is like the great ocean,

original: mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not disturbed by any misfortune that befalls it.

original: brgyad pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: The eighth, endowed with the perfection of effort, is like a vajra,

original: yid ches pa brtan pas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa brtan pas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unshakable by the firm conviction.

original: dgu pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni ri'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: dgu pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni ri'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: The ninth is like the king of mountains,🔽

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas rnam pa thams cad du bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //🔽bcu pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni sman chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas rnam pa thams cad du bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // bcu pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni sman chen po lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of meditation is like a king of mountains, because it cannot be moved in any way by the distraction of objectification.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽bcu gcig pa thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro // bcu gcig pa thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like a great medicine, because it cures all the sicknesses of the addictions and the knowable.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //🔽bcu gnyis pa smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro // bcu gnyis pa smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ste /
translated: The perfection of means is like a spiritual friend, because it never abandons the welfare of sentient beings in any situation.

original: ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of vows is like a wish-granting gem, because it accomplishes the results wished for.🔽The perfection of powers is like a great lord, because it is never overcome by the addictions.🔽The perfection of knowledge is like a great fire, because it consumes the fuel of the addictions.

original: bcu gsum pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni nyi ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni nyi ma lta bu ste /
translated: The thirteenth, endowed with the perfection of strength, is like the sun,

original: gdul bya'i lo tog yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i lo tog yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it ripens the crop of those to be trained.

original: bcu bzhi pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni klu snyan pa sgrogs pa dang 'dra ste /🔽gdul bya 'dun par @21a * //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni klu snyan pa sgrogs pa dang 'dra ste / gdul bya 'dun par @21a * //
translated: The fourteenth, endowed with the perfection of intuition, is like a melodious nāga,

original: byed pa'i chos ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i chos ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the Dharma to attract those to be trained.

original: bcu po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcus bsdus te /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcus bsdus te /
translated: These ten are included in the ten stages, such as the Joyous,

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi spyod yul can yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi spyod yul can yin no //
translated: and are the objects of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: bco lnga ba mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po chen po lta bu yin te /
analyzed: bco lnga ba mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po chen po lta bu yin te /
translated: The fifteenth, endowed with the superknowledges, is like a great king,

original: mthu thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accomplishes the aims of others with unimpeded power.

original: bcu drug pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni bang mdzod lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu drug pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni bang mdzod lta bu ste /
translated: The sixteenth, endowed with the collections of merit and intuition, is like a treasury,🔽because it is the source of all desired objects.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a treasury, because it is the treasury of the many collections of merit and knowledge.

original: bcu bdun pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa ni lam chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcu bdun pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa ni lam chen po lta bu ste /
translated: The seventeenth, endowed with the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, is like a great road,

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all noble persons have gone and are going on it.

original: bco brgyad pa zhig nas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni bzhon pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bco brgyad pa zhig nas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni bzhon pa lta bu ste /
translated: The eighteenth, endowed with calm and insight, is like a vehicle,

original: zung 'jug tu 'gro bas na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du yang mi lhung bas bde blag tu 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zung 'jug tu 'gro bas na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du yang mi lhung bas bde blag tu 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it goes to the union of calm and insight, and so goes easily, not falling into either cyclic existence or nirvāṇa.

original: bcu dgu ba gzungs dang spobs pa ldan pa ni bkod ma'i chu dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bcu dgu ba gzungs dang spobs pa ldan pa ni bkod ma'i chu dang 'dra ste /
translated: The nineteenth, endowed with retention and eloquence, is like a river,🔽because it is a river of retention and eloquence.

original: rnam pa thams cad du chu 'dzin par byed cing mi zad par 'byin pa dang 'dra bar thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang bstan pa mthar thug pa med par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chu 'dzin par byed cing mi zad par 'byin pa dang 'dra bar thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang bstan pa mthar thug pa med par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a cloud that holds water in every way and pours it out inexhaustibly, because it holds the Dharma that has been heard and that has not been heard and pours it out in teaching without any final exhaustion.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa las khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa las khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These five are included in the bodhisattva path of distinction.

original: nyi shu pa chos kyi dga' ston dang ldan pa ni sgra snyan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: nyi shu pa chos kyi dga' ston dang ldan pa ni sgra snyan pa lta bu ste /
translated: The twenty-first, endowed with the feast of Dharma, is like a sweet sounding voice,

original: thar ba 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan par sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar ba 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan par sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it proclaims the Dharma sweetly to disciples who desire liberation.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang 'brel pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa'i sbyor pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang 'brel pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa'i sbyor pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is included in the bodhisattvas path of connection to the buddha stage.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa ni chu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa ni chu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra ste /
translated: The twenty-second, endowed with the path of single progress, is like a river,🔽because it is uninterrupted.

original: shes pa dang shes par bya ba mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas snying rje chen po dang thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyun mi 'chad bar gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes par bya ba mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas snying rje chen po dang thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyun mi 'chad bar gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has realized the sameness of consciousness and the object of consciousness, he performs the benefit of others without interruption of great compassion and of means and wisdom.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa'i dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa'i dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs thob pa yin no //
translated: This is the attainment of the stage of the actual basis included in the stage of Buddha.

original: nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ni sprin chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ni sprin chen po lta bu ste /
translated: The twenty-second, endowed with the Dharma body, is like a great cloud,

original: sprul ba'i skus dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun tu ston @21b pas sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul ba'i skus dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun tu ston @21b pas sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the performance of the benefit of sentient beings depends on it, since the emanation body manifests in the abode of Tushita and so forth.

original: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag po las zhus pas 'dul byas yongs su brtags pa'i sprul pa la sogs pa dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag po las zhus pas 'dul byas yongs su brtags pa'i sprul pa la sogs pa dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is also the object of the emanation body and so forth, which is the object of the examination of the disciples of the non-conceptual lord of the Tathagatas.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: It is included in the stage of the Buddha, which is the post-attainment of pure mundane gnosis.

original: de ltar na las dang po pa'i sa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar na las dang po pa'i sa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, it is included in the stages from the stage of the beginner

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyis bsdus pa yin no //🔽de bas na don rtogs pa'i go rims kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i go rims dang rab tu dbye pa 'di dag nyid yin gyi lhag pa yang ma yin mtshang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyis bsdus pa yin no // de bas na don rtogs pa'i go rims kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i go rims dang rab tu dbye pa 'di dag nyid yin gyi lhag pa yang ma yin mtshang ba yang ma yin /
translated: up to the stage of the Buddha.

original: go rims gzhan du bstan par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: go rims gzhan du bstan par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is just this order and division of the topics as they have been explained, in accordance with the order of the realization of the meaning. There is nothing more to be said, nor is there anything to be said in a different order.🔽Thus, it has been taught.

original: de ltar rim gyis sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis su phye ba rtog pa'i sgo nas ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum ka la zhes bya ba la sogs ba snga ma
analyzed: de ltar rim gyis sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis su phye ba rtog pa'i sgo nas ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum ka la zhes bya ba la sogs ba snga ma
translated: Thus, the division of the generation of the thought into twenty-two has been analyzed in terms of the conceptual. In whatever way, the bodhisattva, the great being, in the three kinds of perfection of wisdom, etc.,

original: bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: as before.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: Earth, gold, moon, fire,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: treasure, jewel mine, ocean,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
translated: diamond, mountain, medicine, friend, wish-fulfilling gem, sun, song,

original: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
analyzed: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
translated: king, treasure, highway,

original: bzhon ba bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: bzhon ba bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: vehicle, river,

original: sgra snyan chu po sprin rnams kyis //
analyzed: sgra snyan chu po sprin rnams kyis //
translated: musical instrument, river, cloud.

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽'di ni nges par so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' nas /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so // zhes gsungs pa yin no // 'di ni nges par so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' nas /
translated: These are the twenty-two.🔽This is definitely the classification of the bodhisattva stages, from the stage of ordinary beings up to the stage of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi dbye ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi dbye ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is a classification of the nature of cause and effect.

original: de ltar yang mdo sde'i rgyan las ;
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo sde'i rgyan las ;
translated: Thus, in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras,🔽it is said:

original: sems bskyed de ni sa rnams la //
analyzed: sems bskyed de ni sa rnams la //
translated: That generation of the mind is asserted to be

original: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
translated: on the stages of resolute intent, pure superior intention,

original: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: maturation, and likewise the elimination of obscurations.

original: de yi rtsa ba snying rjer 'dod //
analyzed: de yi rtsa ba snying rjer 'dod //
translated: Its root is asserted to be compassion.

original: rtag tu sems can phan par sems //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can phan par sems //
translated: Always having the thought to benefit sentient beings,

original: zhes bshad pas rgyu dang 'bras bu la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems bskyed pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas rgyu dang 'bras bu la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems bskyed pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin par bshad do //
translated: Thus it explains that the generation of the thought that has the nature of focusing on cause and effect is what is to be generated.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba byed na yang de bzhin du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba byed na yang de bzhin du bya ba yin te /
translated: If one were to make a division of it, one should do it in the same way.

original: gzhan du na rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba tsam gyis na de'i dbye ba rnam pa thams cad byas par mi 'gyur pas na dbye ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba tsam gyis na de'i dbye ba rnam pa thams cad byas par mi 'gyur pas na dbye ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, by the mere division of the cause, the division of it would not be made in every way, and so the division would not be complete.

original: zhes pa ni kha @22a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kha @22a * //
translated: This is the opinion of some.

original: cig gi'o // gzhan dag ni rgyal po chen po dang 'dra ba la sogs pa sems brgyad po nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sa las khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cig gi'o // gzhan dag ni rgyal po chen po dang 'dra ba la sogs pa sems brgyad po nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sa las khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the eight thoughts are like a great king, and so on, and are included in the special path of the bodhisattva stages.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba rnam pa thams cad du ston pa'i gzhung ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba las bstan pa yin pas 'dir ni gzhungs mangs kyis dogs nas shes byed nyid du ma bris so //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba rnam pa thams cad du ston pa'i gzhung ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba las bstan pa yin pas 'dir ni gzhungs mangs kyis dogs nas shes byed nyid du ma bris so //
translated: The treatise that teaches the divisions of the generation of the thought of enlightenment in every way is taught in the Twenty-five Thousand. Therefore, fearing prolixity, I have not written it here.

original: de ltar byas na 'dir ni mgo smos pa tsam gyis go ba mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su bzung ba'i phyir ston par bya ba la zhugs pa yin bas ma gsungs pa yin no//
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'dir ni mgo smos pa tsam gyis go ba mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rjes su bzung ba'i phyir ston par bya ba la zhugs pa yin bas ma gsungs pa yin no//
translated: If one does it this way, here one is engaged in teaching for the sake of those sentient beings who delight in a brief summary that understands by way of a mere mention of the head, and so it is not taught.

original: ji ltar du bshad pa'i don gyi dbye ba ni nges pa kho nar khong du chud par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar du bshad pa'i don gyi dbye ba ni nges pa kho nar khong du chud par bya ba yin te /
translated: One should understand that the divisions of the meaning of what has been explained are ascertained.

original: gang gi phyir mdo sde rin po che 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba'i don nye bar bsdu pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes sngar bshad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo sde rin po che 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba'i don nye bar bsdu pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes sngar bshad pa kho na'o //
translated: Because this precious Sutra is an introduction to the collection of the meaning of the Twenty-five Thousand Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, as was explained previously.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos //
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos //
translated: In this way, the master Dignaga says:

original: de ltar ji skad bshad rnams kyis //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad rnams kyis //
translated: Thus, by all that has been explained,

original: brgyad stong 'di don ma tshang med //
analyzed: brgyad stong 'di don ma tshang med //
translated: this Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines is complete.

original: 'dir gzhung bsdus pa yin 'dod de //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung bsdus pa yin 'dod de //
translated: Here, it is asserted that the text is concise,

original: don ni ji skad gsungs de nyid //
analyzed: don ni ji skad gsungs de nyid //
translated: but the meaning is just as it is explained.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Since all aspects are to be realized by the wisdom of the Tathagata,🔽the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la bdag nyid nus pa med pa ltar //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la bdag nyid nus pa med pa ltar //
translated: Just as one's own power is powerless,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa nyid kyis 'phags pa rab 'byor yang nus pa med par dogs pas 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus bskul ba tsam rtogs pas de'i byin gyis brlabs kyi mthu ma rig nas rtogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa nyid kyis 'phags pa rab 'byor yang nus pa med par dogs pas 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus bskul ba tsam rtogs pas de'i byin gyis brlabs kyi mthu ma rig nas rtogs par byed pa ni /
translated: and the noble Subhuti is powerless due to not abandoning the obscurations to be known, the noble Shariputra, realizing that he is merely urged, not knowing the power of the blessing of realization, asks to be taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then and so forth.

original: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rtog pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rtog pa skyes pa'o //
translated: In this way refers to the arising of the thoughts explained below.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is expressed by what and so forth.

original: ci zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The word “what” is a conceptual thought.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni rang dang 'brel par 'jug pa'i'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni rang dang 'brel par 'jug pa'i'o //
translated: “By oneself” means that it is engaged in connection with oneself.

original: de'i yul de la de'i gzhan gyis byas pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i yul de la de'i gzhan gyis byas pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin gyi /
translated: The object of that is not made by another, but

original: 'on kyang rang gi ste rang nyid kyis byas pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ste rang nyid kyis byas pa'i'o //
translated: rather it is made by oneself, by oneself.

original: shes rab ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of discriminating phenomena.

original: spobs pa ni rigs pa dang grol par smra ba'o //
analyzed: spobs pa ni rigs pa dang grol par smra ba'o //
translated: Eloquence is speaking logically and freely.

original: de gnyis kyi stobs ni thogs pa med pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi stobs ni thogs pa med pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: The power of those two is the ability to be unimpeded.

original: bskyed @22b pa ni sngon med pa byas pas so //🔽rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang brjod pa ni rang gi zhes bya ba ste /
