analyzed: bskyed @22b pa ni sngon med pa byas pas so // rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang brjod pa ni rang gi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Generation is the creation of what did not exist before.🔽It is also expressed in another way: “by oneself.”

original: 'dir yang bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, “by oneself” should be understood as “by one’s own.”

original: shes rab kyi spobs pa'i stobs gnas pa la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi spobs pa'i stobs gnas pa la /
translated: The power of wisdom and eloquence is

original: byin gyi rlabs kyis khyad par du byas pas ston par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyis khyad par du byas pas ston par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: manifested by the blessing of the state.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa'i don to 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa'i don to 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “or” indicates another position.

original: 'di snyam du sems pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is that he thinks:

original: thabs kyi khyad par ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas /
analyzed: thabs kyi khyad par ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas /
translated: The distinctive method is inconceivable,

original: brgya la 'dis sngon med pa'i ye shes zhig rtogs par gyur tam /
analyzed: brgya la 'dis sngon med pa'i ye shes zhig rtogs par gyur tam /
translated: so perhaps he has realized some unprecedented transcendent wisdom,

original: yang na sngar yod pa phul du byung par byas sam /
analyzed: yang na sngar yod pa phul du byung par byas sam /
translated: or perhaps he has enhanced the transcendent wisdom he already had,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs thob par gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs thob par gyur /
translated: or perhaps he has attained the empowerment of the Tathagata.

original: gzhan du na bdag dang 'dra ba 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis kyang nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag dang 'dra ba 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis kyang nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, even a noble Subhuti like me would not be able to do this.🔽He is the teacher because he is preeminent among those who abide in the absence of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ston pa yin no zhes kyang smra par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ston pa yin no zhes kyang smra par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But it cannot be said that he is the teacher because he is preeminent among those who abide in the absence of affliction.

original: bdag kyang shes rab dang ldan pa'i mchog nyid yin pa'i khyad par yod pas smra par nus pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang shes rab dang ldan pa'i mchog nyid yin pa'i khyad par yod pas smra par nus pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: I too am the foremost in possessing wisdom, so I am able to speak.🔽The activity of the concentration of non-affliction does not exist in the Teacher.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba ni ston pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba ni ston pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This is the thought of the noble Shariputra.

original: thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa srid pa yin yang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa srid pa yin yang /
translated: Although it is possible to have inconceivable skill in means,

original: dbang po rtul po nyid kyis na sngon med pa'i ye shes la sogs pa 'phral du skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po nyid kyis na sngon med pa'i ye shes la sogs pa 'phral du skyed par mi nus te /
translated: due to being of dull faculties, one is unable to immediately generate previously non-existent wisdom and so forth.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa phyi ma nyid ston pas /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa phyi ma nyid ston pas /
translated: Therefore, teaching the subsequent thought,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said then and so on.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi sems gtad na gzhan gyi sems shes kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi sems gtad na gzhan gyi sems shes kyi /
translated: When the minds of the Shravakas are focused, they know the minds of others,

original: gzhan du ma yin pas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba'i tshig gis sems ma gtang bar shes par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba'i tshig gis sems ma gtang bar shes par brjod pa yin no //
translated: but not otherwise. Therefore, by the phrase through the power of the Buddha, it is said that without directing the mind, they know.

original: de lta bu'i tshul ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Such a method has the nature of the three kinds of discernment explained above.

original: sems sam yang na shes rab la brten nas yongs su tshol ba'i yid kyi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sems sam yang na shes rab la brten nas yongs su tshol ba'i yid kyi brjod pa'o //
translated: It is mental verbalization that seeks by means of mind or wisdom.

original: de yang sems rtsing ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems rtsing ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa yin no //
translated: And it is discernment because it is coarse mind.

original: de zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni brjod ma thag pa'o //
translated: That means the immediately preceding.

original: kun rdzob tu de'i rjes su byed pa'i sems kyis shes nas 'chad par 'gyur pa 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de'i rjes su byed pa'i sems kyis shes nas 'chad par 'gyur pa 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Having understood it by means of a mind that conforms to the conventional, he spoke as follows.

original: smras pa de nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes @23a * //🔽bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa de nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes @23a * // bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He said, “Venerable Śāriputra, etc.

original: gang ci zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang ci zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whatever means🔽Sūtras, aphorisms, and prophecies,

original: mdo sde dbyangs bsnyad lung bstan dang // tshigs bcad ched brjod rtogs pa brjod //
analyzed: mdo sde dbyangs bsnyad lung bstan dang // tshigs bcad ched brjod rtogs pa brjod //
translated: Verses, special sayings, and narratives,🔽Accounts of the past, and also legends,🔽Extensive teachings, and also jātakas,

original: de ltar byung dang gleng gzhi dang // shin tu rgyas pa skyes rabs bcas //🔽gtan phab rmad du byung smos te //
analyzed: de ltar byung dang gleng gzhi dang // shin tu rgyas pa skyes rabs bcas // gtan phab rmad du byung smos te //
translated: And also instructions and marvels.

original: de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis gsung //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis gsung //
translated: Thus the twelve branches are taught.

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽de la smra pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa skyes pa las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de la smra pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa skyes pa las /
translated: Thus it is.

original: yongs su grol par bya ba'i don du gang gis 'don par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grol par bya ba'i don du gang gis 'don par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, “recitation” is that by which one recites, for the sake of complete liberation, from the arising of the knowledge that has hearing as its own nature.

original: ston pa ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa skyes pa las yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du gang gis don 'chad par byed pa'o //🔽nye bar ston pa ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes ba skye la /
analyzed: ston pa ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa skyes pa las yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du gang gis don 'chad par byed pa'o // nye bar ston pa ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes ba skye la /
translated: “Teaching” is that by which one explains the meaning, for the sake of complete ripening, from the arising of the knowledge that has reflection as its own nature.

original: yongs su grol par bya ba'i don du gang gis gzhung dang don la nges pa skyes pas rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grol par bya ba'i don du gang gis gzhung dang don la nges pa skyes pas rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
translated: “Demonstration” is that by which one teaches, from the arising of the knowledge that has meditation as its own nature, for the sake of complete liberation, having generated certainty in the text and meaning.

original: des na de ltar brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du smra ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du smra ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the three phrases beginning with “expression” correspond respectively to the explanations beginning with “recitation.”

original: skyes bu'i mthu ni byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i mthu ni byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The power of the person is blessed.

original: de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir smra ba la sogs pa de thams cad la nye bar brtags nas skyes bu'i mthu zhes bya ba'i sgras bshad do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir smra ba la sogs pa de thams cad la nye bar brtags nas skyes bu'i mthu zhes bya ba'i sgras bshad do //
translated: and because it is the cause of that, all of that, such as speaking, etc., is explained by the word “power of the person” after having been examined.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis kyang rang gis rtogs pa'i chos nyid ni mngon sum du byas ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis kyang rang gis rtogs pa'i chos nyid ni mngon sum du byas ba ma yin nam /
translated: But did not the śrāvakas also realize the reality that they themselves had understood?

original: ci'i phyir de rang gi nus pas smra ba la sogs pa thams cad byed pa ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rang gi nus pas smra ba la sogs pa thams cad byed pa ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Why is it that all of that, such as speaking, etc., is not done by their own power?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rang nyid kyis dri ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rang nyid kyis dri ba byas pa yin no //
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he asks himself, “Why is that?”

original: kha cig ni gzhan gyis byas bar gyur na snying mi tshim pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan gyis byas bar gyur na snying mi tshim pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that if it were done by another, there would be the fault of dissatisfaction, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni de'i rjes thogs su rgyun chad pa'i nyes pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jigs pas 'dri bar mi nus pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / sems rtse gcig par byas pa rnams tshig gi spyod lam las nyams pa'i phyir rnam par g-yengs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de'i rjes thogs su rgyun chad pa'i nyes pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jigs pas 'dri bar mi nus pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / sems rtse gcig par byas pa rnams tshig gi spyod lam las nyams pa'i phyir rnam par g-yengs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The first question is asked in order to abandon the fault of interruption immediately after the other, the second question is asked in order to benefit those who are unable to ask due to fear, and the third question is asked in order to abandon the fault of distraction for those who have one-pointed minds, due to the fault of distraction in verbal conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: The answer is The Dharma that the Tathagata has taught... and so on.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i chos brjod par bya ba'i don de la ste yod par gyur pa la slob pa na /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i chos brjod par bya ba'i don de la ste yod par gyur pa la slob pa na /
translated: The meaning to be expressed in the Dharma that is taught through the realization of the factors conducive to penetration, that is, the existing Dharma, when one is training in it,

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pas rtogs pa'i chos @23b nyid de mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pas rtogs pa'i chos @23b nyid de mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: is realized by attaining the path of seeing, and is actualized.

original: bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pas 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pas 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is grasped by realizing the path of cultivation.

original: rtogs pa'i don gyi yul can bshad pa'i chos mdo sde la sogs pa de thams cad rtogs pa'i chos nyid dang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don gyi yul can bshad pa'i chos mdo sde la sogs pa de thams cad rtogs pa'i chos nyid dang mi 'gal te /
translated: The Dharma of realization is the object of realization. The Dharma of scripture, the sutras, etc., is the means of realization. All of that is not in contradiction with the reality of realization,

original: de dang mi 'gal bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mi 'gal bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches without contradicting that reality.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos de dag lung 'bogs par byed pa'i mdo sde la sogs ba lung gi chos gang yin pa de dag rtogs pa'i chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos de dag lung 'bogs par byed pa'i mdo sde la sogs ba lung gi chos gang yin pa de dag rtogs pa'i chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the Dharma of scripture, the sutras, etc., which are the means of realization for those sravakas, is not in contradiction with the reality of realization.

original: lung 'bogs pa nye bar ston pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa nye bar ston pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the means of realization is the indication of the means of realization.

original: smra ba dang ston par byed pa yang bzung ste /
analyzed: smra ba dang ston par byed pa yang bzung ste /
translated: It is also the teaching and the expression of the means of realization.

original: de ltar skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the case here.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
translated: This is the outflow of the Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'di ni nye bar brtags nas skyes bu'i byed par bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar brtags nas skyes bu'i byed par bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the teaching of the activity of the person, which is indicated.

original: 'dra bar 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra bar 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: The arising of the similar is the outflow.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is the effect of conformity.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: This is what is taught by this.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang bral pas rtogs pa'i don gyi yul la yang ;
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang bral pas rtogs pa'i don gyi yul la yang ;
translated: They are devoid of the skillful means of remaining in a state of constant meditative equipoise.🔽

original: rang gi rtogs pa dang mi 'gal bar ston par mi nus na /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa dang mi 'gal bar ston par mi nus na /
translated: Because they are always devoid of the skillful means of meditative equipoise, they are unable to teach the object of realization without contradicting their own understanding.

original: ma rtogs pa'i don gyi yul la lta smos kyang ci dogs /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i don gyi yul la lta smos kyang ci dogs /
translated: What need is there to mention their inability to teach the object that is not realized?

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid yin par bstan to zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid yin par bstan to zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is taught to be the power of the Buddha alone.

original: de ltar yang /🔽rang gi rtogs pa'i rjes 'brang bas //
analyzed: de ltar yang / rang gi rtogs pa'i rjes 'brang bas //
translated: In this way,🔽how can one fathom

original: ji tsam zhig ni dpag par nus //
analyzed: ji tsam zhig ni dpag par nus //
translated: the extent of the Buddha's realization?

original: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur ba //
analyzed: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur ba //
translated: The cause of that which has arisen from skillful means is hidden,

original: de bshad par ni dka' ba yin //
analyzed: de bshad par ni dka' ba yin //
translated: and it is difficult to explain.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dpags nas bstan par nus pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dpags nas bstan par nus pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is not possible to teach by inferring through this method.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs nas /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs nas /
translated: Having completed the digression,

original: da ni de ltar byang chub kyi sems dang po la sogs pa bskyed pa dus ji lta ba bzhin du don du gnyer bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos la slob pas bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa na /🔽bsam gtan la thob mngon par shes //
analyzed: da ni de ltar byang chub kyi sems dang po la sogs pa bskyed pa dus ji lta ba bzhin du don du gnyer bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos la slob pas bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa na / bsam gtan la thob mngon par shes //
translated: By means of the doors of meditative absorption,🔽he attains the superknowledges.

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas te //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas te //
translated: By means of the doors of meditative absorption, he attains the superknowledges.

original: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
translated: He goes to the various worlds

original: mchod pa'i phyir dang mnyan pa'i phyir //🔽'jig rten khams ni rnams su 'gro //🔽'dis ni sangs rgyas dpag med la //
analyzed: mchod pa'i phyir dang mnyan pa'i phyir // 'jig rten khams ni rnams su 'gro // 'dis ni sangs rgyas dpag med la //
translated: in order to worship and listen🔽to the immeasurable buddhas.🔽By this, for immeasurable eons,

original: bskal dpag med gyur bsnyen bkur byas //
analyzed: bskal dpag med gyur bsnyen bkur byas //
translated: he serves the immeasurable buddhas.

original: de la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir //
translated: By serving them,

original: sems ni las rung mchog tu gyur //
analyzed: sems ni las rung mchog tu gyur //
translated: his mind becomes supremely fit.

original: zhes bya bas sems las su rung ba nyid kyi stobs kyis gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo @24a * //
analyzed: zhes bya bas sems las su rung ba nyid kyi stobs kyis gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo @24a * //
translated: By the power of mental fitness, his stability is by means of the door of meditative absorption.

original: nas ; de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni //
analyzed: nas ; de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni //
translated: At that time, in the stream of Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas rnams la zhi gnas dang // ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la zhi gnas dang // ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir //
translated: pristine wisdom, the buddhas

original: gdams ngag rgya chen rnyed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gdams ngag rgya chen rnyed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: will find extensive instructions.🔽In this way, the bodhisattva who is engaged in the perfection of wisdom🔽will attain the extensive instructions of the buddhas.🔽The instruction on the meaning connected with the bodhisattva who is

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i don gyi gdams ngag ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i don gyi gdams ngag ni /
translated: engaged in the perfection of wisdom is as follows.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: The noble Subhūti, having first recited the words of the Buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: said, “Blessed One, what is the meaning of the term ‘bodhisattva’?🔽”

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don 'di la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don 'di la /
translated: The meaning of the term “bodhisattva” is as follows.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis byang chub la dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub kyang yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis byang chub la dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub kyang yin la /
translated: Because of the power of wisdom, one is focused on enlightenment, and🔽because of the intention of great compassion, one is focused on sentient

original: snying rje chen po'i bsam pas sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir sems dpa' yang yin pas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad de /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i bsam pas sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir sems dpa' yang yin pas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad de /
translated: beings. Therefore, it is explained that one is a bodhisattva.

original: dper na mi gtsang ba la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mi gtsang ba zhes zer ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang ba la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mi gtsang ba zhes zer ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like calling a concentration that has an impure object an “impurity.

original: gnas gzhan dag tu bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba rnams kyang bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bzlas te brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan dag tu bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba rnams kyang bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bzlas te brjod pa yin no //
translated: ” The bodhisattvas mentioned in other scriptures are also mentioned here in order to be included.

original: chos gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes bya ba ni don dam par brtags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang gi tshig bla dgas te /
analyzed: chos gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes bya ba ni don dam par brtags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang gi tshig bla dgas te /
translated: “The name of any dharma” means the name of any entity that is imagined ultimately, etc.

original: mngon du byas nas bstan pa lags /
analyzed: mngon du byas nas bstan pa lags /
translated: “Having realized it, I teach it.”

original: 'on kyang gang gi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “However, it is not the name of anything at all.”

original: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “It is just so, Śāriputra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: I do not see that dharma called a bodhisattva.

original: de kho na nyid du brtags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo gdams par bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du brtags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo gdams par bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity that is imagined in reality, etc., as something to be instructed is not apprehended.

original: de lta na yang gdams ngag gi yul ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gdams ngag gi yul ni yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say, The object of instruction exists,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the Bhagavān says, “It is like this,” and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgrub pa la sogs pa chos rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgrub pa la sogs pa chos rnam pa bcu'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom has the nature of ten dharmas such as practice.

original: 'di ltar gdams pa'i yul gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdams pa'i yul gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, with regard to the object of instruction,

original: stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: in the Twenty-five Thousand,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: it says, “Bhagavān, how should bodhisattva mahāsattvas train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la @24b sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la @24b sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Śāriputra, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not see that name, and so on.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The dharmas of bodhisattvas” means

original: chos gang la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas su byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas su byas pa'o //
translated: The term “bodhisattva” is applied to any dharma.

original: chos de ma 'tshal ba ni thos pas so //
analyzed: chos de ma 'tshal ba ni thos pas so //
translated: One does not understand that dharma through hearing.

original: ma dmigs pa ni bsam pas so //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa ni bsam pas so //
translated: One does not apprehend it through reflection.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba ni bsgom bas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba ni bsgom bas so //
translated: One does not see it perfectly through meditation.

original: yang na so sor nges pa'i don dang lhan cig nye pa'i rgyu med pas /
analyzed: yang na so sor nges pa'i don dang lhan cig nye pa'i rgyu med pas /
translated: Or else, because there is no cause for the definite meaning that is proximate,

original: rnam pa med pa'i shes pas ma 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i shes pas ma 'tshal ba'o //
translated: one does not understand it through a cognition that is without aspects.

original: dngos po med du zin kyang rmi lam la sogs par 'byung ba srid pas rnam pa dang bcas pas ma dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med du zin kyang rmi lam la sogs par 'byung ba srid pas rnam pa dang bcas pas ma dmigs pa'o //
translated: Even though it is non-existent, it is possible that it occurs in dreams and so forth. Therefore, one does not apprehend it through an aspect that is existent.

original: de nyid kyis na gnyi ga yang dag par rjes sum mthong na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu po gang la dang po thob pa'i yon tan yongs su bsrung pa'i don gyis yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i🔽phyir bslab pas gdams par bgyi zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gnyi ga yang dag par rjes sum mthong na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu po gang la dang po thob pa'i yon tan yongs su bsrung pa'i don gyis yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i🔽phyir bslab pas gdams par bgyi zhing /
translated: By that very fact, when one does not see perfectly both, one should be instructed with respect to the ten aspects such as the practice of the perfection of wisdom, in order to guard the qualities of the first attainment and so forth, in order to not fall away.

original: de nas phyis ma thob pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir rjes su bstan par bgyi ste /
analyzed: de nas phyis ma thob pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir rjes su bstan par bgyi ste /
translated: Then, in order to attain the qualities not yet attained, there is instruction.

original: de kho na nyid du na rnam pa thams cad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na rnam pa thams cad ma yin gyi /
translated: In reality, it is not in all aspects,🔽but rather the instruction is in the conventional expression.

original: 'on kyang gdams ngag ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu yin no zhes don gyis 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gdams ngag ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu yin no zhes don gyis 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is implied in the meaning.

original: de ltar yang 'di skad du 'di nyid gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'di skad du 'di nyid gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And thus, it is said: “This is the instruction and the teaching,” and so on, which will be explained immediately below.

original: de yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa bcur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa bcur shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be known as tenfold, according to the division of the objects.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa sgrub pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' ba mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya'o zhes slob pa ni sgrub pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa sgrub pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' ba mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya'o zhes slob pa ni sgrub pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: Therein, the instruction in practice is: “One should practice the differentiation of the Thought of Enlightenment as it has been explained, by way of non-apprehension, in the uncommon practice of the Sravakas, etc., and by way of non-apprehension, in the non-transgression of the conventional and the ultimate truths.”

original: sdug bsngal la gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i stong ba nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba la stong ba nyid dang rgyur gyur ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa'i stong ba nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba la stong ba nyid dang rgyur gyur ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyis /
translated: Origination is the same nature as form and so on, which are the cause of emptiness, because they are not different.🔽Form and so on are not phenomena of origination, cessation, defilement and purification.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni kun 'byung pa dang 'gog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'gog pa la stong ba nyid skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang @25a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni kun 'byung pa dang 'gog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'gog pa la stong ba nyid skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang @25a * //
translated: Cessation is the same nature as emptiness, because it is free from arising and cessation, defilement and purification,🔽deterioration and enhancement and so on.

original: nyams pa dang 'phel pa la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni gzugs med pa nas ma rig pa skye ba yang med /
analyzed: nyams pa dang 'phel pa la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni gzugs med pa nas ma rig pa skye ba yang med /
translated: Form does not arise from ignorance up to🔽old age and death.

original: ma rig pa 'gag pa yang med /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gag pa yang med /
translated: Ignorance does not cease up to🔽old age and death do not cease.

original: sangs rgyas kyang med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang med /
translated: There is no buddha.

original: byang chub kyi bar du yang med do zhes bya ba dang / lam la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ; bdag nyid dam nang stong ba la sogs pa ni phyi stong ba nyid la sogs pa dang lhan cig dang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag phan tshun du ldan pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub po zhes ston pa bden pa la
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du yang med do zhes bya ba dang / lam la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang ; bdag nyid dam nang stong ba la sogs pa ni phyi stong ba nyid la sogs pa dang lhan cig dang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag phan tshun du ldan pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub po zhes ston pa bden pa la
translated: and in the path, generosity and so on, the perfections, the self or inner emptiness and so on, are not mutually concomitant or not concomitant with outer emptiness and so on, and the earlier and later limits.🔽and the Buddha advised him:

original: gdams pa dang / sangs rgyas la sangs rgyas dang byang chub dag mtshan nyid gcig la nyid kyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pa mi sbyor bas /
analyzed: gdams pa dang / sangs rgyas la sangs rgyas dang byang chub dag mtshan nyid gcig la nyid kyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pa mi sbyor bas /
translated: “The Buddha and enlightenment have the same characteristic, and the characteristic of the phenomenon that causes one to become a buddha is the knowledge of all aspects. Since one does not observe that, one does not connect form and so on with it.”

original: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid du shes ba zhes bya ba dang / chos la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus ba bzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa mtha' dag bsdus pas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba dang /🔽dge 'dun la sangs rgyas dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyis dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i bye brag gis /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid du shes ba zhes bya ba dang / chos la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus ba bzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa mtha' dag bsdus pas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba dang / dge 'dun la sangs rgyas dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyis dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa 'bras bu la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i bye brag gis /
translated: The Dharma is the four truths subsumed by the three knowledges of the buddhas, the Dharma subsumed by the antidotes and all aspects and all subsumed phenomena are the essence.🔽The Sangha is the seven great beings together with the pratyekabuddhas, the eight who are divided into twenty by the categories of duller and sharper faculties and so on.

original: skyes bu chen po bdun po rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig brgyad po dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis grangs nyi shur chad pa byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa slob pa phyir mi ldog pa rnams la skye ba med par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po bdun po rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig brgyad po dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis grangs nyi shur chad pa byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa slob pa phyir mi ldog pa rnams la skye ba med par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are aryas in training and are irreversible should enter into the nonarising of these.

original: zhes lung 'bogs pa dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa dang ; brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan du byed pa la lus la sogs pa'i bsod nams nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur pas /
analyzed: zhes lung 'bogs pa dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa dang ; brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan du byed pa la lus la sogs pa'i bsod nams nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur pas /
translated: The instruction in non-attachment to the body, etc., since one would become attached to the very merit of the body, etc.

original: ma zhen pa la lus la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med par ston pa'i gdams pa dang / dus yun ring mo zhig tu goms par byas kyang 'dod pa'i don ma grub na dngang ba'i rang bzhin can yongs su skyo bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ma zhen pa la lus la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med par ston pa'i gdams pa dang / dus yun ring mo zhig tu goms par byas kyang 'dod pa'i don ma grub na dngang ba'i rang bzhin can yongs su skyo bar 'gyur bas /
translated: The instruction in the absence of weariness, etc., up to the absence of conceit in perfect enlightenment, since one would become weary, having a nature of fear, if one did not accomplish the desired aim even though one had cultivated for a long time.

original: yongs su ngal ba med pa la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i gdams pa dang / phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs @25b pa la don re re'i phyir lam gyi lung mnos par bya na sems zhum par 'gyur pas /
analyzed: yongs su ngal ba med pa la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i gdams pa dang / phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs @25b pa la don re re'i phyir lam gyi lung mnos par bya na sems zhum par 'gyur pas /
translated: The instruction in the absence of conceit in the request for the scriptures of the path for each aim from the Buddhas, etc., who dwell in the ten directions, since one would become faint-hearted.

original: lam yongs su bzung ba la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du slob pa'i gdams pa dang / sha'i spyan dang rnam par smin pa las byung pa lha'i dang / shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: lam yongs su bzung ba la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du slob pa'i gdams pa dang / sha'i spyan dang rnam par smin pa las byung pa lha'i dang / shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: As for the path, the instructions for training in the fact that phenomena are by nature unborn and the three eyes the fleshly eye, the divine eye that arises from the maturation of karma and the eye of wisdom, the eye of Dharma and the eye of buddhahood are established as being the same in suchness.

original: dngos po so sor nges pa thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dang / chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa'i yul can rnams de bzhin nyid du gcig pa nyid du bsgrub po //
analyzed: dngos po so sor nges pa thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dang / chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa'i yul can rnams de bzhin nyid du gcig pa nyid du bsgrub po //
translated: All the different things, the deaths, transitions and rebirths of all sentient beings, the nonconceptuality with regard to all phenomena and the realization of all the noble beings and the objects of complete enlightenment with regard to all phenomena in all its aspects are established as being the same in suchness.

original: zhes slob pa spyan lnga la gdams pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba lha'i mig dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa /
analyzed: zhes slob pa spyan lnga la gdams pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba lha'i mig dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa /
translated: This is advice to the learner on the five eyes, and on the superknowledges of magical power, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, recollection of past lives, and divine eye arisen from formative force, and the superknowledge of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: rnams grangs bzhin du sa g-yo ba la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i sgra chung du dang cig shos thos pa dang / gzhan gyis sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma rjes su dran pa dang ;
analyzed: rnams grangs bzhin du sa g-yo ba la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i sgra chung du dang cig shos thos pa dang / gzhan gyis sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma rjes su dran pa dang ;
translated: They are, respectively, the shaking of the earth and so on, hearing the small and great sounds that abide in all the world systems, knowing the minds of others that are associated with attachment and so on, recollecting one's own and others' former lives, and seeing the death and rebirth of sentient beings.

original: gzugs thams cad mthong ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa rnams gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes ston pa mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa dang / mthong ba'i lam la bden pa bzhis bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid ;
analyzed: gzugs thams cad mthong ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa rnams gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes ston pa mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa dang / mthong ba'i lam la bden pa bzhis bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid ;
translated: The path of seeing has the nature of sixteen moments subsumed by the four truths.

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa'i bdag nyid can la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i lus can gyi rnal 'byor pa des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rnam par sgom par
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa'i bdag nyid can la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i lus can gyi rnal 'byor pa des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rnam par sgom par
translated: The yogi who has a body that is the nature of the patience and knowledge of the dharma and subsequent [realizations], who realizes that all phenomena are essenceless, and who is like a magician, without clinging to anything, meditates on the antidote to the objects of abandonment.

original: byed do ; ; zhes ston pa mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo nyid gcig ba nyid kyis phan tshun tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: byed do ; ; zhes ston pa mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo nyid gcig ba nyid kyis phan tshun tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as conditioned and unconditioned phenomena cannot be mutually designated as different because they are of the same nature,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa la dmigs @26a * //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po dang tha mi dad pa la dmigs @26a * //
translated: because it focuses on the object directly perceived by the path of seeing, as explained above, it is not different from the path of seeing.

original: pa'i phyir / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag tha dad du gyur pa med pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa rnam par gzhag pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag tha dad du gyur pa med pas bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa rnam par gzhag pa ni med kyi /
translated: Therefore, there is no actual path of meditation,

original: 'on kyang de ni des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid du rnam par bsgom pa'i lam la gdams pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen po nyid du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid du rnam par bsgom pa'i lam la gdams pa ste /
translated: but it is an instruction on the path of meditation that is the antidote to the object of elimination by that path, meditating on the reality of dependent origination.

original: de ltar na gdams ngag bcu po 'di ni 'dir gzhung nyung ba nyid du 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgras gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gdams ngag bcu po 'di ni 'dir gzhung nyung ba nyid du 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgras gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these ten instructions are stated by the word perfection of wisdom here because they are considered to be few in the treatise.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: Thus, in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines,

original: gdams ngag re re'i gzhung gsal po kho nar bstan te /
analyzed: gdams ngag re re'i gzhung gsal po kho nar bstan te /
translated: each instruction is clearly taught in the treatise.

original: gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas shes par byed pa nyid du ni ma bris so //
analyzed: gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas shes par byed pa nyid du ni ma bris so //
translated: Fearing excessive length, I have not written it down for the purpose of understanding.

original: de lta bu'i gdams ngag des ji lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' la gdams par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gdams ngag des ji lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' la gdams par bya zhe na /
translated: By what kind of instruction should a bodhisattva be instructed by such an instruction?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The Blessed One said, Nevertheless... and so on.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad ni de ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad ni de ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word if means if that is so.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the non-apprehension of the bodhisattva and the perfection of wisdom.

original: gdams pa'i yul rnam bcur smras pa la sems mi 'gong zhing spa mi 'gong ste /
analyzed: gdams pa'i yul rnam bcur smras pa la sems mi 'gong zhing spa mi 'gong ste /
translated: He is not discouraged and does not become discouraged when the instructions are given to the ten objects.

original: gang gi phyir bag mi tsha ba ste mi rmongs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bag mi tsha ba ste mi rmongs pas so //
translated: He is not confused, because he is not confused about the instructions.

original: de nyid kyis na dad pa nyid kyis chos la bsten pa yin pa'i phyir de dang por gnas med pa'i 'jigs pas mi dngang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dad pa nyid kyis chos la bsten pa yin pa'i phyir de dang por gnas med pa'i 'jigs pas mi dngang ngo //
translated: For that very reason, because of his faith, he relies on the teaching, so he is not frightened by the fear of the groundlessness that comes first.

original: bstan pa la kun tu zhum zhing snyom las mi byed de /
analyzed: bstan pa la kun tu zhum zhing snyom las mi byed de /
translated: He does not become timid and lazy about the teaching.🔽He does not become timid,

original: gang gi phyir bag 'khums par mi 'gyur pa ste /🔽sngar ma'i ngo bor mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bag 'khums par mi 'gyur pa ste / sngar ma'i ngo bor mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: because he does not become fainthearted.

original: de nyid kyis na shes rab dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na shes rab dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For that very reason, because he is endowed with wisdom,

original: de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyi nang du kun tu 'jigs pas kun tu mi skrag go //🔽nye bar bstan pa la de'i yid phyir phyogs par mi byed cing 'gyod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyi nang du kun tu 'jigs pas kun tu mi skrag go // nye bar bstan pa la de'i yid phyir phyogs par mi byed cing 'gyod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: he is not frightened by the fear of the company of those who know reality.🔽He does not turn away from the teaching and does not become regretful.

original: gang gi phyir sems nyid ni yid de bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems nyid ni yid de bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur pa ste /
translated: He does not turn away from the teaching and become regretful, because his mind is not crushed.

original: phyis sems bcom par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phyis sems bcom par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: because later on, the mind will not be destroyed.

original: de nyid kyis na dad pa dang shes rab dag dang ldan pas tha mar kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dad pa dang shes rab dag dang ldan pas tha mar kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: And because of that, he is endowed with faith and wisdom, and so in the end he is not frightened.

original: thams cad du ma nges pa'i skrag pas skrag par mi 'gyur ro //🔽yang na smras pa la sogs pa'i dus su go rims bzhin du gzhung dang don gnyis ka nges par 'dzin pas /
analyzed: thams cad du ma nges pa'i skrag pas skrag par mi 'gyur ro // yang na smras pa la sogs pa'i dus su go rims bzhin du gzhung dang don gnyis ka nges par 'dzin pas /
translated: He is not frightened by the fear of uncertainty in all cases.

original: mi 'gong kun tu mi zhum bag mi tsha'o //
analyzed: mi 'gong kun tu mi zhum bag mi tsha'o //
translated: Or else, at the time of speaking, etc., he is not puffed up, does not shrink, and is not embarrassed, because he has ascertained both the text and the meaning, respectively.

original: de ci'i @26b phyir zhe na /🔽gang gis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar rang gi yul gyi don yongs su bcad pa las /🔽bag 'khums bar mi 'gyur 'di'i yid phyir phyogs par mi bgyid /
analyzed: de ci'i @26b phyir zhe na / gang gis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar rang gi yul gyi don yongs su bcad pa las / bag 'khums bar mi 'gyur 'di'i yid phyir phyogs par mi bgyid /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur bas so //🔽de nyid kyis na thog ma dang bar dang tha mar /
analyzed: bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur bas so // de nyid kyis na thog ma dang bar dang tha mar /
translated: Because he is not timid, his mind does not turn away, and he is not destroyed and turned away, since he has ascertained the meaning of his domain without contradicting the authorities of direct perception, inference, and scriptural testimony.🔽And because of that, he is not afraid, does not tremble, and is not terrified,

original: mi dngang / mi skrag /
analyzed: mi dngang / mi skrag /
translated: in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One does not become frightened.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba la mkhas pas ji skad du bshad pa'i gdams ngag la sems zhum pa la sogs pa dang bral ba de'i de kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba la mkhas pas ji skad du bshad pa'i gdams ngag la sems zhum pa la sogs pa dang bral ba de'i de kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This itself is the meaning of reality for the bodhisattva who, by means of the skill in the differentiation of the conventional and the ultimate, is free from the depression of mind, etc. with regard to the instructions as they have been explained.

original: 'di nyid ces bya bas mtshan nyid ma smras par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya bas mtshan nyid ma smras par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, How does one apprehend the perfection of wisdom without stating its characteristics?

original: brjod pa don gang smras pa la sogs pa na sems zhum pa la sogs par mi byed pa'i don de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu yin par brjod zin te /
analyzed: brjod pa don gang smras pa la sogs pa na sems zhum pa la sogs par mi byed pa'i don de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu yin par brjod zin te /
translated: It is said that the meaning of the statement, One does not become depressed, etc. with regard to the meaning that is expressed, is the ten aspects of the perfection of wisdom, such as accomplishment, etc.

original: des na don gyis 'phangs pa bzung ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des na don gyis 'phangs pa bzung ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since one apprehends the perfection of wisdom by means of the meaning that is implied, there is no fault.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Summary is stated by If, etc.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de bshad ma thag pa'i gdams pas ji skad du bshad pa'i yul la gnas pa dang ldan par gyur na de'i tshe 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' de'i don du gnyer ba'i don thob par byed pa'i nye bar bstan pa gdams pa
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de bshad ma thag pa'i gdams pas ji skad du bshad pa'i yul la gnas pa dang ldan par gyur na de'i tshe 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' de'i don du gnyer ba'i don thob par byed pa'i nye bar bstan pa gdams pa
translated: If the bodhisattva becomes endowed with abiding in the object as just explained through the instructions, then this is the instruction and the teaching that causes the bodhisattva to attain the goal that is to be pursued.

original: dang rjes su bstan pa lags so zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang rjes su bstan pa lags so zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the instruction and the teaching.

original: de ltar byas na byang chub kyi sems dang des 'phangs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa gang yin pa yongs su mi ngal ba dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa lam yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar byas na byang chub kyi sems dang des 'phangs pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa gang yin pa yongs su mi ngal ba dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa lam yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: If one acts in this way, the practice of the perfection of wisdom that is the essence of the Dharma that is projected by the thought of awakening is not wearying, and the cause of not going by another vehicle is the complete acceptance of the path.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu gang yin pa spyan lnga dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mngon par shes pa drug dang mthar thug par 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu gang yin pa spyan lnga dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mngon par shes pa drug dang mthar thug par 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ste /
translated: The five eyes are the cause for going without relying on others, the six higher perceptions are the cause for completing the accumulations for omniscience and the paths of seeing and meditation are the cause for going to the ultimate.

original: de dag thams cad gdams ngag gi skabs su bstan te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gdams ngag gi skabs su bstan te /
translated: All of these are taught in the section on instructions.

original: 'di tsam kho nas don thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas ji skad du bshad pa'i gdams ngag rnam pa bcu go rims bzhin du bstan pa yin no//
analyzed: 'di tsam kho nas don thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas ji skad du bshad pa'i gdams ngag rnam pa bcu go rims bzhin du bstan pa yin no//
translated: Since all goals are perfectly accomplished by just this, the ten kinds of instructions are taught in this order.

original: @27a * // de skad du yang /
analyzed: @27a * // de skad du yang /
translated: And in the same text:

original: sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
analyzed: sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
translated: Accomplishment, the truths,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
translated: the three jewels of the Buddha and so on,🔽nonattachment, nonwearying,

original: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
analyzed: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
translated: grasping the path, the five eyes and the higher perceptions,

original: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya ba gdams ngag ni //
analyzed: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya ba gdams ngag ni //
translated: which has six qualities.

original: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should know that it has ten aspects.

original: de lta mod kyi dge 'dun dkon mchog gi skabs su byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba 'di ltar gzung bar bya ste /🔽'og nas bshad pa'i lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug la brten nas mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bye brag gi 'bras bu dang po
analyzed: de lta mod kyi dge 'dun dkon mchog gi skabs su byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba 'di ltar gzung bar bya ste / 'og nas bshad pa'i lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug la brten nas mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bye brag gi 'bras bu dang po
translated: However, in the context of the Jewel of the Saṅgha, this classification of bodhisattvas, such as those of dull faculties, should be understood as follows:

original: la zhugs pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: la zhugs pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Based on the sixteen moments of the path of insight, which are included in the knowledge of the path that will be explained below, there are two types of those who have entered the first result, which is the fifteen moments of the path of insight of the faith-follower and the Dharma-follower.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang yin pa de mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang yin pa de mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: After that, those who are not free from attachment to the desire realm are stream-enterers in the sixteenth moment of the path of insight.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi'i bar du spangs pa las de nyid lha dang mi'i rigs su skye ba nyid kyis gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi'i bar du spangs pa las de nyid lha dang mi'i rigs su skye ba nyid kyis gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Then, on the path of cultivation, he is a candidate for the second fruit, because he has abandoned the first three categories of defilements of the realm of desire, and because he is reborn only among the gods and humans.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga spangs pas 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga spangs pas 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa na /
translated: Then, having abandoned the fifth category of defilements of the realm of desire, he is a candidate for the third fruit.

original: dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa dag ni gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa dag ni gcig kho na yin no //
translated: The person of dull mind and the person of sharp mind, who are candidates for the second fruit, are only one, namely, the person who obtains through faith.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: Then, having abandoned the sixth category of defilements of the realm of desire, he is a once-returner.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid lha rnams su skye ba cig lhag ma lus pa'i phyir gzhan bar chad gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid lha rnams su skye ba cig lhag ma lus pa'i phyir gzhan bar chad gcig pa yin no //
translated: Then, having abandoned the seventh and eighth categories, he is a candidate for the fourth fruit, because he is reborn only once among the gods.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun pa brgyad pa spangs pas snga ma bzhin du dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun pa brgyad pa spangs pas snga ma bzhin du dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa gcig yin no //
translated: Then, by abandoning the seventh and eighth desire realm afflictions, he is a once-returner, who has entered the third result, as before.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Then, by abandoning the ninth desire realm affliction, he is called a non-returner.

original: de yang rnam pa lngar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lngar shes par bya'o //
translated: He should be understood as five types.

original: de la skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs /
translated: Among them, the fetter of birth is abandoned,

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma spangs pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma dor mngon par sgrub pa byed pa na'am mngon par grub pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma spangs pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma dor mngon par sgrub pa byed pa na'am mngon par grub pa yang rung ste /
translated: but the fetter of manifestation is not abandoned. Therefore, when manifesting the intermediate existence, or when manifested,

original: srid pa bar @27b mar lam mngon du byas pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar @27b mar lam mngon du byas pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: by manifesting the path in the intermediate existence, he attains the end of suffering. This is parinirvana in the intermediate state.

original: kun tu sbyor ba gnyi ga ma spangs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //🔽de bzhin du skyes nas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas lam mngon du byed pa thob pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba gnyi ga ma spangs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o // de bzhin du skyes nas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas lam mngon du byed pa thob pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who obtains the end of suffering after being born in the form realm without abandoning either fetter is one who attains nirvana after being born.🔽Similarly, one who obtains the end of suffering by manifesting the path through exertion after being born is one who attains nirvana through exertion.

original: de las go bzlog pas ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de las go bzlog pas ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who obtains the end of suffering through nonexertion is one who attains nirvana without exertion.

original: lnga pa ni gong du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gong du 'pho ba'o //
translated: The fifth is one who migrates to a higher level.

original: de yang 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //
translated: That is, one who goes to Akaniṣṭha and one who goes to the summit of existence.

original: de la 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ni 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba nyid kyis 'og min du 'jug pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ni 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba nyid kyis 'og min du 'jug pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The one who goes to Akaniṣṭha as the ultimate is of three kinds: the one who leaps over, the one who leaps over half, and the one who enters Akaniṣṭha by dying in all abodes.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: The one who goes to the peak of existence as the ultimate is the one who is free from attachment to the form realm.

original: mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The one who is peaceful in this life and the one who makes the body manifest are the other two kinds.

original: de'i 'og tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad pa spangs pas ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad pa spangs pas ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: After that, by abandoning the eighth affliction of the peak of existence, one enters the result of an arhat.

original: de'i 'og tu nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la dmigs nas rang gi lam mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba na rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ste nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la dmigs nas rang gi lam mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba na rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ste nyi shu'o //
translated: After that, one becomes a pratyekabuddha when a buddha does not appear because one manifests one’s own path by focusing on the piṭaka of the śrāvakas.

original: de ltar yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las don 'di nyid rgya cher gsungs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las /🔽byang chub sems dpa' dad pas rjes su 'brang ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las don 'di nyid rgya cher gsungs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las / byang chub sems dpa' dad pas rjes su 'brang ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, this very point is extensively taught in the Twenty-five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, and in the Sutra of the Wheel of No Return.🔽The Bhagavan clearly taught the classification of persons in the Sutra of the Wheel of No Return, beginning with the bodhisattva who is a follower through faith🔽and continuing up to the bodhisattva who is a pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du gang zag gi rnam par gzhag pa bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu gsal bar gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag las kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du gang zag gi rnam par gzhag pa bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu gsal bar gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag las kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should also look at those sutras.

original: 'dir ni gzhung mngas kyis dogs te kho bo cag gis ma bkod de btags zin pa la 'thag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mngas kyis dogs te kho bo cag gis ma bkod de btags zin pa la 'thag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Fearing excessive length, I have not cited them here. What is the use of beating a dead horse?

original: de yang 'bras bu dang po dang gnyis pa la gnas pa dang / 'bras bu bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i gang zag ni go sla ba nyid kyis na bsdus par ma bshad do //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu dang po dang gnyis pa la gnas pa dang / 'bras bu bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i gang zag ni go sla ba nyid kyis na bsdus par ma bshad do //
translated: Moreover, the person who is abiding in the first and second results and the person who is entering the fourth result are not explained in the summary because they are easy to understand.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:🔽Those of dull and sharp faculties

original: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / dad dang mthong thob @28a * //
analyzed: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / dad dang mthong thob @28a * //
translated: are attained through faith and seeing.

original: rigs nas rigs //
analyzed: rigs nas rigs //
translated: They are born in the same class,🔽and in the same instant,🔽and go to the highest

original: bar chad gcig par skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: bar chad gcig par skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro //
translated: without doing what should not be done.

original: 'phar gsum srid rtse'i mthar thug 'gro //
analyzed: 'phar gsum srid rtse'i mthar thug 'gro //
translated: They have three jumps, and go to the end of the peak of existence.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags bcom mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags bcom mthong ba'o //
translated: They destroy attachment to form, and see the end of suffering.

original: chos la zhi lus mngon sum byed //🔽bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o //
analyzed: chos la zhi lus mngon sum byed // bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o //
translated: They manifest the body of dharma,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and are rhinoceros-like or with a group.

original: las dang po pa de ltar gdams ngag thob pa la /
analyzed: las dang po pa de ltar gdams ngag thob pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva who has thus received instructions as a beginner

original: bsod nams tshogs ni yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: bsod nams tshogs ni yang dag rdzogs //
translated: completes the accumulation of merit.

original: de nas blo ldan bsam pa brtan //
analyzed: de nas blo ldan bsam pa brtan //
translated: Then the wise one has a stable intention,🔽and the stream of being is completely imbued

original: dad sogs dge ba'i chos rnams kyis //🔽rgyud ni yongs su bsgos gyur pa //
analyzed: dad sogs dge ba'i chos rnams kyis // rgyud ni yongs su bsgos gyur pa //
translated: with virtuous qualities such as faith.

original: bskal pa grangs med nges 'byung bas //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med nges 'byung bas //
translated: For eons beyond measure,

original: ye shes tshogs ni grub bya'i phyir ;
analyzed: ye shes tshogs ni grub bya'i phyir ;
translated: in order to accomplish the accumulation of wisdom,

original: ; mngon shes gdams ngag bstan pa yis //
analyzed: ; mngon shes gdams ngag bstan pa yis //
translated: through the instructions on preternatural knowledge,🔽he enters the level of practice.

original: spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug / ces bshad pa de ltar byas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug / ces bshad pa de ltar byas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to purify the level of practice through devoted interest,

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'og tu bden pa bzhi rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun bzhi po
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'og tu bden pa bzhi rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun bzhi po
translated: The four aspects of heat and so on are the four aspects of heat, peak, patience and supreme mundane state that are compatible with liberation and are the root of virtue possessing the characteristics of clear faith and so on that obtain the culmination of the supreme of all virtuous roots that are the basis of the transcendent wisdom of the path of seeing.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ba yin pa las /🔽'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa las /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ba yin pa las / 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa las /
translated: They are called the four aspects of heat and so on because they are the mundane states that arise from meditation and are compatible with the realization of the four truths.🔽They are superior to the heat and so on of sravakas and so on because they focus on things characterized by impermanence and so on.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la dmigs pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang chos su blta ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la dmigs pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang chos su blta ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir
translated: They are superior by way of the aspects of nonattachment and so on because they are the antidote to the view of the perishing aggregates.

original: dang / theg pa gsum rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir khyad zhugs pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dang / theg pa gsum rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir khyad zhugs pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and because it is superior by being the cause for understanding the three vehicles, and because it is superior by being the cause for the special possession of the characteristics of the spiritual friend who is skilled in means.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i dngos po la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la brten pa dang / skyes bu btags par yod pa la brten pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i dngos po la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la brten pa dang / skyes bu btags par yod pa la brten pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, there are two kinds of conceptualizations of the apprehended, one based on the thing that is afflicted and the other based on the thing that is the antidote, and there are two kinds of conceptualizations of the apprehender, one based on the substantial existence of the person and the other based on the imputed existence of the person.

original: de ltar 'og nas 'chad pa'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pas bsdus pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po @28b rnams kyis grangs ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag kun
analyzed: de ltar 'og nas 'chad pa'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pas bsdus pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po @28b rnams kyis grangs ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag kun
translated: Thus, these factors conducive to penetrative insight are definitely the four types of conceptions that are to be eliminated by the paths of seeing and meditation, which are subsumed by the manifest realizations of the peak, as will be explained below.🔽🔽

original: nas nyon mongs pa la brten par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nas nyon mongs pa la brten par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these factors conducive to penetrative insight are said to be based on the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation, which are subsumed by the peak application explained below.🔽They are also said to be superior to those conceptual thoughts that are based on the afflictions, since each is divided into small, medium and great.

original: de bzhin du ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa la brten pa 'di dag re re zhing chung du dang 'bring dang chen pos dbye bas khyad par du 'phags par yang brjod par bya ba yin pas khyad par rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa la brten pa 'di dag re re zhing chung du dang 'bring dang chen pos dbye bas khyad par du 'phags par yang brjod par bya ba yin pas khyad par rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Thus, there are five types of superiority.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi po ni gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po bdag nyid can gyi bden pa bzhi dmigs pa bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi po ni gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po bdag nyid can gyi bden pa bzhi dmigs pa bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs
