translated: The four roots of virtue such as heat of sravakas and so on are not mixed with the four truths that are objects possessing the characteristics of being form and so on, because they are antidotes to the view of the self, they engage the aspects of impermanence and so on, they are causes for realizing their own vehicle alone, they are free from grasping and they are not obstacles to distant enlightenment.

original: pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang rang gi theg pa kho na rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhi po na ring gi byang chub kyi bgegs su gyur pa ma yin pas na gang gi phyir de dang 'dres par gyur kyang ma 'dres par skye ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang rang gi theg pa kho na rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhi po na ring gi byang chub kyi bgegs su gyur pa ma yin pas na gang gi phyir de dang 'dres par gyur kyang ma 'dres par skye ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, though they are mixed with those four, they are posited as unmixed.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As the Abhidharmasamuccaya says:🔽The bodhisattva’s heat and so on🔽are not mixed with those of sravakas and so on🔽because of their focal object, aspect,

original: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa yis //🔽byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //🔽drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa yis //🔽byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //🔽drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
translated: cause and complete grasping.

original: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan bsten pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan bsten pa //
translated: The four kinds of conceptualization are present in the four stages of heat, peak, patience, and the supreme mundane state.

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: The small, medium, and great

original: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang // bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang // bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags //
translated: are superior to the śrāvakas, rhinoceroses, and the assembly.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa chung ngur gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa chung ngur gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the meaning of the object of observation of the roots of virtue belonging to the small stage of heat, etc. is stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, Blessed One,” and so forth.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag ston pa'o //
translated: “Moreover” means teaching the instruction of the perfection of wisdom by another aspect.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba spyir smos pa yin na yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba spyir smos pa yin na yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Although “in the perfection of wisdom” is a general statement, the meaning is “in the characteristic that observes the thing, impermanence, and so forth.”

original: 'di ltar skabs gzhan dag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag mdo sde ni mdo sde gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /🔽dro bar gtogs pa chung du'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar skabs gzhan dag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag mdo sde ni mdo sde gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las / dro bar gtogs pa chung du'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: And in the Twenty-Five Thousand:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpas gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs stong zhes @29a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpas gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs stong zhes @29a * //
translated: “Venerable Sariputra, here the bodhisattva should contemplate form as impermanent, contemplate form as suffering, contemplate form as empty,

original: bya ba dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: contemplate form as selfless, and so on.”

original: 'dir ni khyad par 'di tsam yod de /
analyzed: 'dir ni khyad par 'di tsam yod de /
translated: There is only this difference here:

original: 'di lta ste mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: “In brief, it is taught.”

original: der ni bden pa re re'i dbang du byas te rgyas par bstan pa yin pa des na the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: der ni bden pa re re'i dbang du byas te rgyas par bstan pa yin pa des na the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: There, it is taught extensively, taking each truth separately. Therefore, do not doubt it.

original: spyod cing zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pas so sgom pas zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: spyod cing zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pas so sgom pas zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pas so //
translated: “One engages” with non-concentrated cognition; “one cultivates” with concentrated cognition.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu drug sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The sixteen aspects such as impermanence are said to be the objects of observation that are based on the four truths such as suffering.

original: de rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what aspects are they observed?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: He asks about that beginning with “how.”

original: des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir shes bya dmigs par bya bar mi rlom pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir shes bya dmigs par bya bar mi rlom pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: “By that” and so forth. Not only does one not imagine the object of knowledge to be the object of observation because it is extremely hidden,

original: mngon par zhen pa bkag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gang zhig byang chub thob par byed pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa des kyang rlom sems su mi bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa bkag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gang zhig byang chub thob par byed pa'i ye shes kyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa des kyang rlom sems su mi bya ste /
translated: but also one does not imagine the object of observation that is the nature of the object of observation to be observed by the wisdom that causes the attainment of enlightenment, which has the nature of the cessation of the conception of self and so forth.

original: mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that one should not settle down on it.

original: chos nyid kyi sgo nas mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sgo nas mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not settle down on it by way of the reality of the object, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //🔽'di skad du nyan thos ni gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po la dmigs par byed pa na bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis so // 'di skad du nyan thos ni gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po la dmigs par byed pa na bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, etc. means in the manner previously explained.

original: de'i rnam pa la sogs pa yin no //🔽byang chub sems dpa' ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po la dmigs pa na chos su lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa la sogs pa yin no // byang chub sems dpa' ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po la dmigs pa na chos su lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is what is being said: When the Sravaka takes as his object of reference a thing having the characteristic of being able to assume form, etc., he does so in the aspect of selflessness, etc.

original: de'i rnam pa mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: When the Bodhisattva takes as his object of reference a thing having the characteristic of impermanence, etc., he does so in the aspect of non-settling down on it, etc.

original: gal te mngon par zhen pa'i dngos po med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon par zhen pa'i dngos po med pa yin na /
translated: If the thing on which one settles down does not exist,

original: de lta na ni med pa yin pa'i phyir gnyen po yin par mi rigs so//
analyzed: de lta na ni med pa yin pa'i phyir gnyen po yin par mi rigs so//
translated: But if that is so, then it is not reasonable that it is an antidote, because it does not exist.🔽But if it is not a form of clinging, then it follows that the eyes, etc. are also antidotes.

original: 'on te gang mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa yin ni de'i tshe mig la sogs pa yang yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhen brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te gang mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa yin ni de'i tshe mig la sogs pa yang yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhen brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de ltar mngon par zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de ltar mngon par zhen pa yin la /
translated: It is a form of clinging to the extent that it is a counteragent.

original: ji ltar gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa de ltar ni mngon par zhen pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa de ltar ni mngon par zhen pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is not a form of clinging to the extent that it is an antidote.

original: yang @29b ji ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang @29b ji ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how is it a counteragent?

original: ji ltar mi bden pa'i rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa dag go //
analyzed: ji ltar mi bden pa'i rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa dag go //
translated: It is a form of clinging to the extent that it is a form of grasping at existence or nonexistence that is motivated by unreal imagination.

original: ji ltar na gnyen po'i phyogs yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnyen po'i phyogs yin zhe na /
translated: How is it an antidote?

original: ci nas kyang de dag med pa'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang de dag med pa'o //
translated: It is to the extent that it is the nonexistence of those two.

original: yang ji ltar na de dag med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de dag med ce na /
translated: Again, how is it the nonexistence of those two?

original: gal te de gnyis de kho na nyid du na med pa yin no zhes shes par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de gnyis de kho na nyid du na med pa yin no zhes shes par gyur ba'o //
translated: It is when one understands that those two do not exist in reality.

original: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te sems med pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'chad bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te sems med pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'chad bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the venerable Śāriputra says, “If that mind is nonexistent,” and so on, as will be explained immediately below.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa tshang mas 'thad pa ma yin nam rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag ji ltar mngon par zhen pa med pa yin snyam nas ;
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa tshang mas 'thad pa ma yin nam rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag ji ltar mngon par zhen pa med pa yin snyam nas ;
translated: Are not all the aspects of non-attachment and so on tenable? Those who understand may wonder, “How can there be non-attachment?”

original: de ci'i slad du zhen zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhen zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Why is that?”

original: gtan tshigs gang las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the reason?

original: yang na gang mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa 'di don gang gi rgyu yin te dgos pa gang yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na gang mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa 'di don gang gi rgyu yin te dgos pa gang yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, what is the purpose of that non-attachment? What is the need?

original: lan bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lan bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain the answer, it is said, “It is like this,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas sems kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas sems kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba yin te /
translated: Because it is free from the nature of one and many, the nature of mind is inherently unborn, which is luminosity.

original: med par kun tu rtog pa'i mun pa thams cad rnam par bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: med par kun tu rtog pa'i mun pa thams cad rnam par bsal ba yin no //
translated: All the darkness of conceptualization of non-existence is completely dispelled.

original: de bas na mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sems ni yang dag pa nyid du na sems ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sems ni yang dag pa nyid du na sems ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a mind that is not different from the aspects of non-attachment, etc., is not a mind in reality.

original: 'di snyam du sems rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir de dang tha mi dad pa mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams ji ltar na de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin zhes bsams pa'o🔽// sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir de dang tha mi dad pa mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams ji ltar na de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin zhes bsams pa'o // sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni ma yin pa'am /
translated: Thinking like this, one may wonder: “Since the mind is devoid of intrinsic nature, how can the aspects of non-attachment, etc., which are not different from it, become the basis of non-attachment in reality?”

original: med pa la sbyar yang rung ste /
analyzed: med pa la sbyar yang rung ste /
translated: This negation “not a mind” can be applied to “not existent” or “non-existent.”

original: yod pa dang med pa tsam du rlom pa dang rjes su 'brel bas na phyin ci log mi ldog par mthong nas /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa tsam du rlom pa dang rjes su 'brel bas na phyin ci log mi ldog par mthong nas /
translated: Since it is connected with the presumption of mere existence or non-existence, seeing that the error is not reversed,

original: ci sems gang sems med pa'i sems de yod dam zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: ci sems gang sems med pa'i sems de yod dam zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: one says, “Is the mind that is not a mind, that mind existent?”

original: sems gang mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sems de kho na nyid du na sems med pa'o zhes gang brjod pa /
analyzed: sems gang mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sems de kho na nyid du na sems med pa'o zhes gang brjod pa /
translated: The mind that is not different from the aspects such as “the mind that is without attachment” is, in reality, a non-mind.

original: ci sems med pa de yod dam zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci sems med pa de yod dam zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What is meant is: “Is that non-mind existent?”

original: rig pas dngos po nyid du na med pa yin pas ma yin pa la ni dgag pa ma yin gyi /🔽'on kyang med pa la yin la de la yang yod pa dang @30a * //
analyzed: rig pas dngos po nyid du na med pa yin pas ma yin pa la ni dgag pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang med pa la yin la de la yang yod pa dang @30a * //
translated: Since it is not an entity, it is not a non-entity.🔽However, it is not a non-existent, and even that is not a mere designation as existent or non-existent.

original: med pa tsam du btags pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa can rab 'byor gyis de nyid lan 'debs su gzhug par 'dod nas /
analyzed: med pa tsam du btags pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa can rab 'byor gyis de nyid lan 'debs su gzhug par 'dod nas /
translated: Subhūti, who has this thought, wishes to have him answer that very question,

original: slar dris pa'i bya bas sh'a ri'i bu ci sems pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /🔽sems med pa'i ngo bo tsam ni sems med pa ste /
analyzed: slar dris pa'i bya bas sh'a ri'i bu ci sems pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te / sems med pa'i ngo bo tsam ni sems med pa ste /
translated: and so he says, “Śāriputra, is mind itself,” and so on, with the action of a counter-question.🔽The mere nature of a non-mind is a non-mind.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na sems med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na sems med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Since it is the reality of that, it is “the nature of a non-mind.”

original: sems med pa de la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa'i yod pa nyid yod pa'am /🔽yang na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa dmigs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sems med pa de la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa'i yod pa nyid yod pa'am / yang na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa dmigs par 'gyur ram /
translated: The non-existent is not the non-existent, nor is the existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.

original: de bzhin du med pa nyid la yang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽'am zhes bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni phyi ma la ltos pa yin la /🔽phyi ma ni snga ma la ltos pa yin par shes par bya'o //🔽ma skyes ngo bo nyid la ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du med pa nyid la yang sbyar bar bya'o // 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni phyi ma la ltos pa yin la / phyi ma ni snga ma la ltos pa yin par shes par bya'o // ma skyes ngo bo nyid la ni //
translated: The existent is not the non-existent, nor is the non-existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The non-existent is not the non-existent, nor is the existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The existent is not the non-existent, nor is the non-existent the existent.

original: rtag dang chad nyid gal zhig / chos kyi bye brag rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: rtag dang chad nyid gal zhig / chos kyi bye brag rnam rtog pa //
translated: The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The non-existent is not the non-existent, nor is the existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.

original: ngo bo nyid la rtog par byed //🔽ji ltar sus kyang nam mkha' la //🔽yig sogs dgod par mi nus ltar ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la rtog par byed // ji ltar sus kyang nam mkha' la // yig sogs dgod par mi nus ltar ;
translated: The existent is not the non-existent, nor is the non-existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The non-existent is not the non-existent, nor is the existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The existent is not the non-existent, nor is the non-existent the existent.

original: / dngos po rnams ni ma skyes la //🔽chos su rnam rtog de bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas de ni med do zhes bya ba smras pa yin te /
analyzed: / dngos po rnams ni ma skyes la // chos su rnam rtog de bzhin no // zhes bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas de ni med do zhes bya ba smras pa yin te /
translated: The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The non-existent is not the non-existent, nor is the existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The existent is not the non-existent, nor is the non-existent the existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.🔽The existent is not the existent, nor is the non-existent the non-existent.

original: bshad ma thag pa gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa gnyi ga'o //
translated: The non-existent is not the non-existent, nor is the existent the existent.

original: da ni de'i tshig nyid lan du sbyor bas smras pa ni /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: da ni de'i tshig nyid lan du sbyor bas smras pa ni / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: Now, in response, he applies the very words of the opponent.🔽He says, “Venerable Śāriputra, if you think that the Tathāgata has a mind that is not mind,

original: brgal ba gang yin pa de ci rigs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brgal ba gang yin pa de ci rigs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la /
translated: then that objection is not appropriate.”

original: brgal ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: brgal ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: An objection is a dispute.

original: ci rigs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bzlog pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bzlog pa spong ba ste /
translated: The word “appropriate” is a rejection of the opposite.

original: mi rung ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi rung ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “unsuitable.”

original: de nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That is what is meant by “Venerable Śāriputra, if you think that the Tathāgata has a mind that is not mind, then that objection is not appropriate.”

original: 'di snyam du sems med pa la yod pa nyid dam /🔽med pa nyid med cing mi dmigs na de la ji ltar khyod kyis sems gang sems de yod dam zhes brgal bar rigs /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems med pa la yod pa nyid dam / med pa nyid med cing mi dmigs na de la ji ltar khyod kyis sems gang sems de yod dam zhes brgal bar rigs /
translated: If you think that a non-mind exists or does not exist,🔽then how could you object, saying, “What is that mind? Is that mind existent?”

original: de la yang gang gi phyir sems med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang gang gi phyir sems med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In response to that, he says, “Because a non-mind is a mere non-mind.”

original: sems med pa tsam nyid yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: sems med pa tsam nyid yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that a non-mind is a mere non-mind.

original: de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du yod par sgro 'dogs pa ni mi 'grig go zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du yod par sgro 'dogs pa ni mi 'grig go zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the superimposition of existence as the nature of things and non-things is not correct.

original: chos can gang sems med pa nyid yin na yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i phyir sems med pa yang med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: chos can gang sems med pa nyid yin na yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i phyir sems med pa yang med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If the subject is mindless, since there is no object, the application of negation does not exist. Therefore, the statement “mindless is also nonexistent”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems med pa nyid de yang gang yin zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems med pa nyid de yang gang yin zhes bya ba'o//
translated: is “Venerable Subhūti, what is that very absence of mind?”

original: @30b yang dag kun rdzob rnams kyi skabs //
analyzed: @30b yang dag kun rdzob rnams kyi skabs //
translated: The section on the correct conventional.

original: med par de nyid khang pa yi //
analyzed: med par de nyid khang pa yi //
translated: It is not suitable

original: steng du 'dzegs par bya ba ni //
analyzed: steng du 'dzegs par bya ba ni //
translated: for the wise to ascend🔽to the roof of reality

original: mkhas la rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas la rung ba ma yin no //
translated: without that.

original: zhes bya bas rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu lan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya bas rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu lan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply in terms of the yogic conventional,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems med pa de ni 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems med pa de ni 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, that absence of mind is unchanging, and so on.

original: sems med pa nyid 'di gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de goms par byas pa na /
analyzed: sems med pa nyid 'di gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de goms par byas pa na /
translated: When this very absence of mind is cultivated in sequence,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gyur ba med pa'i yongs su grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o //🔽phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gyur ba med pa'i yongs su grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o // phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is changeless because it is the cause of the unchanging perfect nature in the stage of a buddha.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is also non-conceptual because it is the cause of the non-erroneous perfect nature.

original: de lta na yang rtogs pa'i chos dang mi 'gal bar brjod pa yin no zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang rtogs pa'i chos dang mi 'gal bar brjod pa yin no zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Even so, it is said that it does not contradict the Dharma of realization.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then and so on.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis so //
translated: How means by what aspect.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mchod par ston pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mchod par ston pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word also indicates the words of praise.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gang gi mthus gzhan rnams kyi rgyud la bdag dang gzhan la gdung bar byed pa'i don gyis sgra sgrogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di la mi skye ba de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gang gi mthus gzhan rnams kyi rgyud la bdag dang gzhan la gdung bar byed pa'i don gyis sgra sgrogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di la mi skye ba de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin
translated: The samadhi called free from affliction is the samadhi in which, by the power of this samadhi, afflictions that cause distress in oneself and others do not arise in the mindstreams of others.

original: to // de la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gsungs pa ltar sems med pa nyid ston pas na zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: to // de la gnas pa rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gsungs pa ltar sems med pa nyid ston pas na zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
translated: The word demonstrates is to be supplied in the appropriate places.

original: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar bas lan gnyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar bas lan gnyis brjod pa'o //
translated: The word excellent is repeated to express amazement.

original: gang gal te sangs rgyas kyi mthus thabs la mkhas pa dang bcas pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gal te sangs rgyas kyi mthus thabs la mkhas pa dang bcas pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is the case that the Buddha, through his skillful means, does not teach the perfection of wisdom,

original: gang gis sh'a ri'i bu de la mkhas pa yin du zin kyang 'phags pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa legs par 'gyur ba khyad par 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gang gis sh'a ri'i bu de la mkhas pa yin du zin kyang 'phags pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa legs par 'gyur ba khyad par 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: then what is the special excellence of the noble Subhūti, who, although skilled in this, gives his approval?

original: ci yang med mod kyis /🔽'on kyang che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pas de dag gi gdu bya rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ci yang med mod kyis / 'on kyang che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pas de dag gi gdu bya rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: There is none at all.🔽Nevertheless, in order to benefit those who are to be guided by demonstrating his greatness,

original: ma 'ongs gdul bya rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs gdul bya rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: or in order to dispel the doubts of future disciples,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs nyid kyis rtsod pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i legs so zhes smra ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs nyid kyis rtsod pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i legs so zhes smra ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in saying good with the non-disputatiousness that is itself the blessing of the Tathagata.

original: sems med pa nyid kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ston pa na /
analyzed: sems med pa nyid kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ston pa na /
translated: When showing the greatness of being without mind,

original: la la rigs ma nges pa yin yang dbang po rno bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su yang thabs kyi khyad par @31a * //
analyzed: la la rigs ma nges pa yin yang dbang po rno bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su yang thabs kyi khyad par @31a * //
translated: some, even though their lineage is not ascertained, due to sharp faculties, by the inconceivable special method in the stage of the factors conducive to penetrability,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: are ascertained as irreversible.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, Therefore... and so on.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi sems des kyang rlom sems su mi byed pa des na mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi sems des kyang rlom sems su mi byed pa des na mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas yin no //
translated: Because of that, by the thought of enlightenment, one does not make a conceit. By that, it is in the manner of non-attachment, and so on.🔽Again means that one should ascertain the impermanence, and so on, because of the observation of entities.

original: yang zhes bya bas ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya bas ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par bya ba'o //
translated: Should be imagined means should be ascertained.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni thams cad phyir mi ldog par nges pa nyid du bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni thams cad phyir mi ldog par nges pa nyid du bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no fault in the eighth stage, because all are definitely irreversible.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of the factors conducive to insight, is not absent, because it is not subject to complete degeneration.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog par brtag par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog par brtag par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: Again means not only should one consider the irreversible.

original: de ltar dmigs pa dang rnam pa brjod nas dro ba chung du'i rgyu'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa dang rnam pa brjod nas dro ba chung du'i rgyu'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus described the object and aspect, in order to teach the specific cause of lesser warmth, he says:

original: nyan thos kyi sa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The stage of the śrāvakas, etc.

original: khyad par can gyi shes pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i shes pa nyid ni sa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi shes pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i shes pa nyid ni sa'o //
translated: The stage is the state of knowledge that has attained the special knowledge.

original: de la slob par 'dod pas te sgrub par byed par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de la slob par 'dod pas te sgrub par byed par 'dod pas so //
translated: One who desires to train in that, who desires to accomplish it,

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni gtsor nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mchog tu ston pa'o rnam ba'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzhung dang don dag yongs su gcod pas mnyan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni gtsor nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mchog tu ston pa'o rnam ba'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzhung dang don dag yongs su gcod pas mnyan par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be listened to by the consciousness of the eye and the mental consciousness induced by it, through fully discerning the text and its meaning.

original: bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi yid la byed pas gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi yid la byed pas gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: It should be grasped by mental attention that has contemplation as its nature.

original: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgrub pas rdzogs par byas pas bcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgrub pas rdzogs par byas pas bcad par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be studied by completing it through practice that has meditation as its nature.

original: dam bcas nas glegs bam klog bas na bklag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam bcas nas glegs bam klog bas na bklag par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be read by reading the scriptures after having made a promise.

original: lung dang rtogs pas kun chub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pas kun chub par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be mastered through scripture and realization.

original: bshad pa la sogs pas gzhan dag la rab tu ston pas rab tu gdon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa la sogs pas gzhan dag la rab tu ston pas rab tu gdon par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be taught to others through explanation and so on.

original: mnyan pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbyor ba dang mjug gi sems phun sum tshogs pas na bslab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan pa la sogs pa thams cad la sbyor ba dang mjug gi sems phun sum tshogs pas na bslab par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be trained in through the excellent mental states of application and conclusion in all of listening and so on.

original: dngos gzhi'i sems la yang mnyam par gzhag par bya ba yin pas na rnal 'byor du bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i sems la yang mnyam par gzhag par bya ba yin pas na rnal 'byor du bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is also the main mind that is to be concentrated, it is the yoga.

original: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Possessing skill in means refers to🔽the skill in🔽completing the qualities of a buddha,🔽in ripening sentient beings,🔽in quickly attaining the goal,🔽in not interrupting the path,

original: sangs rgyas chos rnams rdzogs bya dang // sems can yongs su smin bya dang // myur 'thob bya ba 'grub pa dang // lam rgyun mi gcod la mkhas dang // byang chub sems @31b dpa'i sa kun la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams rdzogs bya dang // sems can yongs su smin bya dang // myur 'thob bya ba 'grub pa dang // lam rgyun mi gcod la mkhas dang // byang chub sems @31b dpa'i sa kun la //
translated: and in all the bodhisattva levels.

original: thabs ni mtshungs pa med pa ste //
analyzed: thabs ni mtshungs pa med pa ste //
translated: The means are incomparable.

original: thabs mkhas de la brten nas ni //
analyzed: thabs mkhas de la brten nas ni //
translated: Relying on that skill in means,

original: de dag kun tu sgrub par byed //
analyzed: de dag kun tu sgrub par byed //
translated: they accomplish all those goals.

original: ces bshad pas /🔽ji skad bshad pa'i don myur du yongs su thob par byed pa /🔽kun rdzob dang don dam pa la brten pa'i sems kyi bye brag nyid ni thabs te /
analyzed: ces bshad pas / ji skad bshad pa'i don myur du yongs su thob par byed pa / kun rdzob dang don dam pa la brten pa'i sems kyi bye brag nyid ni thabs te /
translated: Thus it is explained.🔽Possessing skill in means is having the specific mind that relies on the conventional and the ultimate, which quickly attains the meaning explained above.

original: de dang ldan pa ni thabs mkhas pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni thabs mkhas pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The means are the specific mind that relies on the conventional and the ultimate, which quickly attains the meaning explained above.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na'i chos nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa lam shes pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su grub par
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na'i chos nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa lam shes pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su grub par
translated: For the sake of attaining all the dharmas of the bodhisattva. This is the attainment of the dharmas of only the bodhisattvas, not in common with the sravakas, etc., which is characterized by the knowledge of the path.

original: bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting 'dzin du bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting 'dzin du bya'o //
translated: For the sake of attaining that, one should enter the samadhi called Yoga.

original: 'ga' zhig tu sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'don to //
translated: In some places, it is recited as for the sake of attaining all the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: de ni mi rigs te gang phyir byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad rgyas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te gang phyir byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad rgyas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not correct, because immediately after for the sake of attaining all the dharmas of the bodhisattva, etc., it will be said the extensive dharmas of the bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos sbyin pa la sogs pa bstan pa nyid ma yin nam zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang byang chub sems dpa'i chos sbyin pa la sogs pa bstan pa nyid ma yin nam zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Isn't giving, etc., which are the dharmas of the bodhisattva, taught in the sravaka vehicle as well?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes smras so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes smras so //
translated: Anticipating this doubt, it is said why is that?

original: lan ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is: in this very perfection of wisdom.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos gang la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos gang la'o //
translated: In which means: in which bodhisattva dharma.

original: 'di snyam du nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos ni de'i sde snod las rgya cher gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos ni de'i sde snod las rgya cher gsungs la /
translated: The idea is that the dharmas of the sravakas, etc. are taught extensively in their canon,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni zhar la ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni zhar la ston to //
translated: while the bodhisattva dharmas are taught incidentally.

original: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams nyid ni rgya cher bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams nyid ni rgya cher bstan la /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva dharmas themselves are taught extensively,

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams ni zhar la bstan snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams ni zhar la bstan snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: while the sravaka dharmas are taught incidentally.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment means:

original: gang la gong na gtso bo gzhan med pa de ni bla na med pa'o //🔽yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa ni /
analyzed: gang la gong na gtso bo gzhan med pa de ni bla na med pa'o // yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa ni /
translated: that which has no other, higher, chief thing is unsurpassed.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Perfect, complete enlightenment is the full, non-erroneous, complete enlightenment in all ways.

original: sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of by the Buddha is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to perfect the attainment of all the qualities of a Buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to realize all the qualities of a Buddha, which are characterized by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nyan thos kyi theg par sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bstan pa nyid do snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bstan pa nyid do snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Fearing that one might think, The qualities of a Buddha are taught in the Hearers' Vehicle, [Subhūti] says,

original: de ci'i @32a * //🔽phyir zhe na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i @32a * // phyir zhe na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is that?

original: de kho na bzhin du lan gyi don gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du lan gyi don gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the answer is stated beginning with In this perfection of wisdom itself.

original: nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Even those who want to train in the stage of the Hearers, and so on.

original: mthar rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du theg pa gsum rtogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dro ba chung ngur gtogs pa'i dge ba rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa yin no rgyu'i dngos po 'di ni drod la sogs pa thams cad kyi🔽yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du theg pa gsum rtogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dro ba chung ngur gtogs pa'i dge ba rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa yin no rgyu'i dngos po 'di ni drod la sogs pa thams cad kyi yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This causal nature should be understood as being for all heat and so forth.

original: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang lags pa 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang lags pa 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the medium focal object is stated in the passage beginning with “Bhagavan, this very name of bodhisattva.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba la sngar ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba la sngar ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: In the previous passage, “Bhagavan, I do not see that dharma called bodhisattva,” and so on,

original: don gang la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming don gang la yod pa de ma dmigs par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: don gang la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming don gang la yod pa de ma dmigs par brjod pa yin la /
translated: it is stated that the focal object is not observed, that is, the meaning of the name bodhisattva, which is the meaning that the name exists for.

original: da lta ni /
analyzed: da lta ni /
translated: Now,

original: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste //
translated: All these are mere names,

original: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas //🔽rjod par byed las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas // rjod par byed las ma gtogs pa //
translated: they are based on mere ideas.🔽One should not imagine the object of expression

original: brjod par bya ba brtag mi bya //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba brtag mi bya //
translated: apart from the means of expression.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: In this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming gi rang bzhin gdags par bya ba gang yin pa de ma dmigs par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming gi rang bzhin gdags par bya ba gang yin pa de ma dmigs par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: the nature of the designation “bodhisattva” is shown to be non-apprehensible. This is the distinction.

original: ma 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: “I do not understand” and so on has already been explained.

original: yang na 'das pa ni ma 'tshal /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa ni ma 'tshal /
translated: Or else, the past is not understood,

original: da ltar byung ba ni ma dmigs /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni ma dmigs /
translated: the present is not apprehended,

original: ma 'ongs pa ni yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: and the future is not seen.

original: chos thams cad dus gsum du stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad dus gsum du stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are empty in the three times.

original: 'o na ni gdams pa'i yul gyi ming yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni gdams pa'i yul gyi ming yod do zhe na /
translated: But if the name of the object of instruction exists,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said “even the perfection of wisdom,”

original: ming tsam zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: thinking that it is merely a name.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni ming gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni ming gi rang bzhin te /
translated: The term “bodhisattva” is a name.

original: ming gi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming gi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a topic of names.

original: glo ba la gcags lags so zhes bya ba ni /🔽yul gnas pa ni nyams su myong ba'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir dang ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni glo ba la gcags te /
analyzed: glo ba la gcags lags so zhes bya ba ni / yul gnas pa ni nyams su myong ba'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir dang ma dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni glo ba la gcags te /
translated: “I am sad” means

original: yid la gcags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa nyid yin no //
translated: that he is sad, that is, he is mentally sad, because he is not the final limit of experience and because he is not perceived.

original: de nyid ni gang bdag gi dngos @32b po ma 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'du ba dang 'god pa zhes bya ba la sgrub pa ni 'du ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni gang bdag gi dngos @32b po ma 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'du ba dang 'god pa zhes bya ba la sgrub pa ni 'du ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: “I do not know my own nature.”🔽“Affirmation and denial” means

original: dgag pa ni 'god pa'o //
analyzed: dgag pa ni 'god pa'o //
translated: affirmation and denial.

original: sgrub dang dgag pa ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: sgrub dang dgag pa ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from affirmation and denial,

original: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad gzhan //
translated: there is no other verbal convention.

original: yod min zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis tshig gnyis kho nas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir 'dir 'di ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yod min zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis tshig gnyis kho nas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir 'dir 'di ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because everything is included in just these two, affirmation and denial, he says, “Apart from affirmation and denial, there is no other verbal convention.”

original: 'di skad du de kho na nyid du na 'du ba dang 'god pa dang bral ba nyid kyi khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du de kho na nyid du na 'du ba dang 'god pa dang bral ba nyid kyi khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that in reality, the object is form, etc., which is characterized by being free from collection and dispersion.

original: de rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what aspect is it apprehended?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya bya la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya bya la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Nevertheless, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i ming de yang rgyun gyi tshul gyis gnas pa ma lags pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ming de yang rgyun gyi tshul gyis gnas pa ma lags pa'o //
translated: That name of the object is not established by the mode of continuity.

original: dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: dgag bya yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: Since the object of negation does not exist,

original: yang dag tu na bkag med gsal //
analyzed: yang dag tu na bkag med gsal //
translated: in reality there is no negation.

original: yul med pa la dgag pa yi //
analyzed: yul med pa la dgag pa yi //
translated: In the absence of an object,

original: sbyor ba legs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba legs pa yod ma yin //
translated: the application of negation is not good.

original: rnam par rtog la brten na yang //
analyzed: rnam par rtog la brten na yang //
translated: Even if it is based on conceptual thought,

original: kun rdzob par 'gyur yang dag min //
analyzed: kun rdzob par 'gyur yang dag min //
translated: it is conventional, not real.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa yang ma lags pa'o //🔽rgyun mi 'dra ba nyid kyis na gnas pa dang bral ba yang ma lags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa yang ma lags pa'o // rgyun mi 'dra ba nyid kyis na gnas pa dang bral ba yang ma lags pa'o //
translated: In this way, it is not non-abiding.🔽By the continuity of difference, it is also not free from abiding.

original: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa dang bral ba ma lags pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa dang bral ba ma lags pa'o //
translated: It is not free from abiding in reality.

original: ming du btags pa kun rdzob tu snad ba na ji ltar na rgyun dang de mi 'dra bar 'thad pa ma yin snyam du dogs ba bsu nas /
analyzed: ming du btags pa kun rdzob tu snad ba na ji ltar na rgyun dang de mi 'dra bar 'thad pa ma yin snyam du dogs ba bsu nas /
translated: When names are imputed, how could it be tenable that there is a continuum and that it is not like that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes smos so //
translated: Why is that?

original: ming de ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ming de ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because that name does not exist.

original: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
translated: The phrase “in reality” is a remainder.

original: kun rdzob tu ni nyes pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni nyes pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that there is no fault conventionally.

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar mi de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar mi de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To summarize, it says “In that case, that person…”

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is saying:

original: chos nyid kyi sgo nas rgyun dang de dang mi 'dra ba dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ni rnam pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sgo nas rgyun dang de dang mi 'dra ba dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ni rnam pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The reality that is free from a continuum and that which is not like that from the perspective of reality is the aspect.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the object of observation of the great is stated:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “If it is said…” and so forth.

original: zab mo zhes bya ba ni ming tsam nyid kyis btags pa tsam gyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: zab mo zhes bya ba ni ming tsam nyid kyis btags pa tsam gyi rang bzhin /
translated: “Profound” is the nature that is merely imputed by the mere name.

original: gzhan mu stegs pa rnams dang rang gi sde pa rten med pas 'jigs pa rnams kyis gting mi dpogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs pa rnams dang rang gi sde pa rten med pas 'jigs pa rnams kyis gting mi dpogs pa'o //
translated: It is unfathomable by others, the tīrthikas, and by our own faction who are afraid of the absence of a basis.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: btags pa tsam nyid kyi khyad par can sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: btags pa tsam nyid kyi khyad par can sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The object of the four noble truths such as suffering, which are distinguished as mere designations, is observed.

original: de rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what aspect is it observed?

original: @33a * // lhag pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @33a * // lhag pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said: with superior intention, and so on.🔽That designation is not expressed as any dharma whatsoever, such as virtue, and so on. With the superior intention that it is inexpressible, it is observed and conceived.

original: btags pa de ni dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyi chos gang du yang brjod du med par zhes bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas mos shing dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa de ni dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyi chos gang du yang brjod du med par zhes bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas mos shing dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is said:🔽Extensive, vast, delightful,🔽with great purpose, diligent,🔽virtuous superior intention,

original: yangs shing rgya che dga' ba dang // dgos pa che la brtson pa dang ; / dge ba lhag pa'i bsam pa dang // dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yin //
analyzed: yangs shing rgya che dga' ba dang // dgos pa che la brtson pa dang ; / dge ba lhag pa'i bsam pa dang // dag pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yin //
translated: and pure superior intention.

original: zhes bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam bas so //
translated: It is said: with superior intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba ni ldan pa ste gtsor drod chen po dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba ni ldan pa ste gtsor drod chen po dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is not separated from the perfection of wisdom is endowed, primarily, with the great heat stage, which is not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag tu yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'di skabs las rig par bya'o //🔽phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas pa ni thob pa yongs su mi nyams pa sa brgyad pa la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag tu yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'di skabs las rig par bya'o // phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas pa ni thob pa yongs su mi nyams pa sa brgyad pa la ste /
translated: And in other contexts, the meaning of the perfection of wisdom should be understood in the same way.

original: de'i 'bras bu phyir mi ldog pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu phyir mi ldog pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the stage of irreversibility has attained, because he has attained the result of the eighth stage, which is irreversibility.

original: legs par gnas pa ni ma thob pa yongs su mi nyams pa ste de bskyed par rung ba nyid kyis gong nas gong du khyad par 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par gnas pa ni ma thob pa yongs su mi nyams pa ste de bskyed par rung ba nyid kyis gong nas gong du khyad par 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is well-established has not attained, because he is fit to generate the next higher stage, in order to attain the special qualities of the higher stages.

original: gnyis po 'di ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor bas bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor bas bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: These two should be accomplished by the application of non-attachment, as stated. This is the non-abiding method.

original: 'di skad du rnam pa ni chos nyid kyi sgo nas brjod du med pa yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam pa ni chos nyid kyi sgo nas brjod du med pa yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the aspects are inexpressible from the point of view of reality.

original: stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las kyang dro ba chen po'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang yang 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhe bgyi 'di ni chos kyi brda las byung ba'i btags pa lags la zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi zhes bgyi ba de yang dge ba'am mi dge ba'am dngos po'i dngos po med pa'i chos gang
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las kyang dro ba chen po'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / bcom ldan 'das gang yang 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhe bgyi 'di ni chos kyi brda las byung ba'i btags pa lags la zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi zhes bgyi ba de yang dge ba'am mi dge ba'am dngos po'i dngos po med pa'i chos gang
translated: And in the Pañcavimśati, in the context of the object and aspects of the great heat,🔽it says:🔽Blessed One, that which is called a bodhisattva is a designation that arises from the connection of a dharma.

original: du yang brjod par bya ba ma lags so //
analyzed: du yang brjod par bya ba ma lags so //
translated: And that which is called buddha is not something to be expressed as any dharma, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or a thing or nonthing.🔽Blessed One, it is like this: for example, the name dream is not a thing.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na rmi lam zhes bgyi ba'i ming ni zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs te de bas na som nyi mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na rmi lam zhes bgyi ba'i ming ni zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs te de bas na som nyi mi bya'o //
translated: And so on at length. Therefore, do not be doubtful.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas dro bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas dro bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, because it is a sign of the fire of nonconceptual intuition, it is like heat, and so it is the object of heat, and it is endowed with the aspects of heat.

original: bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam ches nye bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i cha dad mthun pa las 'di'i khyad par yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam ches nye bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i cha dad mthun pa las 'di'i khyad par yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If there is no obstacle, the path of insight will occur very soon. This is the difference from the stage of acquiescence in the truth of suffering.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: @33b dmigs pa mi rtag pa sogs pa //
analyzed: @33b dmigs pa mi rtag pa sogs pa //
translated: The object is impermanence, etc.

original: bden pa'i rten can de yi ni //
analyzed: bden pa'i rten can de yi ni //
translated: It has the support of the truth.

original: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog / theg pa gsum char thob pa'i rgyu //🔽gzugs sogs 'du 'god gnas bral dang // gnas dang btags dang brjod du med //
analyzed: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog / theg pa gsum char thob pa'i rgyu // gzugs sogs 'du 'god gnas bral dang // gnas dang btags dang brjod du med //
translated: Its aspects are the cessation of adherence, etc. It is the cause of attaining the three vehicles.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Form, etc. are free from arrangement and location, and are not located, not imputed, and inexpressible.

original: da ni dro ba'i rjes la rtse mor gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gtsor tse mo'i rang bzhin la'o //🔽spyod cing zhes bya ba dang sgom pas zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //🔽yang na sbyor ba dang mjug gi sems kyis spyod cing dngos gzhi'i sems kyis sgom pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ni dro ba'i rjes la rtse mor gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gtsor tse mo'i rang bzhin la'o // spyod cing zhes bya ba dang sgom pas zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to // yang na sbyor ba dang mjug gi sems kyis spyod cing dngos gzhi'i sems kyis sgom pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Now, the meaning of the object of the small root of merit belonging to the peak is stated: “Moreover, Bhagavan, a Bodhisattva who is practicing the perfection of wisdom, who is cultivating the perfection of wisdom, should contemplate thus: ‘Form is impermanent, and so on up to consciousness. ’”🔽The perfection of wisdom is the nature of the peak, primarily.🔽“Practicing” and “cultivating” have been explained.🔽Or, the thought of preparation and conclusion practices, and the thought of the actual basis cultivates.🔽🔽

original: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de la gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can ni gzugs so //🔽nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can ni tshor ba'o //🔽mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can ni 'du shes so //🔽sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de la gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can ni gzugs so //🔽nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can ni tshor ba'o //🔽mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can ni 'du shes so //🔽sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: Now, the meaning of the object of the small root of merit belonging to the peak is stated: “Moreover, Blessed One, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, not abiding in form, not abiding in feeling, not abiding in perception, not abiding in volitional formations, not abiding in consciousness, not abiding in the eyes, not abiding in the ears, nose, tongue, thorough knowledges, eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, not abiding in the knowledge of all aspects, not abiding in the fruit of a stream-enterer, not abiding in the fruit of a once-returner, not abiding in the fruit of a non-returner, not abiding in the fruit of an arhat, not abiding in the fruit of a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, not abiding in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, not abiding in the knowledge of all aspects, not abiding in the knowledge of paths, not abiding in the knowledge of all bases, not abiding in the perfection of giving, not abiding in the perfection of morality, patience, diligence, or concentration, not abiding in the perfection of wisdom, not abiding in the perfection of skillful means, not abiding in the perfection of aspiration, not abiding in perfection of outer and inner emptiness, not abiding in the emptiness of emptiness, not abiding in the emptiness of great extent, not abiding in the emptiness of ultimate reality, not abiding in the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, not abiding in the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, not abiding in the emptiness of the unlimited, not abiding in the emptiness of that which has neither been extinguished nor arisen, not abiding in the emptiness of inherent existence, not abiding in the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the object of understanding is consciousness.

original: gzugs de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Form is also threefold:

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Imagined form is form as the mode of the grasped and the grasper, because it is just an imputation.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtogs pa yin pas shes pa nyid de ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtogs pa yin pas shes pa nyid de ltar snang ba ste /
translated: Conceptualized form is consciousness itself appearing as such, because it is a false imagination.

original: de ltar rnam par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is conceptualized in that way.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni de kho na nyid du na gzugs nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni de kho na nyid du na gzugs nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reality of form is form itself, which is fully accomplished as the nature of emptiness in reality.

original: ro tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ro tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of taste, feeling, and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the order of form and so on.

original: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: The order is according to coarseness, affliction,

original: snod sogs don khams ji bzhin no //
analyzed: snod sogs don khams ji bzhin no //
translated: vessel, and so on, according to the meaning of the elements.

original: de kho na nyid du med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa de la dngos por dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ste ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid du med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa de la dngos por dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ste ;
translated: Since they do not exist in reality, one should not abide in them in a manner that observes form, etc. as things,

original: sems kyi rten du mi bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi rten du mi bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: and one should not make them the basis of the mind.🔽This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir gnas par mi 'os pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no @34a * //🔽zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir gnas par mi 'os pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no @34a * // zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since form, etc. is empty of intrinsic reality, it is the nature of the intrinsic reality of form, etc. Therefore, it is the observation of form, etc. that is not suitable to abide in, that is special.

original: ci'i phyir de lta bur dmigs snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bsu nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta bur dmigs snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bsu nas /
translated: The question is raised, “Why is it observed in that way?”

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam pa smras pa ni gal te gzugs la gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas rnam pa smras pa ni gal te gzugs la gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The reply is given by way of negation: “If one abides in form, etc.”

original: 'di snyam du dmigs pa la 'dzin pa'i bye brag nyid rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dmigs pa la 'dzin pa'i bye brag nyid rnam pa yin la /
translated: One might think, “The observation is the very distinction of the apprehender.”

original: yul gnas pa myong ba'i mthar thug pa yin pa des na dmigs pa ni rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa kho na yin par gzung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gnas pa myong ba'i mthar thug pa yin pa des na dmigs pa ni rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa kho na yin par gzung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object is apprehended as being in accordance with the aspect.

original: de bas gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas gzugs la gnas na de'i tshe gzugs mngon par 'du byed pa ste gzugs su rtsol ba'i rnam par rtog pa la spyod la /
analyzed: de bas gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas gzugs la gnas na de'i tshe gzugs mngon par 'du byed pa ste gzugs su rtsol ba'i rnam par rtog pa la spyod la /
translated: Thus, if one dwells on form with the aspects of impermanence, etc., then one is engaged in the discursive thought that forms are impermanent, i.e., one is engaged in the discursive thought that forms are impermanent, i.e., one is engaged in the conceptualization that forms are impermanent.

original: de ltar na yang rtse mo chung ngur gtsor gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rtse mo chung ngur gtsor gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so //
translated: However, one does not primarily practice the perfection of wisdom at the lower stage of the peak.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to feeling, etc.

original: 'di skad du chos nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu yin par gzung ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du chos nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu yin par gzung ste /
translated: In this way, the aspect is apprehended as being of this kind from the point of view of reality.

original: 'di lta ste don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang stong pa nyid dag ni phan tshun ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin pa des na stong pa nyid de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa la
analyzed: 'di lta ste don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang stong pa nyid dag ni phan tshun ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin pa des na stong pa nyid de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa la
translated: Thus, ultimately all phenomena such as form and emptiness are the same in essence. Therefore, since impermanence and so on do not exist in emptiness,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas gnas par mi bya bas mi gnas pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas gnas par mi bya bas mi gnas pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: form and so on do not abide in the mode of permanence, impermanence, and so on.

original: 'di ltar rtse mo chud du'i rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /🔽gzugs nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtse mo chud du'i rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las / gzugs nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, in the Twenty-five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, from the perspective of the stage of the peak, it is said:🔽Form itself is emptiness, emptiness itself is form.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyang gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyang gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Up to: Blessed One, the impermanence of form is emptiness, emptiness is the impermanence of form.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par sgom pa mi 'thad pas yang ji ltar na mgon par 'du byed pa la spyod na spyod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas mngon par 'du byed pa rnams la zhes🔽bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par sgom pa mi 'thad pas yang ji ltar na mgon par 'du byed pa la spyod na spyod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas mngon par 'du byed pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The response to this is “Why is it so?”

original: 'di snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: The thought is this: Mental application is conceptualization,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual.🔽How could one who engages in conceptualization by being fixated on reality be said to be engaging in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de ji ltar na de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pas rnam par rtog pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin te 'on kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar spyad par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin @34b no ;
analyzed: de ji ltar na de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pas rnam par rtog pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin te 'on kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar spyad par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin @34b no ;
translated: However, one should engage in it like an illusory person.

original: ; yongs su 'dzin pa yang ma lags rnal 'byor du mi bgyid pa yang ma lags yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis ni grangs ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs yin par
analyzed: ; yongs su 'dzin pa yang ma lags rnal 'byor du mi bgyid pa yang ma lags yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis ni grangs ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs yin par
translated: The three phrases “not grasping, not making effort, not completing” show the three stages of preparation, actual practice, and conclusion, respectively.

original: blta bar bya'o //
