analyzed: blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand this as it is.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni gtsor rtse mo chung du'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni gtsor rtse mo chung du'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “In the perfection of wisdom” is the nature of the lesser peak.

original: yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Not grasping” and so on.

original: yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni gzung bar mi 'os pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa yongs su bzung zhing bdag gir byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni gzung bar mi 'os pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa yongs su bzung zhing bdag gir byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Not grasping” means that the accumulation of non-grasping, which is not suitable to be grasped, does not lead to the attainment of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum la spyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum la spyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: Here, omniscience is explained as the word for the three omnisciences in general.

original: gzhan dag tu yang ci rigs pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu yang ci rigs pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: And in other places, it should be applied as appropriate.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ji ltar gzung bar 'os pa yin snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ji ltar gzung bar 'os pa yin snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: How is the act of volition to be taken?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gzugs yongs su gzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gzugs yongs su gzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to the question, Why is that? it is said, In the perfection of wisdom, form is not to be apprehended, and so on.

original: 'di snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa ni rigs pas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su gzung ba med la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa ni rigs pas yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su gzung ba med la /
translated: The idea is that the nature of the object of the act of volition, such as form, does not exist through reasoning, so it is not to be apprehended in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir de'i yul can mngon par 'du byed pa ni log par snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i yul can mngon par 'du byed pa ni log par snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bsams pa yin no //
translated: And because the subject of that, the act of volition, is an appearance of error, it is not to be grasped.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That very teaching is stated in the passage beginning with “That non-apprehension of form, etc., is not form, etc.”

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni yul tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni yul tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The affirmation and the negation have different objects, this is the idea.

original: phyin ci log tu thal bar 'gyur bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang yongs su gzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba smos so //🔽nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu thal bar 'gyur bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang yongs su gzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba smos so // nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning with “Therefore, Subhūti, one should not settle down in the perfection of wisdom” is stated because of the consequence of error. The passage beginning with “That perfection of wisdom also is not apprehended” is stated.🔽In order to summarize, he says “In the same way, etc.”

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de kho na ltar zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de kho na ltar zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: “In the same way” means “just so,” and has the sense of a restrictive particle.

original: de lta bu'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa las skyes pa'i rtse mor gtogs pa chung ngu'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /🔽gzugs la @35a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa las skyes pa'i rtse mor gtogs pa chung ngu'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / gzugs la @35a * //
translated: The concentration belonging to the summit of the peak of existence, which arises from such an object and aspect, is called “this” in the verse.

original: sogs pa'i chos thams cad du yongs su gzung ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin don dang ldan pa'i ming can gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i chos thams cad du yongs su gzung ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin don dang ldan pa'i ming can gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is the concentration of the complete relinquishment of all phenomena such as form, and it is called “endowed with meaning.”

original: chos kyi dbyings yangs pa nyid kyis na yangs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yangs pa nyid kyis na yangs pa'o //
translated: It is vast because the expanse of reality is vast.

original: mdun du bgyis pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag gis sems kyi mdun na gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'phags pa rnam grol sdes bshad do //
analyzed: mdun du bgyis pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag gis sems kyi mdun na gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'phags pa rnam grol sdes bshad do //
translated: It is directed in front because it is present in front of the mind through the specific features of the object and aspect as they have been explained. This is explained by Ārya Vimuktisena.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: la las mdun du ma bgyis bzhes 'don pa ni gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: la las mdun du ma bgyis bzhes 'don pa ni gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: some editions read “not directed in front,” but this should not be accepted.

original: tshad med par nges pa ni /
analyzed: tshad med par nges pa ni /
translated: It is ascertained as immeasurable

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ascertained individually in omniscience.

original: yang na thugs rje chen po dang shes rab kyi sbyor bas sems can tshad med pa'i don mdzad par nges pa yin pa'i phyir tshad med par nges pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thugs rje chen po dang shes rab kyi sbyor bas sems can tshad med pa'i don mdzad par nges pa yin pa'i phyir tshad med par nges pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is certain that he acts for the sake of immeasurable sentient beings by the union of great compassion and wisdom, and so it is certain that he is immeasurable.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ji ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ji ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is not understood by others because it is superior by the five aspects, such as the object, as has been explained.

original: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the object of the middling is stated: “That omniscience, too…”

original: yang gi sgras ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The word “too” includes impermanence, etc. and emptiness.

original: ci'i phyir yongs su gzung ba med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yongs su gzung ba med ce na /
translated: Why is it ungrasped?

original: mtshan mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtshan mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “because of the sign…”

original: mtshan ma ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The sign is the uncommon nature.

original: de kho na nyid du na phan tshun tshul gcig yin pas de'i phyir gzung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na phan tshun tshul gcig yin pas de'i phyir gzung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since they are the same mode in reality, therefore, it is ungrasped.

original: 'di skad du chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i stong pa nyid dag ni rang rang gi ngo bo nyid dag gis ngo bo med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad du chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i stong pa nyid dag ni rang rang gi ngo bo nyid dag gis ngo bo med pa'i phyir /
translated: This is what is being said: “Impermanence, etc. and the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects, which are the nature of the dharmadhatu, are not entities by their own nature.

original: 'di dag phan tshun bdag nyid gcig pas mtshan ma med pa nyid kyi khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun bdag nyid gcig pas mtshan ma med pa nyid kyi khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should observe form, etc. which are qualified by signlessness, since they are the same nature as each other.”

original: mtshan mar bzung na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /🔽gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtshan mar bzung na nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is the fault if one grasps signs?

original: mtshan mar gzung bar bya bar gyur na ni ;
analyzed: mtshan mar gzung bar bya bar gyur na ni ;
translated: If one were to grasp signs,🔽then one would see liberation as distant, and would become weary.

original: de'i tshe rang gi bstan pa la mtshan mar bzung bas yun ring por thar pa ma mthong bas kun tu skyo bar gyu ba'i kun tu rgyu phreng ba can zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi dka' thub pa bstan pa'i da la dad par te mtshan ma med pa'i
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi bstan pa la mtshan mar bzung bas yun ring por thar pa ma mthong bas kun tu skyo bar gyu ba'i kun tu rgyu phreng ba can zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi dka' thub pa bstan pa'i da la dad par te mtshan ma med pa'i
translated: The ascetic called Mahavira, who was named after his garland, had faith in the teachings of the teacher Pūraṇa, and he grasped signs in his teachings.

original: tshul la mngon par yid ches pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul la mngon par yid ches pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not attain full confidence in the way things are.

original: mtshan mar @35b 'dzin pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mtshan mar @35b 'dzin pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that one grasps signs in the same way.

original: de nyid ston pas kun tu rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ston pas kun tu rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The Teacher himself teaches this in the passage beginning with “The wandering mendicant.”

original: 'dir mtshan ma med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la zhes bya ba de'i rgyu mtshan ma med pa la mos na ste lhag par mos pa'i yid la byed pa bskyed nas dbang po
analyzed: 'dir mtshan ma med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la zhes bya ba de'i rgyu mtshan ma med pa la mos na ste lhag par mos pa'i yid la byed pa bskyed nas dbang po
translated: Here, since signlessness is what causes the attainment of the state of a tathāgata, when one is devoted to the signlessness that is the cause of this gnosis of omniscience, when one generates the mental attention of superior devotion, one is a person who is devoted to signlessness.

original: rtul po nyid kyis dad pas lam gyi rjes su 'brangs nas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhing phyogs gcig la gang zag la bdag med pa'i shes pas zhugs so //
analyzed: rtul po nyid kyis dad pas lam gyi rjes su 'brangs nas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhing phyogs gcig la gang zag la bdag med pa'i shes pas zhugs so //
translated: Because of having dull faculties, one follows the path through faith, and one enters into the understanding of the selflessness of persons through faith.

original: de zhugs nas kyang dus phyis gzugs la sogs pa la mtshan mar yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: de zhugs nas kyang dus phyis gzugs la sogs pa la mtshan mar yid la mi byed cing /
translated: Having entered into that, later one does not mentally attend to signs in form and so on.

original: mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa de la sgom par byed pa'i shes pa de la dga' ba dang bde ba skyes pa'i mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa bsgom pa de la sgom par byed pa'i shes pa de la dga' ba dang bde ba skyes pa'i mtshan mar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the sign of the arising of joy and pleasure in the consciousness that meditates on that meditation on signlessness.

original: de la dga' ba ni yid bde ba ste sems kyi'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni yid bde ba ste sems kyi'o //
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction, which is mental.

original: bde ba ni shin tu sbyangs te lus kyi'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni shin tu sbyangs te lus kyi'o //
translated: Pleasure is pliancy, which is physical.

original: de yang btsun pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa gang yang rung ba la brten nas zhugs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de yang btsun pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa gang yang rung ba la brten nas zhugs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The Venerable Vimuktisena explains that it is based on either the first or second meditation free from mundane attachment.

original: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what aspect does he take it as an object?

original: shes pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says: by knowledge, etc.

original: sgom par byed pa'i shes pa de nang gi gzugs zin pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nang gi skye mched kyi yin par nang stong pa nyid kyis na yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste mtshan mar zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sgom par byed pa'i shes pa de nang gi gzugs zin pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nang gi skye mched kyi yin par nang stong pa nyid kyis na yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste mtshan mar zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: That consciousness which is meditating, by means of the emptiness of internal things, does not see the internal sense-fields, which are the internal form, as belonging to the primary and secondary elementary matter.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs ma zin pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyi'i skye mched kyi yin par phyi stong pa nyid kyis na yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs ma zin pa'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyi'i skye mched kyi yin par phyi stong pa nyid kyis na yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: By means of the emptiness of external things, it does not see the external sense-fields, which are the external form, as belonging to the primary and secondary elementary matter.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi gzugs de gnyi ga tshogs pa'i yin par te phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi gzugs de gnyi ga tshogs pa'i yin par te phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By means of the emptiness of both internal and external things, it does not see the internal and external form, which is the combination of both.

original: 'o na gzugs las gzhan pa la mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs las gzhan pa la mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is not seen in form, then it is seen in something other than form.

original: shes pa de gzugs las gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shes pa de gzugs las gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That consciousness is not seen in form, nor is it seen in something other than form, etc.

original: de lta na 'di chos sgom pa la mngon par zhugs par ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'di chos sgom pa la mngon par zhugs par ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be said that he has entered into the meditation on the Dharma?

original: tshig gi rnam grangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshig gi rnam grangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase the various expressions and so on is stated.

original: tshig gi rnam grangs nyid la zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi gnas kyi khyad par 'di la mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas kun tu rgyu phreng ba can mos so zhes brjod par bya'i rtogs pa ni @36a * //
analyzed: tshig gi rnam grangs nyid la zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi gnas kyi khyad par 'di la mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas kun tu rgyu phreng ba can mos so zhes brjod par bya'i rtogs pa ni @36a * //
translated: The various expressions themselves are called the stage of devoted engagement because one who is devoted to this special stage of yoga abides on the stage of devoted engagement. It is said that the wandering mendicant Maṇibhadra was devoted to this wisdom of omniscience free from signs.

original: ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir kun tu rgyu phreng ba can mtshan ma med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la /
analyzed: ma yin no // gang gi phyir kun tu rgyu phreng ba can mtshan ma med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la /
translated: However, he did not realize it.

original: de kho na nyid ma rtogs pas dbang po rnon po ma yin pa nyid kyis dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma rtogs pas dbang po rnon po ma yin pa nyid kyis dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Because the wandering mendicant Maṇibhadra did not realize thatness, he was not of sharp faculties. Therefore, he was called a follower of faith.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs na ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs na ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: If he had realized thatness, he would have become a follower of reality.

original: yang ji ltar na dbang po rtul po yin du zin kyang de ltar mos zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na dbang po rtul po yin du zin kyang de ltar mos zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that he was devoted in this way even though he was of dull faculties?

original: chos nyid tshad mar bgyis te mos pa zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos nyid tshad mar bgyis te mos pa zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He was devoted by taking the nature of reality as valid.

original: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid mi bslu bas tshad mar byas na 'di ltar mtshan ma med pa nyid du mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid mi bslu bas tshad mar byas na 'di ltar mtshan ma med pa nyid du mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By the power of the momentum of former impulsion, one has confidence in the non-existence of signs, having taken the non-deceptive reality of the perfection of wisdom as valid.

original: de'i phyir des chos gang yang sgro btags pas yongs su ma bzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir des chos gang yang sgro btags pas yongs su ma bzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, he does not grasp any dharma by superimposition.

original: chos gang blang bar bya ba nyid du dmigs shing chos gang blang bar bya ba nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba'am dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gtang bar bya ba dang yod pa nyid dmigs pa'i chos kyang med do //
analyzed: chos gang blang bar bya ba nyid du dmigs shing chos gang blang bar bya ba nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba'am dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gtang bar bya ba dang yod pa nyid dmigs pa'i chos kyang med do //
translated: There is no dharma that is perceived as something to be taken up, nor is there any dharma that is to be taken up or given up by being perceived as something to be given up, nor is there any dharma that is perceived as existent.

original: re zhig gzhan lta zhog ste de mya ngan las 'das par yang rlom sems su mi bgyid do zhes bya ba de kho na nyid du na mi rtogs so //
analyzed: re zhig gzhan lta zhog ste de mya ngan las 'das par yang rlom sems su mi bgyid do zhes bya ba de kho na nyid du na mi rtogs so //
translated: He does not even conceive of nirvana as real.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi gnas kyi 'di skad du rnam pa ni chos nyid kyi sgo nas ngo bo nyid bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa bdag gir mi byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi gnas kyi 'di skad du rnam pa ni chos nyid kyi sgo nas ngo bo nyid bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa bdag gir mi byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Here refers to the stage of yoga. It is said that in this way, by way of reality, the nature is refuted, and form, etc. are not taken as self.

original: de la kun du rgyu phreng ba can dper byas pa ni mu stegs pa dang 'brel pas ting nge 'dzin las langs pa de lhag par mos pa'i stobs kyis don de mngon du bya ba'i dpang po nyid du shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de la kun du rgyu phreng ba can dper byas pa ni mu stegs pa dang 'brel pas ting nge 'dzin las langs pa de lhag par mos pa'i stobs kyis don de mngon du bya ba'i dpang po nyid du shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: In that, the wandering ascetic Maṇibhadra is given as an example, because of his connection with the tīrthikas. It is to be understood that he is a witness to manifest that meaning by the power of his superior aspiration when rising from samādhi.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: The meaning of the object of the great is stated with This Blessed One... and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: Here will be explained below.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word also means not only what was explained before.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show that, it is said that form... and so on.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don gyi tshig phrad de /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don gyi tshig phrad de /
translated: The word “because” is a particle indicating reason.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yang dag par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yang dag par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is: “because they do not see the signs of form, etc.”

original: de lta na ma dmigs pas thams cad 'gog na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos ltar na mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ma dmigs pas thams cad 'gog na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos ltar na mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, and if everything is stopped by non-apprehension, then the Bodhisattva will attain Nirvana like the Sravakas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to this, he says, “the ten powers of the Tathagata, etc.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @36b bcu la sogs pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @36b bcu la sogs pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata, etc., will be explained later.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam zhig gzhan dag la yod pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa thams cad du mthar phyin par yongs su ma rdzogs par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam zhig gzhan dag la yod pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed pa thams cad du mthar phyin par yongs su ma rdzogs par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Not complete” means that, because they have only a little of them, they are not complete in all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: dang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: ma 'gags pa yi lus kyis ni //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yi lus kyis ni //
translated: With a body that is not stopped,

original: tshor ba nyams su myong byed pa //
analyzed: tshor ba nyams su myong byed pa //
translated: The experience of feeling

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
translated: is like the going out of a lamp.

original: de yi sems ni rnam par grol //
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam par grol //
translated: His mind is completely liberated.

original: zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni theg pa chen por bkag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni theg pa chen por bkag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the nirvana that is refuted in the Mahayana.

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo tshad mar byas nas dus re zhig sems can gyi don rgyun chad pa'i bar mdo ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo tshad mar byas nas dus re zhig sems can gyi don rgyun chad pa'i bar mdo ste /
translated: Taking the Saddharmapundarika-sutra as authoritative, he has a nirvana that is a temporary cessation of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bar du nyan thos dang 'dra bar mtshan ma med pa nyid mngon du byas pa na /
analyzed: bar du nyan thos dang 'dra bar mtshan ma med pa nyid mngon du byas pa na /
translated: In the middle, he manifests the signlessness that is like that of the sravakas.

original: thabs mkhas pa chen po'i stobs kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa chen po'i stobs kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no //
translated: But by the power of his great skill in means, he does not enter nirvana.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i skabs su nyan thos kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba mi srid pas rim gyis zhes bya ba na lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i skabs su nyan thos kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba mi srid pas rim gyis zhes bya ba na lhag ma'o //
translated: Since it is impossible for a sravaka to enter nirvana while he is still in the stage of the aids to penetration, the word “gradually” is added.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The verse that begins “Therefore” is the summary.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid du na sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi mthong ba'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid du na sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi mthong ba'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: By way of the reality of identitylessness, one observes the special form, etc., which is not seen as the sign of blue, etc.

original: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what aspect does one observe?

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān declares Moreover, Subhūti, etc.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Here, thus is in the manner that will be explained below.

original: nye bar brtags pa ni sgom pa'i dus su ji ltar nges par bzung ba'i don so sor brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa ni sgom pa'i dus su ji ltar nges par bzung ba'i don so sor brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The investigation is the discernment of the meaning as ascertained during the time of meditation.

original: nges par bsams pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i dus su lung dang rigs pa nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par bsams pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i dus su lung dang rigs pa nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reflection is the ascertainment of scripture and reasoning during the time of listening and reflection.

original: 'di gang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi nang nas gang yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi nang nas gang yin zhes pa'o //
translated: What is this? means From among the aggregates of form, etc., which is it?

original: yang na ci rdzas dang yon tan nam /
analyzed: yang na ci rdzas dang yon tan nam /
translated: Or, is it a substance, a quality,

original: las sam bya ba'am /
analyzed: las sam bya ba'am /
translated: an action, or a universal?

original: 'du ba'am / spyi'am /
analyzed: 'du ba'am / spyi'am /
translated: “Union” or “general” or

original: khyad par yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'di gang gi yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'di gang gi yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “particular” is what is meant. “ Whose?” means

original: ci bdag nyid dam chos dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: ci bdag nyid dam chos dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: “Whose is it?” “ Is it related to the self or to a dharma?”

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, since form, etc. are not produced,

original: gang yang ma yin gang gi yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang yang ma yin gang gi yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “it is not anything and it is not anyone’s.” is what is meant.

original: gal te de lta yin na med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it does not exist.

original: ci chos gang med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @37a * //
analyzed: ci chos gang med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @37a * //
translated: “ What dharma does not exist?” etc.

original: te yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pas de kho na nyid du med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: te yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pas de kho na nyid du med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: is stated. Since there is no application of negation to a nonexistent object, it is not the perfection of wisdom that is nonexistent in reality. That is the idea.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: “ If” is a particle.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtse mo chen po'i rang bzhin dang ma bral bar rig par bya ste rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtse mo chen po'i rang bzhin dang ma bral bar rig par bya ste rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as inseparable from the nature of the great peak, because it is realized.

original: 'di skad du chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nyid kyi shes rab kyis dngos po thams cad ma dmigs pa nyid du nges par brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad du chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nyid kyi shes rab kyis dngos po thams cad ma dmigs pa nyid du nges par brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: This is what is being said: because of the certainty of the non-apprehension of all things by the wisdom that is the correct discrimination of phenomena,

original: dpyad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin med pa nyid chos nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dpyad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin med pa nyid chos nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: the absence of nature of the perfection of wisdom is the aspect by way of the nature of things through analysis.

original: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, the peak is threefold, endowed with the object and aspect of the peak, because it is the peak of the wavering roots of virtue.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: gzugs sogs mi gnas de dag ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs mi gnas de dag ni //
translated: Forms and so forth do not abide in that

original: de yi ngo bor rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor rang bzhin med //
translated: they are devoid of nature in their essence.🔽They are the same nature as that,

original: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
analyzed: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
translated: but do not abide as impermanent and so forth.

original: de rnams de yi ngo bos stong //
analyzed: de rnams de yi ngo bos stong //
translated: They are empty of that essence.

original: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig //
analyzed: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig //
translated: They are the same nature as that.🔽Because of not apprehending phenomena and

original: chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // de dag mtshan mar mi mthong phyir //
analyzed: chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // de dag mtshan mar mi mthong phyir //
translated: not seeing their signs,

original: thams cad dmigs su med par ni //
analyzed: thams cad dmigs su med par ni //
translated: All are not perceived.

original: shes rab kyis ni yongs rtogs pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yongs rtogs pa //
translated: One should fully understand this with wisdom.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: da ni rtse mo'i 'og tu bzod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i dmigs pa'i don 'dri ba sngon du 'gro bas gsungs pa ni de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni rtse mo'i 'og tu bzod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i dmigs pa'i don 'dri ba sngon du 'gro bas gsungs pa ni de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, after the peak, the root of merit belonging to patience, which is small, is stated with the meaning of the object of observation as a preliminary: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this, and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: If it is devoid of intrinsic reality, and so on, is the remainder.

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba dmigs pa yin na /
translated: This is what is said: When the object of observation is devoid of the intrinsic reality of form, and so on,

original: de'i tshe rgyu gang gis gtsor bzod pa chung du'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu gang gis gtsor bzod pa chung du'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: at that time, by what cause should one know that the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of small patience, is not separated?

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the intrinsic reality of dependent origination.

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i lan rig par byed pas smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i lan rig par byed pas smras pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in the sense of the idea “because this exists, that arises,” the reply is understood as “form itself is free from the reality of form.”

original: gzhan du na gang gi tshe gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: gzhan du na gang gi tshe gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes dris pa na /
translated: Otherwise, when it is asked, “form itself is free from the reality of form,”

original: gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i lan mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i lan mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be illogical to reply, “form itself is free from the reality of form.”

original: yang ji ltar na @37b gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid yin par bstan pa nyid kyis gzhan rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang yang bral ba nyid du bstan pa yin zhes bya ba'i don de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na @37b gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid yin par bstan pa nyid kyis gzhan rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang yang bral ba nyid du bstan pa yin zhes bya ba'i don de gsungs pa ni /
translated: Again, anticipating the doubt, “How is it that form and so on are free from reality?”🔽he says the very statement that the perfection of wisdom is free from reality teaches that the others are also free from reality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of that is stated in the passage beginning, “The perfection of wisdom is free from the reality of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the general nature of the characteristic of the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang yang bral ba zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras so //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang yang bral ba zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras so //
translated: Again means that it is also free from the nature and characteristic of the perfection of wisdom. This is the meaning of the word again.

original: 'o na ni bstan pa'i 'bras bu ni phyin ci log ldog pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid dang mtshon bya yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni bstan pa'i 'bras bu ni phyin ci log ldog pa yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid dang mtshon bya yod do zhe na /
translated: If so, since the result of the teaching is the cessation of error, the characteristic and the characterized exist.

original: mtshan nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says The characteristic too and so on.

original: mtshan nyid ni spyi yin la mtshan gzhi mtshon bya ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni spyi yin la mtshan gzhi mtshon bya ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The characteristic is the general, and the characterized, the particular.

original: de lta na de gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid yod do zhe na /🔽ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de lta na de gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid yod do zhe na / ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o zhes smos te /
translated: If so, their nature exists.🔽He says The nature too is free from the characteristic of nature.

original: mtshon bya mtshan nyid rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshan nyid rnam spangs shing //
translated: The characterized, devoid of characteristic,

original: tshig tu brjod pa dang bral ni //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa dang bral ni //
translated: is free from verbal expression.

original: de nyid mtshon bya mtshan nyid du //
analyzed: de nyid mtshon bya mtshan nyid du //
translated: That is the characteristic of what is to be illustrated.🔽

original: gnas pa btags pa yin par rigs //
analyzed: gnas pa btags pa yin par rigs //
translated: That is reasonable as the designation of the characteristic of the characterized.

original: zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the thought.

original: 'di skad du stong pa nyid kyis mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis na rang bzhin med pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du stong pa nyid kyis mtshon bya dang mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis na rang bzhin med pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is said that the object of perception is form, etc. , qualified by essencelessness, by the identity of the characterized and the characteristic through emptiness.

original: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba sngon du 'gro bas rnam pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba sngon du 'gro bas rnam pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: With the question, “In what way is it perceived? ” preceding, the meaning of “aspect” is stated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Venerable Subhūti, etc.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba dmigs pa 'di la kun rdzob tu slob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ci thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba dmigs pa 'di la kun rdzob tu slob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ci thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the one who trains in this object of perception, the conventional, does he go forth to omniscience?

original: rgyu des bzod pa chung dur gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thob par 'gyur rnam zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu des bzod pa chung dur gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thob par 'gyur rnam zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: By that cause, he attains the root of merit included in the lesser forbearance. This is the thought.

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba nyid du smras so zhes khas blang pa'i don du /
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba nyid du smras so zhes khas blang pa'i don du /
translated: The meaning of the statement I do not contradict reality is as follows.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The statement It is just so, Venerable Śāriputra! and so on.

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa rnams dngos po med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa rnams dngos po med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of one will go forth is as follows: The nature of form and so on, which is the non-existence of entities, is the aspect from the perspective of the ultimate and the conventional.

original: de bsgoms pas zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽yang ji ltar na bzod pa chung du'i dge ba'i rtsa ba @38a * //
analyzed: de bsgoms pas zhes bya ba'i don to // yang ji ltar na bzod pa chung du'i dge ba'i rtsa ba @38a * //
translated: The meaning of by cultivating that is as follows.

original: la slob pa na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /🔽'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: la slob pa na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas / 'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: Again, how does one who is training in the roots of merit of lesser patience go to the knowledge of all aspects? The doubt is as follows: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad ni nges par 'byung ba med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos thams cad ni nges par 'byung ba med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the object of meditation of the medium [patience] is stated by Venerable Śāriputra, all phenomena are without going forth.

original: gong nas gong du dmigs pa'i khyad par la sogs pas rtogs pa'i khyad par du gyur pa na nges pa nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gong nas gong du dmigs pa'i khyad par la sogs pas rtogs pa'i khyad par du gyur pa na nges pa nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that when there is a distinction in realization due to the distinction in the object of observation and so forth, it becomes definite.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba la ste chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba la ste chos thams cad ni ma skyes pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” is for the sake of emphasis: the meaning is that all phenomena are non-arisen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams skad cig ma gcig gi mi rtag pa nyid kyis na skye ba'i chos bkag pas nges par 'byung ba med pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i yan lag ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams skad cig ma gcig gi mi rtag pa nyid kyis na skye ba'i chos bkag pas nges par 'byung ba med pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i yan lag ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Because phenomena are impermanent in the sense of being momentary, the quality of being produced is negated, and so they are not the limbs of nirvana, which is the definite emergence.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyis na skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyis na skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “all phenomena” is that because of being essentially non-arisen, they are objects of observation that are distinguished by being without production and without cessation.

original: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what mode are they observed?

original: de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase “if one practices in that way” and so forth is stated.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis de ltar spyod cing bsgoms na ste /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis de ltar spyod cing bsgoms na ste /
translated: If one practices and meditates in this way, as has just been explained,

original: 'gro ba'i don thams cad ni rtogs pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don thams cad ni rtogs pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the benefit of beings is the benefit of realization.

original: nye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni myur du rtogs pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni myur du rtogs pa thob pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is near, because one is close to the attainment of realization.

original: sems can yongs su smin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la nges par sbyor ba la sems can yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la nges par sbyor ba la sems can yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of the full maturation of beings, because of the full maturation of beings in the definite application to virtuous qualities.

original: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid shes pas lus la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid shes pas lus la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of the purification of the body, etc., because of the purification of all aspects of the body, etc., due to the knowledge of the intrinsic reality nature of all things.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa rgyu'i sgo nas bslabs pa las lus kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pas lus yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa rgyu'i sgo nas bslabs pa las lus kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pas lus yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The purification of the body is due to the purification of the three types of physical action, which is the cause of purification in the aspect of cause, from training in the purification of all aspects of the body, etc.

original: sems rnam par dag pa ni yid kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa ni yid kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purification of mind is the complete purification of the three types of mental karma.

original: mtshan yongs su dag pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gnas na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mtshan yongs su dag pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gnas na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The purification of marks is the thirty-two marks of a great person, which are present, clear, and complete.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su dag pa nyid do //
translated: The purification of the buddhaverse is the complete purification of the world of beings and the world of their environments.

original: @38b nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir na cung zad tsam gyis yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: @38b nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir na cung zad tsam gyis yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Since these are completely absent in the stage of the factors conducive to insight, it is said that they are due to a small amount.

original: yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba ni de ltar nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba ni de ltar nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “the venerable Śāriputra” is a summary of what has been discussed.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the object of the great is stated in the passage beginning with “If, Śāriputra,” and so on.

original: 'di snyam du ji srid mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa la spyod pa de srid du mtshan ma ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes gsungs pas dmigs pa'i g-yang sa 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ltung bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji srid mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa la spyod pa de srid du mtshan ma ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes gsungs pas dmigs pa'i g-yang sa 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ltung bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thinking thus, As long as one is engaged in apprehending signs by way of manifest clinging, the sign is the affliction of the bodhisattva, the bodhisattva falls into the abyss of the objective, into the affliction of cyclic existence.

original: de la gzugs ni 'bras bur gyur ba'o //🔽gzugs kyi mtshan ma ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni 'bras bur gyur ba'o // gzugs kyi mtshan ma ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Here, form is the effect.🔽The sign of form is the cooperating cause.

original: gzugs mchan ma'o snyam du zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs mchan ma'o snyam du zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The thought form is a sign is the appropriating cause.

original: gzugs skye ba ni skye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs skye ba ni skye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The arising of form is the occurrence of birth.

original: 'gag pa ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pas so //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pas so //
translated: Cessation is by momentariness and impermanence.

original: stong pa ni gnyi ga med pas te /
analyzed: stong pa ni gnyi ga med pas te /
translated: Emptiness is by the absence of both.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log la 'jug pa yin pas thabs la mi mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log la 'jug pa yin pas thabs la mi mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the entry into error, and so it should be understood as the lack of skill in means.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan nas /
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan nas /
translated: Having taught by way of cessation,🔽now he teaches by way of noncessation.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas gsungs pa ni ji ltar spyad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas gsungs pa ni ji ltar spyad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation in terms of the subsequent conformity is “How should one practice?”

original: de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te /
translated: “Thus practicing” is the summary.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Since the characteristics of particular and universal do not hold, the object is the special form, etc., which is “signlessness of all things.”

original: de ltar spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzod pa chen po'i rang bzhin la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzod pa chen po'i rang bzhin la spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices thus practices the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of great patience.

original: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what mode should one apprehend?

original: de spyod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de spyod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Although practicing thus” and so on is stated.

original: sgrub pa dang ni dgag pa dang // de dag nyid ni ldan pa dang // de dag nyid ni dgag pa dag / rnam pa kun tu mi rtogs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang ni dgag pa dang // de dag nyid ni ldan pa dang // de dag nyid ni dgag pa dag / rnam pa kun tu mi rtogs so //
translated: The establishment, the negation, and the possession of those, and the negation of those, are not imagined in any way.

original: zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the thought.

original: yang mi rtogs na ji ltar na bsgom par bya ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: yang mi rtogs na ji ltar na bsgom par bya ba yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The objection is anticipated with “Why is that?”

original: chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and the response is given with “All dharmas are devoid of a sign of their own-nature,” etc.

original: gang gi rang bzhin kho nas gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi rten dang bral ba nyid kyis mos pa yid la byed pas mi mos shing /
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin kho nas gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi rten dang bral ba nyid kyis mos pa yid la byed pas mi mos shing /
translated: Since the sign of form, etc., is devoid of a basis by its very own-nature, one does not believe it through the mental attention of belief.

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa med pa zhes chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas @39a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa med pa zhes chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas @39a * //
translated: Since one does not fully understand it through the mental attention of reality, one does not understand it from the perspective of the nature of things.

original: dmigs pa na lhag par mos pas bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir nye bar ma rtogs pa dang / de kho na nyid yid la byed pas ma bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa na lhag par mos pas bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir nye bar ma rtogs pa dang / de kho na nyid yid la byed pas ma bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ma zin pa yin no //
translated: Since one does not believe it through the mental attention of belief, one does not apprehend it because one does not appropriate it. Since one does not fully understand it through the mental attention of reality, one does not grasp it.

original: de ltar na ngan 'gro med pas chos chen po la bzod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na ngan 'gro med pas chos chen po la bzod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since one has patience with the great Dharma because one does not go to an unfortunate migratory state,

original: bzod par gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bzod par gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: it is threefold because it is endowed with the objective support and the aspects that pertain to patience.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
analyzed: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
translated: The naturelessness of form and so on,

original: de med pa nyid ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de med pa nyid ngo bo nyid //
translated: Their nonexistence is their nature.

original: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
analyzed: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
translated: They are not produced and do not cease,

original: dag dang de dag mtshan ma med //🔽de yi mtshan mar mi rten pas //
analyzed: dag dang de dag mtshan ma med // de yi mtshan mar mi rten pas //
translated: They are pure and are signless.🔽Since they are not based on signs,

original: mos min 'du shes med pa yin //
analyzed: mos min 'du shes med pa yin //
translated: They are not objects of mental orientation.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bzod thob ngan song mi ltung ngo zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bzod thob ngan song mi ltung ngo zhes bshad pas /
translated: Therefore, it is said that those who have attained the acceptance of nonproduction do not fall into miserable realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzod pa skyed par mi byed do zhes slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzod pa skyed par mi byed do zhes slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: The statement by the master that “Bodhisattvas do not generate the acceptance of nonproduction” is something to be pondered,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod pa rtogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod pa rtogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that bodhisattvas realize the acceptance of nonproduction.

original: bzod pa thob pa ngan song du mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i mdo dang yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: bzod pa thob pa ngan song du mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i mdo dang yang mi 'gal te /
translated: It is not contradictory to the sutra that says that those who have attained the acceptance of nonproduction do not go to miserable realms,

original: las kyi dbang gis snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is intended that they do not go through the power of karma.

original: 'di ni nges par 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nges par 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood with certainty.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yang mdzes dga' khyer te dmyal bar rgyur song ngo zhes phyogs gzhan du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yang mdzes dga' khyer te dmyal bar rgyur song ngo zhes phyogs gzhan du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One's words have carried Śāriputra and others to the hells, as explained in other contexts.

original: da ni bzod pa'i 'og tu chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni bzod pa'i 'og tu chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, after patience, the meaning of the object of observation of the small roots of virtue belonging to the supreme mundane quality is stated: this is called the vast meditative stabilization, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang gis chos thams cad nye bar len par mi byed pa de ni ting nge 'dzin chos thams cad len pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang gis chos thams cad nye bar len par mi byed pa de ni ting nge 'dzin chos thams cad len pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That meditative stabilization by which all phenomena are not appropriated is called the meditative stabilization of the non-appropriation of all phenomena.

original: 'di ni de kho na nyid du ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pas na yangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na nyid du ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pas na yangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod do zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is called vast, etc., because it is the meditative stabilization that is the very essence of reality, and it is the object of observation of form, etc.

original: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what aspect is it observed?

original: ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is stated: the meditative stabilization of the bodhisattva who dwells in this, etc.

original: rnam pa ni rang gi smon lam dang bsod nams dang ye shes dang chos kyi dbyings kyi stobs kyis lhun gyis grub par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba 'jug go zhes 'bras bu'i sgo nas
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang gi smon lam dang bsod nams dang ye shes dang chos kyi dbyings kyi stobs kyis lhun gyis grub par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba 'jug go zhes 'bras bu'i sgo nas
translated: The aspect is that, by the power of one's own prayer, merit, intuition, and Dharma-element, one effortlessly engages in the activity of concentration in all world-realms, in accordance with the fortune of the disciples.

original: dmigs pa'i phyir myur du bla na med pa yang @39b dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir myur du bla na med pa yang @39b dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Thus, by the door of result, one quickly awakens to supreme enlightenment.

original: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the medium objective is stated from Then, by the power of the Buddha...

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i skabs yin yang tshig de yang smos pa ni spobs pa'i khyad par mngon par ston pa'i don yin no//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i skabs yin yang tshig de yang smos pa ni spobs pa'i khyad par mngon par ston pa'i don yin no//
translated: Although it is the occasion of the power of the Buddha, the statement of that word is for the purpose of demonstrating the special eloquence.

original: yang na gdul bya rnams kyi de la dran pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: yang na gdul bya rnams kyi de la dran pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: Or, it is for the purpose of stabilizing the memory of the disciples in that.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i 'bring la'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i 'bring la'o //
translated: This refers to the medium belonging to the supreme mundane quality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The one thus gone and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad du phyin ci ma log par chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du phyin ci ma log par chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the one thus gone because he is endowed with the perfection of others' welfare, since he teaches the Dharma without error in all ways.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang ldan pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pas dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang ldan pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pas dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: He is the foe destroyer because he is endowed with the perfection of his own welfare, since he abandons afflictive obscurations and the obscurations to omniscience along with their latent states.

original: phun sum tshogs pa gnyis thob par byed pa'i lam thugs su chud pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa gnyis thob par byed pa'i lam thugs su chud pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is the perfect buddha because he has realized the path that brings about the attainment of those two perfections.🔽The prophecy is the prediction by the buddhas that one will attain buddhahood, which is the natural result of possessing the concentration of correct engagement.

original: lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni yang dag par zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis lung bstan par mdzad pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no zhes lung bstan pa'i rgyu khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir
analyzed: lung bstan to zhes bya ba ni yang dag par zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis lung bstan par mdzad pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no zhes lung bstan pa'i rgyu khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir
translated: The one who has attained the concentration of correct engagement is the one who has attained the concentration of correct engagement.

original: ro // rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ro // rnam pa gang gis dmigs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be apprehended?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That” and so on.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: “One does not see” means with a non-conceptual mind.

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi bgyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi bgyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: “One does not think” means with a conceptual mind.

original: de kho na nyid du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in reality.

original: bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o //
translated: “I am concentrated” means one has attained meditative concentration.

original: snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug tu gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am dus gsum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug tu gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am dus gsum du gyur pa'o //
translated: “One enters into meditative absorption” and so on refers to the conceptualization that occurs in the preparatory, principal, and subsequent stages, or to the three times.

original: thams cad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: thams cad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: “In every way” and so on.

original: thams cad ni 'di gnyis te dngos po thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad do zhes bshad pas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i dbye bas thams cad nas so //
analyzed: thams cad ni 'di gnyis te dngos po thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad do zhes bshad pas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i dbye bas thams cad nas so //
translated: All means these two: all things and all aspects. Since it is explained that all things are past, etc.,

original: phung po la sogs pa'i yul can rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag gi dngos po ni thams cad do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i yul can rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag gi dngos po ni thams cad do //
translated: all things are the distinctions of the conceptualizations that have the aggregates, etc., as their objects.

original: chung du'i chung du la sogs pa'i yang rnam pas rnam pa thams cad kyi'o //🔽bag chags @40a * //
analyzed: chung du'i chung du la sogs pa'i yang rnam pas rnam pa thams cad kyi'o // bag chags @40a * //
translated: All aspects means the aspects of small, small, etc.

original: dang bcas pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni thams cad du'o //
translated: All means all the aspects of the habitual tendencies.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi 'thad pas byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bos rtogs pa la bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi 'byung bas ma mchis te chos nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa la bslab pa'i
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi 'thad pas byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bos rtogs pa la bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi 'byung bas ma mchis te chos nyid kyi sgo nas rnam pa la bslab pa'i
translated: Since all conceptualizations are untenable, the cognition of the bodhisattva who has realized the nature of meditative concentration does not arise as the thought “I am in equipoise,” etc., and so it is said that it does not exist.

original: phyir mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: It does not arise because of the non-arising of the aspects from the perspective of reality.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the great object of observation is stated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'das na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'das na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, Venerable Śāriputra, what is the name of the samādhi in which the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Śākyamuni, the Bodhisattva, the Great Hero, was dwelling when he outshone the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and all the beings in the buddha field?🔽Śāriputra said, Subhūti, is it possible to demonstrate that samādhi?🔽The Venerable Subhūti said, Venerable Śāriputra, is it possible to demonstrate the samādhi in which the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Śākyamuni, the Bodhisattva, the Great Hero, was dwelling when he outshone the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and all the beings in the buddha field?

original: chos kyi mchog chen por gtogs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba ni /🔽ci byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog chen por gtogs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba ni / ci byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Śāriputra said, Subhūti, is it possible to demonstrate that samādhi?

original: glegs bam la la las ni ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na zhes 'don te /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na zhes 'don te /
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, Venerable Śāriputra, is it possible to demonstrate the samādhi in which the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Śākyamuni, the Bodhisattva, the Great Hero, was dwelling when he outshone the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and all the beings in the buddha field?

original: de la ting nge 'dzin bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba dris pa'i tshig de nyid mi 'byor pa yin pas dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba dris pa'i tshig de nyid mi 'byor pa yin pas dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra said, Subhūti, is it possible to demonstrate that samādhi?🔽The Venerable Subhūti said, Venerable Śāriputra, is it possible to demonstrate the samādhi in which the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Śākyamuni, the Bodhisattva, the Great Hero, was dwelling when he outshone the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and all the beings in the buddha field?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lan yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lan yin te /
translated: Śāriputra said, Subhūti, is it possible to demonstrate that samādhi?

original: chos nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, Venerable Śāriputra, is it possible to demonstrate the samādhi in which the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Śākyamuni, the Bodhisattva, the Great Hero, was dwelling when he outshone the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and all the beings in the buddha field?🔽Śāriputra said,

original: don gsum phan tshun ngo bo gcig pa yin no zhes so sor bstan par mi nus pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir na mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gsum phan tshun ngo bo gcig pa yin no zhes so sor bstan par mi nus pa'i khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir na mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is impossible to point out the three aspects as being the same entity.

original: yang ji ltar na sgom bzhin pa yang bstan par mi nus snyam du dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na sgom bzhin pa yang bstan par mi nus snyam du dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Again, how is it that it is impossible to point out what is being cultivated?🔽The reply is given in terms of the mode of perception:

original: rnam pa ston pas lan gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu des ting nge 'dzin de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ston pas lan gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu des ting nge 'dzin de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, that samādhi is also…”

original: chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin du rnam par mi rtog pa ni thabs dam pa yin zhes chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas dmigs pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin du rnam par mi rtog pa ni thabs dam pa yin zhes chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas dmigs pas /
translated: Since all phenomena do not exist, non-conceptuality in samādhi is the highest method. By observing through the mode of reality,

original: ting nge 'dzin de yang rnam pa med pa'i sems kyis mi shes te nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang rnam pa med pa'i sems kyis mi shes te nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that samādhi is not known by a mind without aspects, because there is no proximate cause.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pas yang dag par mi shes te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pas yang dag par mi shes te /
translated: It is not known by one with aspects, because

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin yang rmi lam la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin yang rmi lam la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though things do not exist, dreams and so on are possible.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: The word “also” means not only in terms of aspects.
