original: 'di zhes bya bar mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bar mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: The thought is that “this” is seen to depend on conceptualization.

original: thams cad nye bar ma dmigs pa la bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa mi 'thad do zhes bya bar @40b dgongs pas /
analyzed: thams cad nye bar ma dmigs pa la bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa mi 'thad do zhes bya bar @40b dgongs pas /
translated: The thought is that when all is not apprehended, meditation, the meditator, and the object of meditation are not tenable.

original: sh'a ri'i bu mi shes yang dag par mi shes zhes zer ram zhes smras so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mi shes yang dag par mi shes zhes zer ram zhes smras so //
translated: Śāriputra said, “Do you say ‘I do not know, I do not understand’?”

original: kun rdzob tu nyes pa med do snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu nyes pa med do snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Thinking that there is no fault in the conventional,

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra…” and so on.

original: bsam pa de nyid ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bsam pa de nyid ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
translated: That very thought is expressed by “Why is that?”

original: ting nge 'dzin de med pas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de med pas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is because that samādhi does not exist.

original: de kho na nyid du na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: In reality means the remainder.

original: sbyor ba la sogs pa ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la sogs pa ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The application, etc. are like an illusory person, by the power of a previous impetus.

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar ston pas legs so zhes bya ba'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar ston pas legs so zhes bya ba'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to show that it is not contradictory to reality, he says, “Excellent!”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is stated in the passage beginning with “Venerable Subhūti, excellent!”

original: spobs pa ni khyod la der snang ba'i shes pa skyes pas so //
analyzed: spobs pa ni khyod la der snang ba'i shes pa skyes pas so //
translated: Eloquence is the arising of the cognition that appears as that.

original: ston pa ni gzhan rnams la dmigs pa de ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa ni gzhan rnams la dmigs pa de ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Teaching is the demonstration of that object to others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The summary is stated in the passage beginning with “bodhisattva.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: ” The word “only” is a restriction.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di la de kho na ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di la de kho na ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should train in this factor of the path to penetration just as it has been taught.

original: yang ji ltar na rim pa 'dis bslab par bya snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rim pa 'dis bslab par bya snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt is introduced by “why is that?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzungs so //
translated: The response is “because bodhisattvas…”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: “In the perfection of wisdom” refers to the nature of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it is the highest of all mundane phenomena,

original: chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: it is the supreme mundane state, which has three aspects: object, aspect, and possession.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it says,

original: ting 'dzin de yi byed pa nyid //
analyzed: ting 'dzin de yi byed pa nyid //
translated: The function of that meditative absorption

original: lung ston pa dang rlom pa zad //
analyzed: lung ston pa dang rlom pa zad //
translated: Is to predict and to end conceit.

original: gsum po phan tshun ngo bo gcig / ting 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa //
analyzed: gsum po phan tshun ngo bo gcig / ting 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa //
translated: The three have the same nature in meditative absorption,🔽Which is nonconceptual.

original: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
analyzed: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
translated: Thus the factors conducive to penetrative insight

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Are small, middling, and great.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: de ltar chos rnam par 'byed pa byas shing mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa sgom pa na /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnam par 'byed pa byas shing mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa sgom pa na /
translated: Thus, when one cultivates the contemplation of the selflessness of all things by means of the mind of meditative equipoise that has analyzed things,

original: gang gi tshe rim gyis don tha dad par gyur pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ye shes kyi snang ba cung zad gsal bas yud tsam kho na mthong ba de'i tshe 'di'i dro bar gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rim gyis don tha dad par gyur pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ye shes kyi snang ba cung zad gsal bas yud tsam kho na mthong ba de'i tshe 'di'i dro bar gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
translated: then when one sees for just a moment with the slightly clear light of wisdom because of the absence of manifest adherence to the diversity of objects, that is the stage of heat.

original: de nyid ni theg pa chen po 'dir snang ba thob pa @41a * //
analyzed: de nyid ni theg pa chen po 'dir snang ba thob pa @41a * //
translated: That is called the attainment of light in this Great Vehicle.

original: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du brjod do //
translated: It is called the concentration of attainment of light.

original: gang gi tshe chos kyi snang ba de nyid 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir bdag med par sgom pa brtson 'grus rtsom pas ye shes kyi snang ba 'bring tsam du gsal bar gyur ba de'i tshe ni rtse mo'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos kyi snang ba de nyid 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir bdag med par sgom pa brtson 'grus rtsom pas ye shes kyi snang ba 'bring tsam du gsal bar gyur ba de'i tshe ni rtse mo'i gnas skabs te /
translated: When one cultivates the contemplation of selflessness with the exertion of striving in order to increase that light of wisdom, and the light of wisdom becomes slightly clearer, that is the stage of the summit.

original: de nyid ni snang ba mched pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nyid ni snang ba mched pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is called the concentration of the increase of light.

original: gang gi tshe na sems tsam du gnas pas phyi'i don la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir shin tu gsal bar shes pa'i snang ba skyes pa de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na sems tsam du gnas pas phyi'i don la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir shin tu gsal bar shes pa'i snang ba skyes pa de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: When the appearance of the object of knowledge arises as extremely clear due to the absence of attachment to external objects by abiding in mind-only, that is the stage of acceptance.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa med par rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir na de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa med par rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir na de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: Because it is engaged without the aspect of the object, it is concentration engaged in one part of the meaning of reality.

original: yang gang gi tshe don la 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng bar snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs te //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe don la 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng bar snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs te //
translated: When the appearance of wisdom free from the appearance of distraction that apprehends objects is perfected, that is the stage of supreme mundane quality.

original: de nyid ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called uninterrupted concentration.

original: gnas skabs 'di dag thams cad ni lhag par mos pa brtan pa yin pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di dag thams cad ni lhag par mos pa brtan pa yin pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: All these stages are explained as the level of practice through belief because they are the firm belief of superior intention.

original: sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so so'i skye bo yin na yang byis pa'i rgud pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing /
analyzed: sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so so'i skye bo yin na yang byis pa'i rgud pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing /
translated: Although the bodhisattva who is on this level is an ordinary being, he is completely beyond all the faults of a child.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan grangs med pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes dkon mchog sprin las gsungs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan grangs med pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes dkon mchog sprin las gsungs so //
translated: It is said in the Cloud of Jewels Satra that he possesses countless good qualities such as meditative stabilizations, dhāraṇīs, liberations, and superknowledges.

original: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang rgyu nyid kyi khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang rgyu nyid kyi khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the object, aspects, and cause of the aids to penetration,

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i don las gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dngos po thams cad kyi rten can dang por gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i don las gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dngos po thams cad kyi rten can dang por gsungs pa ni /
translated: the Bhagavān then taught the first of the four kinds of conceptual thoughts, the conceptual thought of the object, which is based on all things.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ci zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ci zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains like this, what do you think?”

original: brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu slob po snyam du dgongs pas gsungs pa ni de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu slob po snyam du dgongs pas gsungs pa ni de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Lord's thought in saying if one trains thus and so on is that one should train in the conventional.

original: sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ma shes nas dris pa ni de kho na nyid du na chos gang la slob pa lags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ma shes nas dris pa ni de kho na nyid du na chos gang la slob pa lags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Śāriputra, not understanding the Lord's thought, asks, In what Dharma does one train?

original: de la gzhi tsam la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pas phyin ci log dang 'brel par 'gyur @41b pa'i phyir don dam par gang la yang ma yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni chos gang la yang mi slob bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gzhi tsam la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pas phyin ci log dang 'brel par 'gyur @41b pa'i phyir don dam par gang la yang ma yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni chos gang la yang mi slob bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Lord says, In no Dharma, meaning that ultimately one does not train in any Dharma, because one would be related to error through conceptual thought based on mere bases.

original: slob bzhin pa na yang ji ltar mi slob pa yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: slob bzhin pa na yang ji ltar mi slob pa yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Suspecting that if one is training, one is not not training, he asks, Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Lord says, Śāriputra, those dharmas...

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pas na byis pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pas na byis pa'o //
translated: The childish are those who possess defiled dharmas.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang bral bas na so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang bral bas na so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: The ordinary man is devoid of the dharmas of purification.

original: de dag nyid ni 'di lta bu'i chos la mos pa dang thos pa mang ba dang bral bas thos pa dang mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni 'di lta bu'i chos la mos pa dang thos pa mang ba dang bral bas thos pa dang mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are devoid of learning because they are devoid of the faith in and the hearing of such dharmas.

original: 'di snyam du ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis yod pa nyid du nye bar dmigs pas ji ltar mngon par chags pa de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis yod pa nyid du nye bar dmigs pas ji ltar mngon par chags pa de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is thus: By the power of the discursive thought of nescience, one observes the existence of the existent as it is, but it does not exist as it is grasped.

original: de bas na kun rdzob tu slob kyi don dam par mi slob bo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob tu slob kyi don dam par mi slob bo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, One trains conventionally, not ultimately.

original: gal te de ltar med na 'o na ni don gyis gzhan du yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar med na 'o na ni don gyis gzhan du yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If it does not exist in that way, then it does not exist as something else in reality.

original: de lta na yang dngos por 'dzin pa'i phyir skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pas smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'o na ji lta bur mchis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos por 'dzin pa'i phyir skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pas smras pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'o na ji lta bur mchis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then because one grasps it as a thing, there is the fault, thinking thus, he says, Well then, Blessed One, how does it exist?

original: 'on te phyin ci log gi yul bsal ba'i phyir ji ltar mngon par chags pa de bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes de skad du gsungs pa yin mod /
analyzed: 'on te phyin ci log gi yul bsal ba'i phyir ji ltar mngon par chags pa de bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes de skad du gsungs pa yin mod /
translated: Or, in order to eliminate the object of error, it is said, “It does not exist as it is imagined.”

original: de lta na yang yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bka' stsal pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bka' stsal pa ni /
translated: Even so, the statement, “It does not exist in reality,”

original: ji ltar med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is explained in the passage beginning with “It is said that it does not exist in the way it is imagined.”

original: ji ltar rigs pas dpyad na med pa de ltar ma brtags gcig tu na nyams dga' ba nyid kyis kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pas dpyad na med pa de ltar ma brtags gcig tu na nyams dga' ba nyid kyis kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
translated: Since it does not exist when analyzed by reason, it exists conventionally, in the sense that it is delightful only if not investigated.

original: med pa nyid du yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa nyid du yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that it exists in the sense of not existing.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The passage beginning with “Thus” is a summary.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar med pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis kun rdzob tu phyin ci log gi shes pa mi shes pa la ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar med pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis kun rdzob tu phyin ci log gi shes pa mi shes pa la ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Since it does not exist in that way, for that reason, by the method of etymology, it is said that conventional error is ignorance in the sense of non-knowledge.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this expresses the conceptualization of ignorance.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the conceptualization of the aggregates such as form, he says: “in regard to those,” etc.

original: dngos po tsam la brten pas na de la rag las pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyang 'brel par shes par bya ba'i don du snga ma dang 'brel par brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po tsam la brten pas na de la rag las pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyang 'brel par shes par bya ba'i don du snga ma dang 'brel par brjod do //
translated: Since they are based on mere entities, all conceptualizations that depend on them are to be understood as related. In order to demonstrate this, he says: “the former is related to the latter.”

original: 'og ma rnams la yang shes par @42a * //
analyzed: 'og ma rnams la yang shes par @42a * //
translated: This should be understood in regard to the following as well.

original: bya'o ; ; ji ltar mngon par zhen pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: bya'o ; ; ji ltar mngon par zhen pa yin snyam na /
translated: How is there the adherence to that?

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says: “by them,” etc.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa nyid du med pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pa las der rtog pa'i sgo nas sgro btags shing brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa nyid du med pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pa las der rtog pa'i sgo nas sgro btags shing brjod pa yin no //
translated: All dharmas such as the aggregate of form, which do not exist in reality, are imagined as such through the conceptualization of unreality. They are imagined through superimposition and verbalization.

original: ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag gis de la brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag gis de la brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the conceptual thought that is attached to name and form, he says, “If they investigate that with the wisdom that arises from hearing and so on, they do not see name and form.”🔽Conceptual thought is the extreme of eternalism and nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa las /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa las /
translated: Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.

original: rtag pa ni don bya ba dang bral pa'i phyir na kun rdzob tu mi rtag pa kho na yin no zhes ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag /🔽'jig rten pa'i thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pas mi shes so //
analyzed: rtag pa ni don bya ba dang bral pa'i phyir na kun rdzob tu mi rtag pa kho na yin no zhes ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag / 'jig rten pa'i thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pas mi shes so //
translated: Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.

original: mi shes pas ni sngar brtags la //
analyzed: mi shes pas ni sngar brtags la //
translated: Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.

original: phyi nas de nyid don nges pa //🔽gang tshe dngos nyid ma rnyed pa //
analyzed: phyi nas de nyid don nges pa // gang tshe dngos nyid ma rnyed pa //
translated: Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.

original: de tshe dngos med ga la yod //🔽ces bya bar sgom par 'jig rten las 'das pas mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de tshe dngos med ga la yod //🔽ces bya bar sgom par 'jig rten las 'das pas mi mthong ste /
translated: Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of nihilism.🔽Eternalism is the extreme of eternalism, and nihilism is the extreme of

original: de'i phyir de ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de kho na nyid du na med bzhin du de la mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis rtog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de kho na nyid du na med bzhin du de la mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis rtog go //
translated: Therefore, it is imagined that all phenomena such as name and form do not exist in reality, but due to the power of strong attachment to them, they are imagined.

original: mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conceptualization of attachment to the two extremes,

original: brtags nas mtha' gnyis la mngon par chags te zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽de la zhen pa'i rnam rtog pas //
analyzed: brtags nas mtha' gnyis la mngon par chags te zhes bya ba gsungs te / de la zhen pa'i rnam rtog pas //
translated: it is said: Having imagined, one becomes attached to the two extremes.

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that due to the conceptualization of attachment to that,🔽one becomes attached to the two extremes.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conceptualization of not knowing affliction and purification,

original: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: Attachment and so on.🔽 Attachment refers to the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu de'i gzhi de'i dmigs pa la gnas te rgyu mtshan du byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa nas da ltar byung ba'i
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu de'i gzhi de'i dmigs pa la gnas te rgyu mtshan du byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa nas da ltar byung ba'i
translated: The cause of manifest clinging is the basis of that, the objective support of that, the reason for that, the power of the conceptualization that does not understand the intrinsic reality of the phenomena of defilement and purification.🔽From the past up to the present,

original: chos kyi bar la rtog go //
analyzed: chos kyi bar la rtog go //
translated: he conceptualizes the phenomena.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conceptualization that does not abide in the noble path,

original: de dag gis brtags nas ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gis brtags nas ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says: “having investigated with those, they cling to name-and-form.”

original: mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam la gnas par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam la gnas par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is: because of clinging to abiding in the path of seeing and so on.

original: de la ming ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: de la ming ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: Name there is the aggregates that are not form, such as feeling.

original: gzugs ni @42b gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni @42b gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: Form is the form aggregate.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag gis med pa'i chos thams cad la brtags so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag gis med pa'i chos thams cad la brtags so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conceptualization of objects, he says, “They imagine all phenomena to be nonexistent.”

original: dmigs pa de la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa de la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that they are attached to those objects.

original: bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag gis med pa'i chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir de dag gis med pa'i chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conceptualization of self and so on, he says, “They imagine those phenomena to be nonexistent” and so on.

original: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
translated: If there is a self, one knows another.🔽From the division of self and other, there is grasping and aversion.

original: bdag gzhan cha las 'dzin dang sdang // 'di gnyis dang ni 'brel pa las //
analyzed: bdag gzhan cha las 'dzin dang sdang // 'di gnyis dang ni 'brel pa las //
translated: From the connection with these two,

original: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: all faults arise.

original: zhes bya ba bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa las chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par snga ma bzhin du mi shes mi mthong
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa las chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par snga ma bzhin du mi shes mi mthong
translated: From the attachment to self and so on, one does not know, as it is, the path of seeing and so on, which has the characteristic of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and one does not see it.

original: ngo // rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes ma mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te khams gsum pa 'khor ba las nges par mi 'byung ba ni mi
analyzed: ngo // rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes ma mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te khams gsum pa 'khor ba las nges par mi 'byung ba ni mi
translated: The path is not seen and known as it really is means that one does not see and know the path as it really is.🔽One does not go beyond the three realms means that one does not transcend the three realms of cyclic existence.

original: 'da' ba'o // gang gi phyir rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas mchog gi don gyis na yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de kho na nyid khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: 'da' ba'o // gang gi phyir rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pas mchog gi don gyis na yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de kho na nyid khong du mi chud do //
translated: Because of the conception of origination, etc. in purity, one does not understand reality, which is the supreme object, called the limit of reality.

original: de'i phyir rgyu des na byis pa zhes bya bar btags pa'i grangs su 'gro zhing ming thob po //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu des na byis pa zhes bya bar btags pa'i grangs su 'gro zhing ming thob po //
translated: Therefore, by that cause, one is counted among the foolish and obtains that name.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa gnyen po'i rten can bstan pa'i phyir de dag chos bden pa la yid mi ches zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa gnyen po'i rten can bstan pa'i phyir de dag chos bden pa la yid mi ches zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the second kind of apprehended object-conception, which has a remedial basis, it is said: They do not believe in the truth of the Dharma.

original: chos ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Dharma is characterized by the side of the remedy.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term truth is used because it is the opposite of error.

original: yid mi ches so zhes bya ba ni de la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pas phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba med pas mi dad cing lhag par mi mos so //
analyzed: yid mi ches so zhes bya ba ni de la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pas phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba med pas mi dad cing lhag par mi mos so //
translated: One does not believe means that one does not have faith in or aspire to the experience of one's own nature, because one is engaged in the practice of error, having become attached to that.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log tu sgrub pa nyid gsungs pa ni yang sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log tu sgrub pa nyid gsungs pa ni yang sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The practice of error by way of negation is stated in the passage beginning with Moreover, Shariputra, and so forth.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par byang ba'i chos gang la yang zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par byang ba'i chos gang la yang zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is in any purified phenomenon whatsoever by the conceptualization of the apprehended object.

original: de yang 'di ltar yul gyi dbye bas dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar yul gyi dbye bas dgur 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it is ninefold by way of the divisions of the objects.

original: 'di lta ste spungs pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rigs kyi don gyi rnam par @43a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste spungs pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rigs kyi don gyi rnam par @43a * //
translated: They are as follows: the conceptualization of the meaning of a heap, the conceptualization of the meaning of a door of arising, the conceptualization of the meaning of a class, the conceptualization of the meaning of a collection, the conceptualization of the meaning of a continuum, the conceptualization of the meaning of a self, the conceptualization of the meaning of an agent, the conceptualization of the meaning of an experiencer, and the conceptualization of the meaning of an owner.

original: rtog pa dang / skye ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / skye ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: conceptualization of the object of origination, conceptualization of the object of emptiness, conceptualization of the object of the perfections, conceptualization of the path of insight,

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: conceptualization of the path of cultivation, and conceptualization of the path of no learning.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
analyzed: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
translated: By the basis and its antidote,

original: gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: there are two kinds of conceptualization of the apprehended.

original: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
analyzed: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
translated: By the distinctions of delusion, aggregates, etc.,

original: de ni so sor rnam ba dgu //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni so sor rnam ba dgu // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is individually ninefold.

original: de la kha cig na re gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni gzhi thams cad pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni gzhi thams cad pa kho na yin la /
translated: In this regard, some say that the first conceptualization of the apprehended has all the bases,

original: gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba kho na'i gzhi can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba kho na'i gzhi can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ro //
translated: and the second has the bases of purification alone. This is the distinction between these two conceptualizations of the apprehended.

original: de ltar byas nas brjod pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yang yin no zhes tshig snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas brjod pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yang yin no zhes tshig snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the first conception of the apprehended is also the second.

original: re zhig dang po gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yang yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yang yin te /
translated: The first is also the second,

original: dper na gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gzhi thams cad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gzhi thams cad pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, the first conception of the apprehended which has all the bases as its object.

original: gnyis pa kho nar 'gyur gyi dang po ma yin pa ni dper na rnam par byang ba tsam gyi rten can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa kho nar 'gyur gyi dang po ma yin pa ni dper na rnam par byang ba tsam gyi rten can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The second is only the second, but not the first, for example, the second conception of the apprehended which has mere purification as its basis.

original: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi la brten pa ni dang po yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi la brten pa ni dang po yin la /
translated: Others say: The first is based on the basis of defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba'i gzhi la brten pa gnyis pa yin pas 'di gnyis phan tshun rnam par 'chad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'di gnyis ni tha dad pa kho na'i zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i gzhi la brten pa gnyis pa yin pas 'di gnyis phan tshun rnam par 'chad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'di gnyis ni tha dad pa kho na'i zhes zer ro //
translated: and the second is based on the basis of purification. Since these two are mutually exclusive in nature, these two are only different.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can gsungs pa ni /
translated: The first conceptualization of grasping is said to be based on the substantial existence of the person.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The Lord said, “Śāriputra, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in that way, etc.”

original: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi byed par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang pos slob na slob bam ci zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi byed par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang pos slob na slob bam ci zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Thinking, “If one trains with the first conceptualization of grasping, not engaging in the two conceptualizations of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects as explained in the immediately preceding section, is one training?”

original: rnam par rtog pa ni sgrib pa yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni /🔽mi slob ste zhes bya ba de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sgrib pa yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni / mi slob ste zhes bya ba de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The Lord said, “No, one is not training,” because conceptualization is the same as obscuration.🔽The phrase “in reality” is left out.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ni las dang po pa 'di ltar slob po zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ni las dang po pa 'di ltar slob po zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Because it is not tenable in any other way, it is said that “this beginner trains conventionally in that way.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs @43b pa'o ;
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs @43b pa'o ;
translated: The Lord said, “Śāriputra, etc.”

original: ; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The three phrases beginning with “training in omniscience” should be understood as the stages of application and so on, respectively.

original: de yang 'di ltar yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it becomes ninefold due to the division of objects.

original: 'di lta ste rang dbang can gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / gcig pu'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyu'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang dbang can gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / gcig pu'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyu'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: They are as follows: the imagination of a self that is independent, the imagination of a self that is singular, the imagination of a self that is a cause, the imagination of a self that is a seer and so on, the imagination of a self that is the support of affliction, the imagination of a self that is the support of purification, the imagination of a self that is the enjoyer, the imagination of a self that is the agent, and the imagination of a self that is the appropriator.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / don byas pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / don byas pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the self as the basis of the desire-freed, the self as the basis of the path of seeing, the self as the basis of the path of meditation, and the self as the basis of the fulfilled aim.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can no //🔽rnam par rtog pa de la rtsod pa ngan pa spang ba'i sgo nas gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽btags ba tsam kho na'i skyes bu ni 'dzin pa'o zhes mngon par zhen na log par snang ba yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu ste btags pa tsam kho na de yang slob par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can no // rnam par rtog pa de la rtsod pa ngan pa spang ba'i sgo nas gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // btags ba tsam kho na'i skyes bu ni 'dzin pa'o zhes mngon par zhen na log par snang ba yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu ste btags pa tsam kho na de yang slob par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin
translated: The two kinds of grasping-selves are based on the imputedly existent person.🔽The Lord has said that the two kinds of grasping-selves are based on the imputedly existent person.🔽If one conceives that the person is only a mere designation and is the grasper, then that is a wrong view, because the person is like an illusion.

original: te sems med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: te sems med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: If the person is only a mere designation, then even the person who is learning the doctrine of the mere designation would be a mere designation, but that is not so, because he is not mindless.

original: ; yongs su ma shes pa yang slob na ni thams cad kyang slob par 'gyur bas thar pa 'bad pa med par 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gang zhig 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa de skad 'dri na de la lan ji skad bstan
analyzed: ; yongs su ma shes pa yang slob na ni thams cad kyang slob par 'gyur bas thar pa 'bad pa med par 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gang zhig 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa de skad 'dri na de la lan ji skad bstan
translated: With this thought, if someone were to ask, “What is said by that one?” and so on, what answer would be given to that?

original: par bgyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par bgyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni log par snang ba'i rang bzhin du mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni log par snang ba'i rang bzhin du mnyam pa yin te /
translated: Form and so on are equal in being of the nature of false appearance.

original: de bas na rten gzhan med pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra bas bslab par bya zhing thar pa 'bad pa med par 'grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na rten gzhan med pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra bas bslab par bya zhing thar pa 'bad pa med par 'grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since there is no other basis, like an illusory person, one should train. Liberation is not accomplished without effort.

original: rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With this thought, the Lord said, “Subhūti, therefore…” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir khyod de skad 'dri ba 'dir khyed nyid la dri bar byas zhes bya ba slar dri bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod de skad 'dri ba 'dir khyed nyid la dri bar byas zhes bya ba slar dri bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “Since you ask that, I will ask you in return.” This means that you yourself should be questioned about this.

original: bcom ldan 'das legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent! and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das legs so zhes khas blangs par bya ba nas de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ltar nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das legs so zhes khas blangs par bya ba nas de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ltar nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having accepted the Blessed One's statement with Excellent, Blessed One! up to Thus have I heard, means I have listened.

original: @44a * // de ltar ci zhig nyan ce na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽lan ni bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma de gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: @44a * // de ltar ci zhig nyan ce na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // lan ni bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma de gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: What did he listen to? He said The Blessed One said... and so on.🔽The answer is Blessed One, that illusion is not one thing and form and so on are not another.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di dag gzhan pa nyid ma lags te gang gi phyir sgyu ma de gzhan la gzugs la sogs pa de gzhan ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di dag gzhan pa nyid ma lags te gang gi phyir sgyu ma de gzhan la gzugs la sogs pa de gzhan ma lags te /
translated: Blessed One, they are not different, because that illusion is not one thing and form and so on are not another.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid sgyu ma lags so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid sgyu ma lags so //
translated: Form and so on are themselves the illusion.

original: sgyu ma nyid gzugs lags so zhes bya ba de kho na nyid du na gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bas 'di dag dngos po med pa nyid yin pas log par snang ba'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid gzugs lags so zhes bya ba de kho na nyid du na gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bas 'di dag dngos po med pa nyid yin pas log par snang ba'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The statement illusion itself is form means that, in reality, since they are devoid of the nature of unity and multiplicity, they are non-existent, and thus are equal in being the nature of false appearances.

original: sgyu ma dang gzugs la sogs pa phan tshun gcig pa nyid du bstan pa na sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra bas bslab par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang gzugs la sogs pa phan tshun gcig pa nyid du bstan pa na sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra bas bslab par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that illusion and form, etc. are mutually the same, and that one should train in them as being like the illusory person, it is said:

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think? and so on.

original: 'dir 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sgyu ma dang 'dra ba 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la 'du shes te mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sgyu ma dang 'dra ba 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la 'du shes te mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Here, the noble Vimuktisena says that the five appropriated aggregates, which are like illusions, are what are called bodhisattvas. To apprehend them as having characteristics is to perceive them as having substantial reality.

original: bdag po zhes dngos po dang bcas par shes pa ni kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po zhes dngos po dang bcas par shes pa ni kun shes pa'o //
translated: To know them as the owner with substantial reality is to fully know them.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that is attached to the appearance of the object and subject in the object of knowledge and the subject is the representation.

original: gzhan gyis zin pa dang rnam par rig pa dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa'i tha snyad sna tshogs pa ni tha snyad do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zin pa dang rnam par rig pa dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa'i tha snyad sna tshogs pa ni tha snyad do zhes bshad do //
translated: The various conventions that are related to other things that are grasped and represented are the conventional.

original: btsun pa grol sdes ni rigs kyi gnas skabs su ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa grol sdes ni rigs kyi gnas skabs su ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Muktisena explains: At the stage of the lineage, the name is “bodhisattva.”

original: ming 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: ming 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is only a name.

original: sems bskyed ba'i gnas skabs su ni shes pas na kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed ba'i gnas skabs su ni shes pas na kun shes pa'o //
translated: At the stage of generating the mind, it is “all-knowing” because of knowledge.

original: mnyam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam par shes pa ni /
translated: Equal knowledge is

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming gang la mnyam par shes pa'i sems 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de ni mnyam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming gang la mnyam par shes pa'i sems 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa de ni mnyam par shes pa yin te /
translated: the name “bodhisattva.” The reason the mind of equal knowledge engages is that it exists.

original: sems can thams cad mnyam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mnyam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: It is the reason for equal knowledge of all sentient beings.

original: sbyor ba'i sa bdun po la ni chos thams cad btags pa tsam du gtogs pas rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sa bdun po la ni chos thams cad btags pa tsam du gtogs pas rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: On the seven preparatory stages, all phenomena are included in mere designations, so they are consciousness.

original: brgyad pa la sogs par ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir tha snyad tsam du mngon par brjod pas tha snyad ces bya ba yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs par ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir tha snyad tsam du mngon par brjod pas tha snyad ces bya ba yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: On the eighth stage and so on, the path of signlessness is spontaneously accomplished, so it is mere conventionality, since it is expressed as mere conventionality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs la sogs pa logs shig na yod par mi @44b 'thad par khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs la sogs pa logs shig na yod par mi @44b 'thad par khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: The bodhisattva accepts that it is not tenable for form and so on to exist separately, so he says, “It is just so” and so on.

original: rig pa la lan gnyis smros so //
analyzed: rig pa la lan gnyis smros so //
translated: He replies twice to the question.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin te //
translated: The Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, and so on, is a summary.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu des na rten gzhan med pas ji ltar 'khor ba'i las kyi sgyu ma las skyes ba de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyang ye shes kyi sgyu ma las byung ba yin pas mngon par zhen pa med
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu des na rten gzhan med pas ji ltar 'khor ba'i las kyi sgyu ma las skyes ba de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyang ye shes kyi sgyu ma las byung ba yin pas mngon par zhen pa med
translated: For that reason, since there is no other basis, just as the illusion of cyclic existence arises from the illusion of karma, so too transcendent phenomena arise from the illusion of transcendent wisdom.

original: pa'i sbyor bas sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no ;
analyzed: pa'i sbyor bas sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, like an illusory person, you should train in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment through the practice of nonapprehending.

original: ; thar pa 'bad pa med par 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ; thar pa 'bad pa med par 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Liberation is not accomplished without effort.

original: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid shes pa nyid ni thar pa thob par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid shes pa nyid ni thar pa thob par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: For the purpose of attaining liberation, it is the knowledge of thatness itself,

original: ma shes par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ma shes par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: not its nonknowledge, that is intended.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs su ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs su ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt is introduced by “Why is it so?”

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Lord said, “It is like this,” etc.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Those very five appropriative aggregates” etc.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates are contaminated form, etc.

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir phung po lnga po de dag nyid kyang zhes bya ba de ni khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir phung po lnga po de dag nyid kyang zhes bya ba de ni khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: “Those very five aggregates” is an extraction from the context, in order to include the five uncontaminated aggregates.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs nyid kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu'o zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs nyid kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu'o zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The situation of defilement and purification is just like a magical person, as it is seen.

original: yang ji ltar na sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid yin snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid yin snyam du dogs pa de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: To respond to this doubt, he says, Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, It is like this...

original: don smras zin pa yang rnam pa gzhan gyis dogs par byas pa ni zlos pa ma yin pa'i phyir zlos te bshad pa'i nyes pa yod par mi brtags te /
analyzed: don smras zin pa yang rnam pa gzhan gyis dogs par byas pa ni zlos pa ma yin pa'i phyir zlos te bshad pa'i nyes pa yod par mi brtags te /
translated: The meaning has already been stated, but it is doubted in another way. Since it is not a repetition, the fault of explaining a repetition does not apply.

original: thams cad du yang 'di bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang 'di bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in this way everywhere.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bur gsungs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bur gsungs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One said that form is like an illusion...

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because it is said, In these five appropriated aggregates, there is the perception of what is called a bodhisattva...

original: de ma thag kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bur @45a * //🔽gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bur @45a * // gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Immediately after that, the Blessed One said that form and so on are like an illusion.

original: dbang po drug ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six sense faculties are the eye and so on.🔽

original: rna par shes pa yul dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: rna par shes pa yul dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
translated: The phrase “together with its object” refers to the auditory consciousness.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga zhes de ma thag tu 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga zhes de ma thag tu 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the phrase “five aggregates” is now justified.

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug yin te /
translated: The consciousness is the six sense faculties,

original: shes pa nyid de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness itself appears in that way.

original: dbang po drug kyang snga ma bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug kyang snga ma bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The six sense faculties should be understood in the same way as the six consciousnesses.

original: 'dzin par rtog pa skyes bu brtags par yod pa'i rten can bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin par rtog pa skyes bu brtags par yod pa'i rten can bstan pa yin no //
translated: The person is a conceptual designation that is based on the real entity of the six sense faculties.

original: de yang yul gyi dbye bas dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang yul gyi dbye bas dgur 'gyur te /
translated: The person is also of nine types, according to the distinctions of the objects that are grasped.

original: 'di ltar phung po btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / skye mched du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / skye mched du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: The conceptual thought that conceives of the aggregates is one type of conceptual thought; the conceptual thought that conceives of the sense bases is another type of conceptual thought; the conceptual thought that conceives of the constituents is another type of conceptual thought; the conceptual thought that conceives of dependent origination is another type of conceptual thought; the conceptual thought that conceives of the pure is another type of conceptual thought; the conceptual thought that conceives of the impure is another type of conceptual thought; the conceptual thought that conceives of the conditioned is another type of conceptual thought; the conceptual thought that conceives of the unconditioned is another type of conceptual thought; and the conceptual thought that conceives of the past, future, and present is still another type of conceptual thought.

original: mthong ba'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the conceptualization designated as the path of seeing, the conceptualization designated as the path of cultivation, the conceptualization designated as the path of distinction, and the conceptualization designated as the path of no learning.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyi //
analyzed: rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyi //
translated: The grasping that is based on substance and designation

original: 'dzin pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //🔽rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo dang // phung sogs rten la de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'dod // rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo dang // phung sogs rten la de bzhin no //
translated: is also asserted to be of two kinds.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The nature of independence, self, etc., and likewise, the aggregates, etc., are bases.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the four conceptualizations,

original: da ni thabs la mkhas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rang bzhin yongs su 'dzin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni thabs la mkhas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rang bzhin yongs su 'dzin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: now, in order to teach the nature of the spiritual friend who is skilled in means, he says, “the newly entered bodhisattva,” and so on.

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la 'phral du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la 'phral du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase newly entered into the vehicle means those who are temporarily abiding in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni zab pa dang rgya chen po dmigs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni zab pa dang rgya chen po dmigs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase in this refers to the profound and extensive objects, etc.

original: dngang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la gnas ma yin pa la 'jigs pa ni dngang pa ste /
analyzed: dngang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la gnas ma yin pa la 'jigs pa ni dngang pa ste /
translated: The phrase will be frightened, etc. means that they will be frightened by what is not a cause for fear.

original: lam ngan pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: lam ngan pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: This is like a bad road.

original: rgyun du 'jigs pa ni skrag pa ste 'jigs pa skyes pa slar ma ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du 'jigs pa ni skrag pa ste 'jigs pa skyes pa slar ma ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They will be terrified by what is a cause for fear, because fear has arisen and has not been reversed.

original: skrag pa nges par gyur pa ni kun tu skrag pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: skrag pa nges par gyur pa ni kun tu skrag pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They will be terrified, because they are filled with fear.

original: zhum zhing 'gong la 'gyod par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhum zhing 'gong la 'gyod par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They will be remorseful, because they will think, I should not have done this.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bar gyur na ni @45b zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba ma byas par thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms par byas pa'i dmigs pa bkag ste mdo kho nar las dang po ba la skye ba
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bar gyur na ni @45b zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye ba ma byas par thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms par byas pa'i dmigs pa bkag ste mdo kho nar las dang po ba la skye ba
translated: means that if one is a beginner and the object of meditation is taught without a division into the conventional and the ultimate, and without cultivation from beginningless time,

original: med pa la sogs pa ston par byed pa ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang dam pa'i chos spong bar byed pa'i sdig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sdig pa'i grogs po'o //
analyzed: med pa la sogs pa ston par byed pa ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang dam pa'i chos spong bar byed pa'i sdig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sdig pa'i grogs po'o //
translated: then the teaching of non-production, etc. is the cause of evil, the result of which is hell, etc., and the abandonment of the holy Dharma.

original: de'i lag tu song bar gyur ba ni gzung ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i lag tu song bar gyur ba ni gzung ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Falling into their hands” means “falling into their grasp.”

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas rdzogs pa'i don rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas brjod na shin tu bstan par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu song bar gyur na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas rdzogs pa'i don rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas brjod na shin tu bstan par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu song bar gyur na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one falls into the hands of spiritual friends, then the teaching of the ultimate is very clear, since it is expressed by way of implication, after the conventional has been refuted.

original: sems ma zhum zhing mi skrag pa la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sa bdag gi rgyal po'i btsun mo sdug ba shi ba brda'i sprod pa'i tshul du rim gyis dngos po ma lus pa bdag med pa la sogs pa ston
analyzed: sems ma zhum zhing mi skrag pa la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sa bdag gi rgyal po'i btsun mo sdug ba shi ba brda'i sprod pa'i tshul du rim gyis dngos po ma lus pa bdag med pa la sogs pa ston
translated: The spiritual master is one who, by skillful means such as not discouraging or frightening the disciple, gradually teaches the disciple, in accordance with the disciple's thoughts, the non-substantiality of all things, etc., in the manner of a king's queen who loves her husband and who, when the king dies, gradually teaches the king's son, by means of symbols, to be free from all attachment to the objects of desire.

original: par byed pa ser sna la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba ni bde 'gro la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: par byed pa ser sna la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba ni bde 'gro la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: The spiritual master is one who causes one to obtain the result of happy rebirth, etc., by being free from the dharmas of miserliness, etc.

original: de'i lag tu song bar gyur pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i lag tu song bar gyur pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One who has come into the hands of such a spiritual master is as described above.

original: gang de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang zag gang lha sbyin la sogs pa'i gang zag de dag la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' ba'i tshul du phan pa
analyzed: gang de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang zag gang lha sbyin la sogs pa'i gang zag de dag la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' ba'i tshul du phan pa
translated: As to those who are in the hands of such spiritual masters, etc., those persons, such as Devadatta, are in the hands of spiritual masters who, by means of the perfections such as generosity, cause them not to transgress the conventional and ultimate truths, and who, by means of the skillful means of the perfections such as generosity, cause them to obtain the result of happy rebirth, etc.

original: thob par bya ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du rjes su ston cing 'doms pa rnams dang / yang gang zhig lha sbyin la sogs pa la de dag la phan pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i phyir bdud kyi las rnams ston pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du rjes su ston cing 'doms pa rnams dang / yang gang zhig lha sbyin la sogs pa la de dag la phan pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i phyir bdud kyi las rnams ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, some, in order to turn away from what is not beneficial for Devadatta and so on, reveal the deeds of Mara.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: bdud kyi nyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdud kyi nyes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “The faults of Mara are like this…”

original: bdud kyi nyes pa ni 'di lta bur rig par bya zhes pa ni bdud par chod bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi cha lugs su 'ongs nas khyed la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis ci zhig bya zhes ma 'ongs pa'i don dang
analyzed: bdud kyi nyes pa ni 'di lta bur rig par bya zhes pa ni bdud par chod bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi cha lugs su 'ongs nas khyed la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis ci zhig bya zhes ma 'ongs pa'i don dang
translated: “The faults of Mara are to be known as follows” means that in order to create obstacles, having come in the guise of a Buddha, “What is the use of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment for you?”

original: 'byed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byed par byed pa'o //
translated: They create divisions.

original: bdud kyi nyes pa ni 'di dag yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du khyod la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri ba la sogs pa nyams su len pas ci zhig bya zhes da ltar byung ba'i don dang 'byed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi nyes pa ni 'di dag yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du khyod la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dri ba la sogs pa nyams su len pas ci zhig bya zhes da ltar byung ba'i don dang 'byed par byed pa'o //
translated: by asking you about it?

original: des phye ba'i stobs kyis go rims bzhin du bdag gis byas pa dang spangs pa'i las bstan pa'i @46a * //
analyzed: des phye ba'i stobs kyis go rims bzhin du bdag gis byas pa dang spangs pa'i las bstan pa'i @46a * //
translated: By the power of that division, he teaches the karma that is done and abandoned, respectively.

original: phyir bdud kyi las ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: phyir bdud kyi las ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, The karma of Mara is just this, etc.

original: shes nas gang zhig bya ba de ni 'di dag rtogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes nas gang zhig bya ba de ni 'di dag rtogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having understood, one should do what is to be done. This is Having understood these, etc.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The summary is Subhuti, this, etc.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The great armor is the practice of the armor explained below.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin du 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin du 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who has entered into the Great Vehicle is one who is endowed with the practice of entering into it in that way.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de nyid la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de nyid la brtson pa'o //
translated: One who abides in the Great Vehicle is one who is intent upon that very Great Vehicle.

original: de ltar na dang po der zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po der zhugs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, at first one enters into it,

original: phyis ni gnas par 'dod do ;
analyzed: phyis ni gnas par 'dod do ;
translated: and later one abides in it.

original: ; de skad du yang /
analyzed: ; de skad du yang /
translated: It is said:

original: sems mi 'gong pa nyid la sogs //
analyzed: sems mi 'gong pa nyid la sogs //
translated: The absence of mental lassitude, etc.,

original: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed //🔽de yi mi mthun phyogs por ba //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed // de yi mi mthun phyogs por ba //
translated: is the teaching of the lack of own-being, etc.

original: rnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin //
translated: It is the complete acceptance of the latter in all its aspects,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: since it is the rejection of their adverse elements.🔽The Sutra is to be explained by following other Sutras.

original: mdo sde ni mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nyid kyis stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa dang // sngon gyi slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas bshad pa'i rim pa la brten cing /
analyzed: mdo sde ni mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nyid kyis stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa dang // sngon gyi slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas bshad pa'i rim pa la brten cing /
translated: The Lord himself has said that the Twenty-five Thousand is to be followed, and the system of explanation of the former masters such as Vasubandhu is to be relied upon.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa dang yang bstun nas dgongs pa can dang khong nas da byung pa la sogs pa'i tshig byas nas bshad pa dang / de bzhin du thun mong gi sgra yang skabs la sogs pa'i stobs kyis khyad par la 'jug pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa dang yang bstun nas dgongs pa can dang khong nas da byung pa la sogs pa'i tshig byas nas bshad pa dang / de bzhin du thun mong gi sgra yang skabs la sogs pa'i stobs kyis khyad par la 'jug pa'i phyir dang /
