translated: And it is in accordance with the Ornament of Clear Realization that he explains the words of the text, taking them as having an ulterior intention, as having a double entendre, and so on.🔽And in the same way, the common words are also used in a special sense, by the power of the context and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang nyid kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i don gsung rab dang mi 'gal ba la sgra 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de dgag pa'i tshig med pa'i phyir bshad pa 'di ni gzhung dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang nyid kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i don gsung rab dang mi 'gal ba la sgra 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de dgag pa'i tshig med pa'i phyir bshad pa 'di ni gzhung dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: And because the words are used in accordance with the meaning explained, which is not contradicted by the scriptures, and because there are no words that contradict the meaning, this explanation is in accordance with the text.

original: de bas na gzhung dang mi mthun pa kho nang ji ltar bshad ces brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhung dang mi mthun pa kho nang ji ltar bshad ces brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not investigate, saying, “This is not in accordance with the text.”

original: gzhan du na gal te tshul 'di la ma brten na de'i tshe gsung rab kyi bshad pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te tshul 'di la ma brten na de'i tshe gsung rab kyi bshad pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if one does not rely on this method, then it is not an explanation of the scriptures.

original: sgra ni brda las byung pa nyid kyis don du ma la 'jug pas so sor nges pa'i don yongs su 'dzin na som nyir 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni brda las byung pa nyid kyis don du ma la 'jug pas so sor nges pa'i don yongs su 'dzin na som nyir 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is uncertain, because it is applied to many meanings by the mere occurrence of a sign.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni 'phags pa thogs med la sogs pa rnams kyis bshad pa bris pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni 'phags pa thogs med la sogs pa rnams kyis bshad pa bris pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this should be accepted as authoritative because it is a written explanation by the noble Asanga and others.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: And this is what he says:

original: 'phags pa thogs med gsung rab ma lus pa'i don thugs su chud cing rtogs pa thob pa yin du zin kyang zlos te @46b gsung mang ba dang / zlos te gsungs pa yin pa'i phyogs la yang tshig so so'i rnam par bcad pa ma gzigs pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med gsung rab ma lus pa'i don thugs su chud cing rtogs pa thob pa yin du zin kyang zlos te @46b gsung mang ba dang / zlos te gsungs pa yin pa'i phyogs la yang tshig so so'i rnam par bcad pa ma gzigs pa dang /
translated: Even though the noble Asanga had understood and attained realization of the meaning of the entire Exalted Word, he still repeated himself, and in the position of repeating himself, he did not see the individual terminations of the words.

original: zab pa nyid kyis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dpogs par ma dpyod nas yid mi bde ba rjes su thob par gyur to //
analyzed: zab pa nyid kyis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dpogs par ma dpyod nas yid mi bde ba rjes su thob par gyur to //
translated: And because of its profundity, he did not analyze the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, and he attained mental dissatisfaction.

original: de nas de'i don du bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa byams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo bshad pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas de'i don du bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa byams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo bshad pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa mdzad do //
translated: Then, for that purpose, the Bhagavat, the noble Maitreya, composed the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras and the Abhisamayālaṅkāra verses.

original: de gsan nas slob dpon 'phags pa thogs med dang dbyig gnyen la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang bshad pa yin no zhes rjes su thos te /
analyzed: de gsan nas slob dpon 'phags pa thogs med dang dbyig gnyen la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang bshad pa yin no zhes rjes su thos te /
translated: Having heard that, the masters Ārya Asaṅga, Vasubandhu, and so on also composed commentaries.

original: zhar la 'ongs bas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs bas chog go //
translated: Enough with this digression.

original: sgrub pa dang ldan pa la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ji skad du bshad pa dang mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang 'byung bas /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang ldan pa la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ji skad du bshad pa dang mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang 'byung bas /
translated: Since those endowed with practice definitely give rise to the other paths such as the path of seeing, which were explained as the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i de ma thag tu gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i de ma thag tu gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the nature of the dharmadhātu that immediately follows the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavat said, “Thus have I heard” and so on.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what was said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gang yang mdo sde gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes gsungs ba de la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gang yang mdo sde gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes gsungs ba de la /
translated: The Bhagavān has said, “These are the bodhisattva mahāsattvas,” and so on, and also in other sūtras, “bodhisattva mahāsattva.”

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin na tshig snga ma dang mdo sde gzhan dag gi byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i gzhi'i don gang yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin na tshig snga ma dang mdo sde gzhan dag gi byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i gzhi'i don gang yin te /
translated: If it is the nature of the dharmadhātu, what is the meaning of the basis of the bodhisattva in the previous statement and in other sūtras?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi gzhi'i don gang yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi gzhi'i don gang yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: What is the meaning of the basis of the buddhadharmas?”

original: lan bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the answer, he said, “Subhūti,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi gzhi'i don byang chub sems dpa'i gang yin pa de ni de kho na nyid du na gzhi'i don med pa'i gnas kyi don med pa yin pas te /

translated: The meaning of the basis of the bodhisattva, which is the basis of the buddhadharmas, is ultimately the meaning of the basis that is not a basis,

original: rigs med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: “All phenomena are without attachment” means that since realization elsewhere is not tenable,

analyzed: chos thams cad la gzhi dang de'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa med pas chags pa med par gyur pa na sangs rgyas kyi chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar slob pa de'i phyir de kho na nyid du na rten gyi don yod
translated: all phenomena are without attachment because there is no clinging to a basis and its signs. When that is the case, in order to realize the qualities of a buddha, one trains like an illusory person. Therefore, in reality, how could there be a basis for the name “bodhisattva”?

analyzed: par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //

translated: Moreover, conventionally, the nature of the dharma-dhātu is the basis of the qualities of a buddha, because of the differences in the states of the phenomena that are accomplished. It is explained that the lineage is in the thirteen types of bodhisattvas.

original: // de la re zhig dang por 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rten yin no //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi'o //
translated: After that, it is the support for the supramundane path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pa'i stobs kyis rkun po phyung ba dang sgo 'phar bcad pa dang 'dra par dus mnyam du gnyen po mtha' dag skye pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gag pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pa'i stobs kyis rkun po phyung ba dang sgo 'phar bcad pa dang 'dra par dus mnyam du gnyen po mtha' dag skye pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gag pa dag gis so //
translated: After that, it is the support for the arising of the antidotes and the cessation of the discordant class, which occur simultaneously through the power of their arising, like thieves being expelled and a door being shut.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag mi dmigs pas mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs gnyis 'gog pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa yin no //

translated: Then, by not apprehending them, he abandons the discursive thought that is associated with the cessation and origination of the two sides, that is, of the adverse and the counteragent.🔽Then, by the power of his previous aspirational prayers and of his skill in liberative art, such as generosity, he has the wisdom and the liberative art that do not dwell in either the cycle of existence or in the frozenness of individual liberation.🔽Then, by the power of those, he has the qualities that are not held in common with the disciples and solitary sages.🔽Then, by the power of his knowledge of the creative processes of the spiritual life, he has the qualities that are not held in common with the bodhisattvas of the stage of action in faith.

original: de'i 'og tu sngon gyi smon lam dang sbyin pa la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab dang thabs dag gi yin no //
